story:
It's time to claim your "Green Mile"

Our mission is to mobilize like-minded people across the country (and the world) to claim their "Green Mile" and to participate in picking up trash and debris on a weekly basis to keep our communities clean.


My name is Brian Lindholm and my idea originated when visiting my brother recently in Ohio. Every Sunday he would set out with a trash bag in hand to clean up the immediate area in his neighborhood. He said he was "walkin the mile" in quoting a line from his favorite movie "The Green Mile".

When I returned home I implemented the idea in our neighborhood and began to think of ways to spread the message across the country.

Although the idea is simple and effective, I felt that being part of a community and being able to visualize our impact on a map will motivate our founding members to share this concept and keep everyone engaged and committed to following through.

Whether of not you decide to help us financially you can still participate and "Claim Your Mile" and commit to keeping your neighborhood clean. Click here join our movement. Simply press the (+) sign on upper right of map to add your icon.



Our mission is to make this campaign viral and to cover our map with volunteers eager to make a positive change to our environment.

Here is the plan

To keep this short and concise, your micro commitment to add your name to our map and donate a small amount will raise awareness to our cause.

Your contributions will go towards promoting our cause through paid social media advertising and eventually print media advertising such as USA Today.

We really would like to make this a national initiative with local organization and action groups throughout the country. Only with your help and donations can we make that possible.

The benefits of your participation will include a cleaner environment and the satisfaction that you are doing your small part to improve the world.



Please >>>>> Show-U-Care

Your first step is to "Claim Your Green Mile" here

Click on the (+) sign on the upper right corner of the map and insert your details.  Simply navigate  on the map to your area, choose your level of participation and click submit.

Step two is to decide if our cause has sparked your interest enough to contribute financially. Any funding will be used to raise awareness for our project.

Step Three is to share our message via social media and follow through on your commitment to keep your "Green Mile" clean. Please like our Facebook Fan page while visiting our website and look for improvements and updates regarding our campaign. 

Our intentions is to promote and organize "Project Pick-up" in the spring of 2015  in conjunction with Earth Day.

 Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools to improve our chances to reaching our financial goals for our project.

story:
The Project

NE Georgia Earthship is an independent project to create an off-grid sustainable home that can be built in any urban environment. This home will be powered by the sun and collect its water from the rain, obtaining all of its resources from nature rather than relying on city municipal services.  In this way we can work in harmony with the sun and sky, allowing the planet to sustain us while also giving it the respect that is deserves through low impact, efficient systems that reduce waste and consume less resources. 

We began building one year ago and now that we have completed the outer structure we are preparing to continue with the main systems inside. This campaign is to raise the funds for the solar hot water heater system. Those interested in seeing our vision happen FASTER can help through contributions towards this particular system, bringing us closer to the completion of this revolutionary project in sustainable living. Once this house is built, we will have a model home that can be built anywhere for others interested in becoming self-sufficient and owning one of their own.  

Like the original Earthships, our home will implement the use of thermal mass, solar power panels, gray water botanical cells (for reuse and redirection of waste water), solar hot water panels, waste reduction through reuse of glass bottles as bricks in windows and cooling tubes as natural air conditioning. The only difference, between our model and the original Earthships, is that our foundation has been built with concrete, rather than rammed earth tires, which is a key factor in being able to pass building codes in urban areas. We believe that the world will benefit greatly from easier access to these self-reliant homes.

Who Are We?

Andrew Hickman and myself, Rosemary Kimble, are two people that care greatly about the well-being of the planet and living healthy, sustainable lives. We began the project after discovering Earthships through a documentary. Andrew was later invited to intern with Earthship Biotechture in New Mexico and again on a build in Georgia. Through his previous background in building and an enormous amount of research, he has given special attention to previously used techniques to build an Earthship model that focuses on maximum efficiency and durability.  

What does NE Georgia Earthship need?

100% of the money raised will go to complete the solar hot water heater system of our Earthship.  We will need about $4,000 to pay for all of the materials and cost of installation. Any additional funding we receive beyond our goal will go directly to completing the build of the Earthship.

The Impact

It is our goal to use this model home to help change the way homes are built today, giving an option of building for sustainability and reducing the waste created by traditional homes. While this home will be powered by the sun as well as collect all of its water from the rain, its progressive design will also make it more accessible to the average urban citizen. Your contribution gets us even closer to making this way of living a reality for many more people. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that sometimes funding just is not an option but you can help us out in other ways: MAKE SOME NOISE! Help us spread the word. Share our campaign on facebook, twitter, email, tumblr, blogs, reddit, any other social media, with a good old fashioned phone call, and in real life conversations!

SPECIAL THANKS TO Adam Forrester for this terrific video promo!

story:
Who are we?

We are ECOMARES Foundation, a non-governmental organization based in Cali, Colombia. We live in a country with about 50% of its territory covering marine and coastal areas, including oceanic islands, on both the Caribbean and the Pacific. Our mission is to contribute through scientific knowledge and concrete actions to the conservation and sustainable use of coastal and marine ecosystems. Our work encompasses different ecosystems and geographic locations in Colombia and we currently have a research project focused on artisanal fishing on the Pacific coast (www.ecomares.org).

 

What do we want to do?

Through a short-documentary production (10 to 12 min), we intend to raise awareness among government authorities and society in general about the importance of artisanal fishing for coastal communities in the Colombian Pacific and about the problems faced by artisanal fishermen on a daily basis. Through this communication product we expect to trigger support and actions that will:

  • stimulate greater economic investment in the Pacific coastal region, to improve livelihoods for fishing communities;
  • promote the creation of a participatory program to identify and construct solutions for a sustainable future of artisanal fishing communities.

 

What do we need?

We need to raise a minimum of $3,500 USD. This will help us pay for a director of photography, a film director and a researcher to visit the coastal communities, capture inspiring footage, talk to the locals and produce and edit a compelling short video. 

But this is just the first step toward helping these underrepresented communities. With your support, if we can raise more we can do more!

To accomplish our goal, we will partner with the team at Visual Garden, local film producers who have experience in this kind of projects and are willing to contribute their staff and equipment as match to successfully make this project a reality (www.visualgarden.tv, www.hernanherron.com).

 

Where?

The Colombian Pacific coast extends for 1,480 kilometres. It is characterized by stunning landscapes of tropical rain forests, mangroves, rocky cliffs, coral reefs, and sandy beaches. The entire region is one of the richest biodiversity "hot spots" in the world. Our specific shooting locations are one hour away from Buenaventura, the largest commercial port in the country.

 

Why is artisanal fishing so important?

Along the Pacific coast of Colombia, more than 11,000 families of Afro-descendant communities directly depend on artisanal fisheries for their nutrition, income and employment. The production of artisanal fisheries in this region exceeds 5,000 tonnes per year, includes more than 400 species and adds up to at least 15% of total catches from this coast, contributing to the supply of seafood in other parts of the country.

Despite the importance of artisanal fisheries for the Pacific region and for Colombia, relatively little is known about the current condition of main fisheries stocks, seasonal or spatial catch variations, differences among fishing gears on their catch and profitability, as well as other aspects that are relevant for the livelihoods of artisanal fishermen. Currently ECOMARES Foundation is developing a research project that aims to contribute to these knowledge gaps (www.ecomares.org)

 

    Risks and challenges

    Filming with the humid and rainy environmental conditions of the Colombian Pacific coast is always challenging. We are preparing for this with adequate water-proof equipment and planning the filming time at each community so that we have the necessary time to get the footage needed.

    In terms of potential social conflicts, our fisheries researcher at ECOMARES Foundation has established good relationships with community leaders and most of the fishers that live at each of the coastal communities. Visit and filming times will be coordinated with local leaders and taking into account fishers’ activities and preferences.

    Note that in case we do not reach the funding goal, raised funds will be dedicated to buy materials to repair and improve fishing gears for local fishers (e.g.: nets, rope, hooks, buoys).

    Other ways you can help us

    In case you consider our idea worth supporting but you do not have all the funds you would like to contribute, you can help us a lot by spreading the word out using the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
Introduction: Cleantec - Cleantecsystems.com @Cleantecsystems

Cleantec is a prototyping and development company based out of Colorado Springs, Colorado.  Started and run by inventor, scientist, and entrepreneur Michael Ring 3 years ago with a specific mission to invent, design and develop energy generation and management systems that must be unique, creative, cost-effective, innovative but most of all disruptive. Using these guidelines, Cleantec and its staff have committed to stand up and address the energy and environmental problems that if left unsolved will lead to major problems for our modern civilization. In order to succeed in completing this very large goal, an entirely new way of thinking will be needed. Luckily for us, that is exactly what we have. This is something that we will prove in time.

Short story as to why we have decided to  crowdfund.

What began with a few good ideas, a few people and inventions quickly transformed into a prototyping and product development company known as Cleantec. That company has since grown into a remarkably large network of people, other companies and organizations that completely support what we do, share our viewpoints and passions, and that have aided us and will continue to aid us in developing our projects. But “build it and they will come” doesn’t necessarily apply to investors and people with financing capabilities, which is exactly where our problem is located.

In an attempt to develop our projects; we have unsuccessfully canvassed Colorado Springs and bits and pieces of Denver looking for the right person to come in and provide the financial assistance we need to move forward. What we found is that people with money ( The 1% big money) have a severe deprivation in imagination. If it hasn’t been done before, if it’s not a real-estate or a software company, the upper-class in Colorado are simply not interested. At all. Now this might not be the case with all wealthy people but there certainly seems to be a very strong correlation between high account balances and low imaginations. But that is just our experience and most likely just luck of the draw. We also got a whole lot of “we admire your passion and technology but this just doesn’t fit our portfolio” too.  Regrettably this put us at a standstill because without any money whatsoever it turns out to be very difficult to build the products we have designed, or anything at all for that matter.

After all that nonsense and runaround we have decided to crowdfund our secondary product-line CleantecWind with the hope that people with some imagination will see the extraordinary potential and help us do something positive for the community and the world.. A kickstart is exactly what this company needs. One good kick, and she'll fire right up and be able to grow exponentially and hopefully never need venture capital or outside money ever again. So with that, we would like to introduce you to CleantecWind.

CleanTecWind

Wind for the WIn!!

Wind is one of the most under-harvested and under-utilized resource on this planet. This mostly due to the fact that there really is only one commercially available and practical solution to use it, and that is the windmills. Windmills are very expensive, hard to install, require additional equipment for interfacing with the grid, require land, and must be very large in order to be useful.  We have made some pretty great strides over the last few years in wind power, but we think more options are needed.

CleantecWind is here to change that and solve the problem by offering  new solutions and new additions to your wind power options. We have taken a different approach, rather than large windmills, how about small ones, in large quantities. Chickens compared to elephants.

What are we going to produce?

Two, highly advanced, self contained, variable-mounting, variable-orientation wind turbines.

32" Turbine - "The Burst SI"
The 10' "The Gust SI" turbine shown above in peak wind produces 2X the amount of power the solar panels shown produce

Originally it was designed to attach to and upgrade existing solar panels configured in fields making it the first system to make solar panels useful at night. However, after it was designed, we realized that it didn’t just have to go on solar panels. We saw that a small and efficient wind system like this could be useful in about a dozen other places including streetlights and oil pipelines. Both of which we are really excited about and will talk more about below.

One important thing - The blades on each turbine are twisted and are not perfectly straight as the images suggest. This twist allows for a corkscrew effect of catching the wind at many more angles than just head on.

Where are we now?

Presently, Cleantec, its products and staff are at a standstill. We have the final designs, the supply lines, the people and the plan all established for the wind turbine. We know exactly where to get the parts, how to assemble them, and what needs to be tested. We know what it needs to look like, how much it should weigh, what it needs to produce to be useful, how to produce that power efficiently and smoothly, and most of all, how to have the price point that is needed for wide-scale adoption and use. The only thing it is missing is the money to produce it, and place the order for the parts. With your help, this turbine can become a reality and begin to contribute to our energy production problems in this country. It needs you. We need you.

Where does it go?

This turbine can go many places. We have 3 directions we will run with it, which really encompass a great deal of targets. We are confident that we will find even more places for it moving forward.

Solar panel fields - Upgrading their purpose and giving them a new job 24/7

Solar panel arrays and fields are becoming have become very common in our global push for a more sustainable infrastructure. A great deal of money has been invested into solar fields across the country and world. However that investment has a limit in usefulness. As it is now, solar power has reached a slight plateau. The solar power production methods in use today have inherit limits in efficiency, grid utilization, overall effectiveness, and of course, the night time power production limit. So we designed a product to increase the usefulness of the existing investment and bypass the limits we all have in solar power by adding wind to the current setup. Once installed they will require very little additional hardware or investment from the owner of the field and will provide substantial power production increases. SUBSTANTIAL INCREASE. It really is a big win-win

  • The turbines can be mounted on the top edge of the solar panels with cross supports attached to grounding structures.
  • Power produced from the turbines can be tied directly to the panel array output connections and grid tie faculties.
  • Potential installation targets: There are over 83 separate large solar (photovoltaic) fields power plants with over 10,000 panels per installation. Some of which have over 900,000 panels. All of which are useless at night. This product absolutely belongs here.
4 of ? Solar fields - No image credit taken

Streetlights and Light Poles - Because it makes sense

Using the same turbines, and merely changing the mounts, we can use streetlights and light poles as a base structure for our turbines. This gives us the option to tie to the the grid at each light and assist the light in its duties. Presently, the power grid is not quite capable of effectively handling an intermittent power source like the wind yet, so initially the power produced by these turbines will be directed towards assisting the lamp only. Eventually, the smart-grid will be fully developed, and when that happens, the power produced by these units will become even more useful in providing power to the grid at every light.

  • Potential local installations in Cosprings 20,000
  • Potential statewide Installations 10^ 5
  • Potential national installations 10^ 7

    .

And get this, if we were able to put turbines on most of Denver's,  Colorado Springs, and Pueblo's streetlights , congratulations Colorado, you just built the power production capability of a medium nuclear reactor, for like 1/16th the cost. Cool right?

We'll add one more calculation for the mathematically inclined and big picture thinkers just for fun.

There are an estimated 26 Million streetlights in the United States, Let's pretend like somewhere, a good decision was made, and these turbines were put on half of them. 13 Million lights that now each produce 4000 Watts of power, giving us 52GW's of electricity, yes, Gigawatts of power production, for life, across the United States or = roughly 1/8th the power of the whole United States. For an investment of roughly $31 Billion dollars, plus shipping.  Now that might seem like a high price-tag for most of us but to achieve 52GW's by conventional means, would create more zeros than we think we could type.   So yes Mr. President, to answer your call for action towards sustainability, we present to you a solution, and yes, we take Visa. ;-)

Fences, Medians, and Pipelines -1 mile of installations= 1MW power production for  $633,600 ( 1MW could cost well over 2 million dollars for just solar panels alone not including grid interface equipment). We understand that that number is high for most of us, but for states that are looking into alternative energy, that number is very attractive compared to other solutions out there today.

Pipeline Example

Roof-lines -  This also just makes sense. Since the turbines can be mounted in any orientation and still catch the wind without requiring a pole mount structure, the location options for installing wind power have gone up substantially. Skyscrapers shown below are a candidate for wind power now. Better yet, now every gas station, Mcdonalds, Starbucks and Walmart's etc can now have wind power added to them.... Cost effectively. 

Let's do a few more examples to put this into perspective:

There are 4663 Walmarts in the United States today. Let's say that each one of them, purchased 50 of the Cleantec turbines with the roof-line mounting option that each produce 2000 Watts each. If that happened, Walmart as a company would collectively produce 466.3MW (megawatts) of power, for a price-tag of $280 million dollars. Dramatically more affordable.

For comparison, the Topaz Solar Farm in California, produces about 550 MW (megawatts) and cost roughly $2 Billion to complete after install.

12 for each of the 14,000 McDonalds in the United States is 336 MW (Megawatts)

10 for each of the 11,168 Starbucks in the United States = 223.4MW and so on and so fourth.

They add up substantially

New York and Chicago, this one is for you :-)

About the Turbine

The 10' "The Gust SI" Turbine

The turbine featured in the video and in some of the images is just a prototype. It was built with parts that we could afford with the objective to showcase the design and overall form factor. With a successful kickstart, we will be able to deliver a final product.

The final product will be much much cooler, and significantly more advanced.

Not shown changes to the design are as follows:

  • Twisted composite blades - Providing a corkscrew effect to catch the wind at different angles while maintaining strength
  • MagDrive rotors - Building a few high powered magnets into the rotor and a few on the armature will increase the performance of the turbines and decrease the overall start speed
  • Output indicators - Cleanly lighted end-caps that go blue when the turbine is producing power, and red for about 15-20 seconds when it is not. Giving it a really cool night time appearance
  • Aluminum construction - Making the whole turbine light-weight
  • AC pass-through and grid-tie - Providing stable voltage, series linking and the ability to plug into almost any electrical outlet in homes or businesses to grid-tie. Just plug it in with an extension cord and it is done
  • High-speed Bearings- Very cost effective and abundant, offering minimal drag
  • Standardized Mount Fittings - providing different and swappable mounts for the same turbine.

.

With all these features we have calculated that the start speed should be around 8 mph and peak power production at 16 mph and above.

Tech Stuff

Each (10’) AC turbine's power production is internally regulated and capped at 2000W. Each have built-in micro-inverters, regulators, and  storage bank to ensure stable, clean, reliable, manageable and predictable power production output that is sufficient for grid use in all wind conditions.

Each turbine outputs at a constant frequency and rate thanks to the built-in storage bank. When the wind has stopped, the output continues normally until the bank has been depleted past 30% and output is ceased. There is no gradual voltage or current drop.

For obvious reasons we will not be disclosing in full the internal components of this design at this point in time. For two reasons: One, it isn't finished yet and we many improvements that need to made that we will be able to do when we are able to move forward again. Two, If you would like to know how they work, you will just have to buy one and take it apart. Sorry, it's just good business.

2 Initial Versions - 4 Future

  • The Burst - 32” Mini Turbine– Peak Wind Power production 500W AC  60Hz - Direct grid-tie
  • The Gust - 10’ Turbine – Peak Power Production 2000W AC 60Hz- Direct grid-tie

.

Initially there will be 3 mounting options available:

  • The flat surface (roof) mount.
  • The C-Clamp style mount.
  • The Pipe mount (basically giant high-end hose clamps)
  • For solar panel array mount possibilities please contact us directly.

.

Why is it better?

To further support why this design is advantageous over conventional wind products, we have a short list that we hope will convince you to see the potential.

It will be sickeningly cheaper

The costs to produce these units will drop significantly as we move forward. Making it possible for these units to be as abundant and affordable as vacuum cleaners. And when you factor in the removal of the large installation and hardware costs associated with conventional windmills the cost analysis is highly favorable and the economics are very encouraging.

A quick Google search for a 30Kw wind system returns a price of over $30,000, not including installation and other hardware related costs. To get to 30Kw with these turbines it takes 15 units for $18,000... basically installed.

And large orders will get special pricing once we are able to drive the costs down.

Infinitely linkable

Each turbine has an output port of 120v AC and an AC input port. This makes them linkable (think Christmas lights), making it the first modular wind system of its kind. Imagine an oil pipeline (shown above) with wind turbines all the way down it powering the equipment and nearby towns in a good wind. Or imagine highway medians and dividers using some of the wind from traffic to help out a bit. 

It's easier to build

  • It can be made right here in the USA, by American workers and Veterans
  • Large quantity production designed
  • Componentized assembly
  • Abundant and commercially available parts and components
  • Local suppliers and national suppliers established

Smaller

  • Less invasive and disruptive
  • Easy to install
  • Lightweight
  • Shippable

Many more applications than just solar panels

Several have been mentioned above: oil pipelines, fences, highway medians (when safe obviously) but we believe this is just the beginning of a long list. The idea of roof-lines, not just home roof lines, but large buildings and skyscrapers or even gas station islands is also pretty cool. As these units become produced in large quantities, we hope they find their way to everyplace possible.

What do we plan to do from here?

Bring it to reality and finish what we have started. As we said in the very beginning, we made a commitment. We will press-on and keep moving forward. Continuing to work and rework our methods and pursue all options until we have succeeded. If this campaign is successful what we plan to do is:

  • Re-engage operations of Cleantec, its facilities, staff, and plan
  • Call upon the suppliers that we have established and begin the assembly of the initial units
  • Test the units, and select the final assembly based on results
  • Engage operation CleantecWind, which encompasses the order system, sales team and strategy, and rapid production
  • Fulfill perks of the campaign
  • In six months time have the final units production methods and assembly methods perfected with large quantities available for sale
  • Manufacture first few thousand here locally in Colorado Springs using local suppliers and staff and either scale up productions to a bigger facility or outsource main component production to meet demand and/or licensing agreement with a large company as needed
  • Maintain namespace and brand image at all times to aid in the success of future product lines

What else do you need to know

  • We have a team of people ready to go to bring this turbine to life. 20 unique and motivated people that are apart of Cleantec. Ready to rock 
  • Mounting these turbines onto solar arrays requires a support and a vibration dampening mechanism that we have yet fully establish precise specs for due to the fact that there are many different types of solar mounting systems and the product is not quite ready. It is our plan to generate a few different options moving forward in the coming stages when we are able to proceed.
  • We wont be alone. We will leverage the entirely of our network of partners to move this project forward, which includes state and local government, some federal government connections, local contractors, local suppliers, and a ton more people and companies that share the vision of this product and have offered to help us bring it to life.
  • We have additional wind solutions that we will deliver in time, so help us now, and we will get there together
  • The reason the website is locked is because we have more to show but it is all not quite ready. One thing at a time. 
  • This is only the beginning for Cleantec. Strap in world, you're about be rocked.

If you need more information, you can watch this video

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fTQAz43J8U4

 

What’s in it for you? Why donate?

  • Support sustainable energy for this planet.
  • Help upgrade all those solar panel fields, streetlights, and roofs in the world to be more useful.
  • Help clean up the environment and reduce global warming.
  • Help a talented group of inventors get a good start.
  • Create some jobs for good people in Colorado Springs
  • Help change the way people think about renewable energy innovation.
  • Help us show the people that there is more than one way to think about solving our problems, and that sometimes good things can come in ways they wouldn't expect.
  • Help something new and positive happen.
  • Help change and solve the problems that we all face.
  • Be a force for good.
story_txt:
Introduction: Cleantec - Cleantecsystems.com @Cleantecsystems
Cleantec is a prototyping and development company based out of Colorado Springs, Colorado.  Started and run by inventor, scientist, and entrepreneur Michael Ring 3 years ago with a specific mission to invent, design and develop energy generation and management systems that must be unique, creative, cost-effective, innovative but most of all disruptive. Using these guidelines, Cleantec and its staff have committed to stand up and address the energy and environmental problems that if left unsolved will lead to major problems for our modern civilization. In order to succeed in completing this very large goal, an entirely new way of thinking will be needed. Luckily for us, that is exactly what we have. This is something that we will prove in time. 
Short story as to why we have decided to  crowdfund. 
What began with a few good ideas, a few people and inventions quickly transformed into a prototyping and product development company known as Cleantec. That company has since grown into a remarkably large network of people, other companies and organizations that completely support what we do, share our viewpoints and passions, and that have aided us and will continue to aid us in developing our projects. But “build it and they will come” doesn’t necessarily apply to investors and people with financing capabilities, which is exactly where our problem is located. In an attempt to develop our projects; we have unsuccessfully canvassed Colorado Springs and bits and pieces of Denver looking for the right person to come in and provide the financial assistance we need to move forward. What we found is that people with money ( The 1% big money) have a severe deprivation in imagination. If it hasn’t been done before, if it’s not a real-estate or a software company, the upper-class in Colorado are simply not interested. At all. Now this might not be the case with all wealthy people but there certainly seems to be a very strong correlation between high account balances and low imaginations. But that is just our experience and most likely just luck of the draw. We also got a whole lot of “we admire your passion and technology but this just doesn’t fit our portfolio” too.  Regrettably this put us at a standstill because without any money whatsoever it turns out to be very difficult to build the products we have designed, or anything at all for that matter. 
 After all that nonsense and runaround we have decided to crowdfund our secondary product-line CleantecWind with the hope that people with some imagination will see the extraordinary potential and help us do something positive for the community and the world.. A kickstart is exactly what this company needs. One good kick, and she'll fire right up and be able to grow exponentially and hopefully never need venture capital or outside money ever again. So with that, we would like to introduce you to CleantecWind.
CleanTecWind 
Wind for the WIn!! 
Wind is one of the most under-harvested and under-utilized resource on this planet. This mostly due to the fact that there really is only one commercially available and practical solution to use it, and that is the windmills. Windmills are very expensive, hard to install, require additional equipment for interfacing with the grid, require land, and must be very large in order to be useful.  We have made some pretty great strides over the last few years in wind power, but we think more options are needed.
CleantecWind is here to change that and solve the problem by offering  new solutions and new additions to your wind power options. We have taken a different approach, rather than large windmills, how about small ones, in large quantities. Chickens compared to elephants.
What are we going to produce?
Two, highly advanced, self contained, variable-mounting, variable-orientation wind turbines.

32" Turbine - "The Burst SI"

The 10' "The Gust SI" turbine shown above in peak wind produces 2X the amount of power the solar panels shown produce
Originally it was designed to attach to and upgrade existing solar panels configured in fields making it the first system to make solar panels useful at night. However, after it was designed, we realized that it didn’t just have to go on solar panels. We saw that a small and efficient wind system like this could be useful in about a dozen other places including streetlights and oil pipelines. Both of which we are really excited about and will talk more about below. 
One important thing - The blades on each turbine are twisted and are not perfectly straight as the images suggest. This twist allows for a corkscrew effect of catching the wind at many more angles than just head on. 
Where are we now?
Presently, Cleantec, its products and staff are at a standstill. We have the final designs, the supply lines, the people and the plan all established for the wind turbine. We know exactly where to get the parts, how to assemble them, and what needs to be tested. We know what it needs to look like, how much it should weigh, what it needs to produce to be useful, how to produce that power efficiently and smoothly, and most of all, how to have the price point that is needed for wide-scale adoption and use. The only thing it is missing is the money to produce it, and place the order for the parts. With your help, this turbine can become a reality and begin to contribute to our energy production problems in this country. It needs you. We need you.
Where does it go? 
This turbine can go many places. We have 3 directions we will run with it, which really encompass a great deal of targets. We are confident that we will find even more places for it moving forward.
Solar panel fields - Upgrading their purpose and giving them a new job 24/7 
Solar panel arrays and fields are becoming have become very common in our global push for a more sustainable infrastructure. A great deal of money has been invested into solar fields across the country and world. However that investment has a limit in usefulness. As it is now, solar power has reached a slight plateau. The solar power production methods in use today have inherit limits in efficiency, grid utilization, overall effectiveness, and of course, the night time power production limit. So we designed a product to increase the usefulness of the existing investment and bypass the limits we all have in solar power by adding wind to the current setup. Once installed they will require very little additional hardware or investment from the owner of the field and will provide substantial power production increases. SUBSTANTIAL INCREASE. It really is a big win-win 

The turbines can be mounted on the top edge of the solar panels with cross supports attached to grounding structures.
Power produced from the turbines can be tied directly to the panel array output connections and grid tie faculties.
Potential installation targets: There are over 83 separate large solar (photovoltaic) fields power plants with over 10,000 panels per installation. Some of which have over 900,000 panels. All of which are useless at night. This product absolutely belongs here.


4 of ? Solar fields - No image credit taken
Streetlights and Light Poles - Because it makes sense
Using the same turbines, and merely changing the mounts, we can use streetlights and light poles as a base structure for our turbines. This gives us the option to tie to the the grid at each light and assist the light in its duties. Presently, the power grid is not quite capable of effectively handling an intermittent power source like the wind yet, so initially the power produced by these turbines will be directed towards assisting the lamp only. Eventually, the smart-grid will be fully developed, and when that happens, the power produced by these units will become even more useful in providing power to the grid at every light.

Potential local installations in Cosprings 20,000
Potential statewide Installations 10^ 5
Potential national installations 10^ 7
    .
And get this, if we were able to put turbines on most of Denver's,  Colorado Springs, and Pueblo's streetlights , congratulations Colorado, you just built the power production capability of a medium nuclear reactor, for like 1/16th the cost. Cool right?
We'll add one more calculation for the mathematically inclined and big picture thinkers just for fun.
There are an estimated 26 Million streetlights in the United States, Let's pretend like somewhere, a good decision was made, and these turbines were put on half of them. 13 Million lights that now each produce 4000 Watts of power, giving us 52GW's of electricity, yes, Gigawatts of power production, for life, across the United States or = roughly 1/8th the power of the whole United States. For an investment of roughly $31 Billion dollars, plus shipping.  Now that might seem like a high price-tag for most of us but to achieve 52GW's by conventional means, would create more zeros than we think we could type.   So yes Mr. President, to answer your call for action towards sustainability, we present to you a solution, and yes, we take Visa. ;-)

Fences, Medians, and Pipelines -1 mile of installations= 1MW power production for  $633,600 ( 1MW could cost well over 2 million dollars for just solar panels alone not including grid interface equipment). We understand that that number is high for most of us, but for states that are looking into alternative energy, that number is very attractive compared to other solutions out there today.

Pipeline Example
Roof-lines -  This also just makes sense. Since the turbines can be mounted in any orientation and still catch the wind without requiring a pole mount structure, the location options for installing wind power have gone up substantially. Skyscrapers shown below are a candidate for wind power now. Better yet, now every gas station, Mcdonalds, Starbucks and Walmart's etc can now have wind power added to them.... Cost effectively. 
Let's do a few more examples to put this into perspective:
There are 4663 Walmarts in the United States today. Let's say that each one of them, purchased 50 of the Cleantec turbines with the roof-line mounting option that each produce 2000 Watts each. If that happened, Walmart as a company would collectively produce 466.3MW (megawatts) of power, for a price-tag of $280 million dollars. Dramatically more affordable.
For comparison, the Topaz Solar Farm in California, produces about 550 MW (megawatts) and cost roughly $2 Billion to complete after install.
12 for each of the 14,000 McDonalds in the United States is 336 MW (Megawatts)
10 for each of the 11,168 Starbucks in the United States = 223.4MW and so on and so fourth.
They add up substantially 

New York and Chicago, this one is for you :-)
About the Turbine

The 10' "The Gust SI" Turbine
The turbine featured in the video and in some of the images is just a prototype. It was built with parts that we could afford with the objective to showcase the design and overall form factor. With a successful kickstart, we will be able to deliver a final product.
The final product will be much much cooler, and significantly more advanced.
Not shown changes to the design are as follows:


Twisted composite blades - Providing a corkscrew effect to catch the wind at different angles while maintaining strength

MagDrive rotors - Building a few high powered magnets into the rotor and a few on the armature will increase the performance of the turbines and decrease the overall start speed

Output indicators - Cleanly lighted end-caps that go blue when the turbine is producing power, and red for about 15-20 seconds when it is not. Giving it a really cool night time appearance

Aluminum construction - Making the whole turbine light-weight

AC pass-through and grid-tie - Providing stable voltage, series linking and the ability to plug into almost any electrical outlet in homes or businesses to grid-tie. Just plug it in with an extension cord and it is done

High-speed Bearings- Very cost effective and abundant, offering minimal drag

Standardized Mount Fittings - providing different and swappable mounts for the same turbine.
.
With all these features we have calculated that the start speed should be around 8 mph and peak power production at 16 mph and above.
Tech Stuff
Each (10’) AC turbine's power production is internally regulated and capped at 2000W. Each have built-in micro-inverters, regulators, and  storage bank to ensure stable, clean, reliable, manageable and predictable power production output that is sufficient for grid use in all wind conditions.
Each turbine outputs at a constant frequency and rate thanks to the built-in storage bank. When the wind has stopped, the output continues normally until the bank has been depleted past 30% and output is ceased. There is no gradual voltage or current drop.
For obvious reasons we will not be disclosing in full the internal components of this design at this point in time. For two reasons: One, it isn't finished yet and we many improvements that need to made that we will be able to do when we are able to move forward again. Two, If you would like to know how they work, you will just have to buy one and take it apart. Sorry, it's just good business.
2 Initial Versions - 4 Future


The Burst - 32” Mini Turbine– Peak Wind Power production 500W AC  60Hz - Direct grid-tie

The Gust - 10’ Turbine – Peak Power Production 2000W AC 60Hz- Direct grid-tie
.
Initially there will be 3 mounting options available: 

The flat surface (roof) mount.
The C-Clamp style mount.
The Pipe mount (basically giant high-end hose clamps)
For solar panel array mount possibilities please contact us directly.
.
Why is it better?
To further support why this design is advantageous over conventional wind products, we have a short list that we hope will convince you to see the potential. 
It will be sickeningly cheaper
The costs to produce these units will drop significantly as we move forward. Making it possible for these units to be as abundant and affordable as vacuum cleaners. And when you factor in the removal of the large installation and hardware costs associated with conventional windmills the cost analysis is highly favorable and the economics are very encouraging.
A quick Google search for a 30Kw wind system returns a price of over $30,000, not including installation and other hardware related costs. To get to 30Kw with these turbines it takes 15 units for $18,000... basically installed.
And large orders will get special pricing once we are able to drive the costs down.
Infinitely linkable
Each turbine has an output port of 120v AC and an AC input port. This makes them linkable (think Christmas lights), making it the first modular wind system of its kind. Imagine an oil pipeline (shown above) with wind turbines all the way down it powering the equipment and nearby towns in a good wind. Or imagine highway medians and dividers using some of the wind from traffic to help out a bit. 
It's easier to build

It can be made right here in the USA, by American workers and Veterans
Large quantity production designed
Componentized assembly
Abundant and commercially available parts and components
Local suppliers and national suppliers established
Smaller

Less invasive and disruptive
Easy to install
Lightweight
Shippable
Many more applications than just solar panels
Several have been mentioned above: oil pipelines, fences, highway medians (when safe obviously) but we believe this is just the beginning of a long list. The idea of roof-lines, not just home roof lines, but large buildings and skyscrapers or even gas station islands is also pretty cool. As these units become produced in large quantities, we hope they find their way to everyplace possible.
What do we plan to do from here?
Bring it to reality and finish what we have started. As we said in the very beginning, we made a commitment. We will press-on and keep moving forward. Continuing to work and rework our methods and pursue all options until we have succeeded. If this campaign is successful what we plan to do is:

Re-engage operations of Cleantec, its facilities, staff, and plan
Call upon the suppliers that we have established and begin the assembly of the initial units
Test the units, and select the final assembly based on results
Engage operation CleantecWind, which encompasses the order system, sales team and strategy, and rapid production
Fulfill perks of the campaign
In six months time have the final units production methods and assembly methods perfected with large quantities available for sale
Manufacture first few thousand here locally in Colorado Springs using local suppliers and staff and either scale up productions to a bigger facility or outsource main component production to meet demand and/or licensing agreement with a large company as needed
Maintain namespace and brand image at all times to aid in the success of future product lines
What else do you need to know 

We have a team of people ready to go to bring this turbine to life. 20 unique and motivated people that are apart of Cleantec. Ready to rock 

Mounting these turbines onto solar arrays requires a support and a vibration dampening mechanism that we have yet fully establish precise specs for due to the fact that there are many different types of solar mounting systems and the product is not quite ready. It is our plan to generate a few different options moving forward in the coming stages when we are able to proceed.
We wont be alone. We will leverage the entirely of our network of partners to move this project forward, which includes state and local government, some federal government connections, local contractors, local suppliers, and a ton more people and companies that share the vision of this product and have offered to help us bring it to life.
We have additional wind solutions that we will deliver in time, so help us now, and we will get there together
The reason the website is locked is because we have more to show but it is all not quite ready. One thing at a time. 
This is only the beginning for Cleantec. Strap in world, you're about be rocked.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fTQAz43J8U4

Support sustainable energy for this planet.
Help upgrade all those solar panel fields, streetlights, and roofs in the world to be more useful.

story:
Schierman Sanctuary

This is an exclusive invitation to continue to develop the Schierman's fourth-generation family farmstead, Schierman Sanctuary as a 40-acre private park and rural retreat destination on the Palouse. Schierman Sanctuary is a man-made private park in rural Eastern Washington State, it is aptly dubbed the 'Oasis' and often called the 'Shire'. It stands out on the Palouse with it's deep green foliage, lush lawns, water features, and abundant wildlife. The success of this campaign will make property enhancement and park expansion happen sooner and steadier. Your contributions will provide an amazing private hideaway to share with friends and family. Schierman Sanctuary will be exclusive to Indiegogo contributors and their guests. The complete design includes:

  Two open-air amphitheaters with multipurpose pavilion stages, one for drive-in concerts.

Edible and experimental gardens, a nursery, and year-round pit greenhouses for edibles and aquaculture.

Camping and private group camp areas.

Private tiny guest houses both seasonal and year-round.

Catering kitchen and small bistro/bar serving local foods and beverages.

Gear rental shop.

Large multipurpose studios for art residency, retreats, and sustainable workshops.

Permanent restrooms with indoor/outdoor showers, spa and sauna.


Let your imagination wander... You are a photographer seeking unique settings and serenity in the country; adventurers looking for new and relatively unexplored lands without crowds or tourists; artists, writers or musicians looking for a retreat or studio residency; a couple dreaming of a rustic summer vacation destination in an airy cabin with campfires under the stars; A family planning a memorable reunion; or a group of friends looking for an exclusive and intimate weekend concert destination.

Every season provides opportunities for exploring by bike, kayak, canoe, car, motorcycle, boat, by air, horseback, or on foot. Winter provides an especially surreal landscape for photography, hiking, telemark or cross-country skiing, snowshoeing, curling up in a cozy little cabin, working in a warehouse studio space or playing indoor games in the rec barn with friends.

The Palouse contains diverse nature, unique terrain, secret landmarks, hidden waterfalls, mysterious lakes, ghost towns, old cemeteries, quaint country towns, abandoned railroad tunnels and trestles, great fishing, miles of country back roads, and so much more. Several of the local towns are great for relaxed games of golf that are reasonably priced with little waiting and few other golfers. There are private airstrips nearby if you wish to bring your own plane and you may also book private sightseeing plane tours locally.  

You will have the time of your life staying where the hosts have enjoyed a lifetime exploring the Palouse. Tom Schierman is a Palouse landscape photographer, capturing hundreds, sometimes over a thousand photos every day. Sunset and sunrise are almost always spectacular as are the shadows on the land. The diversity of the terrain and the daily color changes of the fields and seasons is something everyone should experience more than once.

This is where the funding will go:

-Each of the existing farm buildings need some type of interior or exterior repair or remodel to create a more aesthetic and functional rustic resort ambiance. The interior and surrounding exterior spaces need to be available for relaxing, entertainment, and multipurpose guest use. Generally speaking, the buildings need roofing repairs, interior/exterior addition, concrete floors, lumber, flooring, insulation, walls...the list goes on, but it's not impossible, so we'll start with the most necessary priorities, like roofing repairs that need to be done before winter, creating guest and volunteer quarters, and making multipurpose studios and lounge areas in existing buildings.

-At a minimum, permanent restrooms with indoor and outdoor showers need to be built and connected to a new septic system and drain field engineered for public use.

If funding is successful, at least one private cabin or bunkhouse will be built.


This campaign will provide building materials, furniture, fund equipment rental, septic system and plumbing, update and expand electrical, and install ambient property lighting. Even at the funding requested, expenses will have to be juggled incredibly carefully since it is the bare minimum needed to open with accommodations for guests. The Schiermans and volunteer crew will take on as much work as possible to decrease labor costs so more funding can go toward materials. 

Extra funding will benefit the property immensely and will provide more amenities now versus later. This could include construction of more private guest houses and potentially more luxurious rustic resort amenities (like a sauna and spa or big outdoor kitchen) and expansion of the park grounds depending on your votes and contributions. This is a collaborative effort to create the retreat atmosphere you yearn to experience on the Palouse. However, you are welcome to sit back and watch the progress without adding input too.

If funding comes up short, the development process must start with the most important building enhancement requirements - however, the park may not be able to fully open to guests or host events as soon as everyone would like. It's safe to say you want to experience the park as soon as possible and probably more often than you realize.

The goal is to utilize green and reclaimed materials, alternative energy, sustainable practices, and intelligent design everywhere possible. This development is being designed with care to be gentle on the environment and blend in to the surroundings.

The successful campaign will have a lively open-house party with local talent for completion celebration. You are welcome to visit and tour or camp on select dates during construction and celebrations. 

When this project is complete you will have created an astounding and permanent rural destination experience in the Pacific Northwest.

Farm Buildings

-Schierman Barn is being designated as a rec hall for social gatherings, acoustic concerts, private events, workshops, and indoor games. Currently it contains Billiards, Darts, Foosball, Ping-Pong, and a giant set of Jenga with more to come.

-The "Machine Shed" is on it's way to becoming a large multipurpose backstage warehouse for meetings and indoor social functions with bar, loft lounge, and indoor stage with a big open layout.

-The shop complex will be renovated and expanded to house multipurpose studios and the connected "blacksmith shop" and bunkhouse will become a gear rental and repair shop. Parts of it need new roofing and remodel badly before winter.

-The farmhouse is being redesigned as a club house with guest loft, catering kitchen, offices, and media lounge.

-The 1920's carriage house will serve as a front desk and Palouse travel kiosk with local maps, photos, sightseeing, unique local travel destinations, the history of the property and surrounding area, and guided tours of the Palouse. 

-"Windmill Hill"-The hillside field with a windmill centerpiece is now a large lawn amphitheater.

-8 acres of field will be turned into large lawns and landscapes for camping, drive-in concerts and ope-air events.

-There are several private campfire pits and full-size outdoor game courts placed around the property for additional leisure and recreation amenities. Currently it hosts Bocce Ball, Croquet, Horsehoes, Kubb, and Basketball with more coming soon.

-A big, year-round pit greenhouse is being planned for organic garden food. A major goal is to serve guests fresh veggies and herbs, homemade stews and soups, handmade breads, local seafood, locally sourced meats, herbal blended butters, wood-smoked delights, and free-range eggs,  as well as local Palouse beers, wines, and hand-crafted alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages.

Property Line 

Detailed map of buildings and south gathering spaces 

Green- new buildings, stages, and covered sidewalks; white- existing buildings 

Road development, cabin placement, and new 1/2 acre pond

Roads, cabins and lawn parking for events (top of picture)


The Palouse is starting to gain recognition as the "Tuscany of America" by photographers and travel writers. 

This photo by Tom Schierman is the Northern corner of Schierman Sanctuary, and shows some of the hillside in the foreground where the new guest cabins will be sited. Picture sitting on the front porch with this view.


Schierman Sanctuary is nestled in soft rolling hills, but the rough 'scablands' of the great Missoula floods are right out the back door- Less than fifteen minutes away is a unique perspective of the wild West. The massive glacial floods created a mess of interesting landscapes with lakes, rivers and waterfalls. It's not hard to imagine outlaws and Indians in the Palouse scablands. 

 Schierman Sanctuary exists to bring people together to collaborate on creations that enhance the health and happiness of society. Plus, opening Schierman Sanctuary to guests is tremendously important because it keeps the Schierman family working on the farm without having to commute to a job elsewhere, and it permanently secures the nearly 100 year-old Schierman farmstead as a place for relaxing and entertaining by covering large expenses. Your support will make a huge impact for like-minded people interested in securing a privately-owned country destination. It will provide a base for people around the globe to experience the Palouse region, provide local jobs, and bring guest amenities off the drawing board. This venture will always promote local communities and strive to boost local economies while advocating sustainability and environmentalism. 

The Schierman Sanctuary Team

Tom Schierman (father and official property owner) has been planting and expanding the park for 40 years. He fancies himself the 'park ranger'. When he began planting there was hardly a tree on the property, now there are too many to count and the park is rich with abundant life. When Tom moved home from college the farmstead was a typical wide-open Palouse farm. Nothing special. He babied rows of tiny trees all around the farmhouse until they were big enough to transplant around the property permanently. He has photographed the entire growth and expansion since he started as a younger man. Something special indeed. In the last five years these three men planted over 1500 trees and shrubs from their own private nursery to expand the landscape.

James Schierman (32) has been involved with farming, gardening, and tree planting since very young. He was born in the family farmhouse in frigid February on a water bed and first weighed on a sausage scale. He moved home from college in 2003 following his heart back home and a freedom for his imagination. He is the unofficial 'property manager' and development visionary creating and designing guest cabins, deciding road and infrastructure placement, new landscape design, water feature creation, existing building remodel, guest amenities, websites, and property infrastructure.

Jon Schierman (23) has also been involved with the growth of the park since he was very young, and has been a critical groundskeeper helping to irrigate, garden, mow, create new tree groves, and a great deal of other landscape maintenance and property enhancement. He is elemental in the effort to transform the farm to open the property to the public.

Countless friends and family have been tremendously beneficial to the creation of Schierman Sanctuary, and while not naming any names here, the gratitude remains strong. You will all receive special acknowledgement and perks for helping bring this project to the world.

The perks of being a contributor are robust: guest stay, discounts, private group camping, guest cards and lanyards, invitation to private weekend parties, permanent mention in the resort guest directory and on main kiosk, access to behind-the-scenes newsletter with photos and videos, the entire farm history with photos and videos, and a weekly voting opportunity. Funding this campaign practically makes you an owner and puts you on the guest list for all events.

Everyone can chip in

Understandably, not everyone can contribute that wants to, if you want to see this project unfold, get the word out to everyone everywhere and make plans to experience it in the future.

Please share it everywhere by using the Indiegogo share tools!

Your new Palouse destination awaits!

 Edible and experimental gardens, a nursery, and year-round pit greenhouses for edibles and aquaculture.
Camping and private group camp areas.
Private tiny guest houses both seasonal and year-round.
Catering kitchen and small bistro/bar serving local foods and beverages.
 Gear rental shop.
Large multipurpose studios for art residency, retreats, and sustainable workshops.
Permanent restrooms with indoor/outdoor showers, spa and sauna.
 
Let your imagination wander... You are a photographer seeking unique settings and serenity in the country; adventurers looking for new and relatively unexplored lands without crowds or tourists; artists, writers or musicians looking for a retreat or studio residency; a couple dreaming of a rustic summer vacation destination in an airy cabin with campfires under the stars; A family planning a memorable reunion; or a group of friends looking for an exclusive and intimate weekend concert destination.
Every season provides opportunities for exploring by bike, kayak, canoe, car, motorcycle, boat, by air, horseback, or on foot. Winter provides an especially surreal landscape for photography, hiking, telemark or cross-country skiing, snowshoeing, curling up in a cozy little cabin, working in a warehouse studio space or playing indoor games in the rec barn with friends.
The Palouse contains diverse nature, unique terrain, secret landmarks, hidden waterfalls, mysterious lakes, ghost towns, old cemeteries, quaint country towns, abandoned railroad tunnels and trestles, great fishing, miles of country back roads, and so much more. Several of the local towns are great for relaxed games of golf that are reasonably priced with little waiting and few other golfers. There are private airstrips nearby if you wish to bring your own plane and you may also book private sightseeing plane tours locally.  
You will have the time of your life staying where the hosts have enjoyed a lifetime exploring the Palouse. Tom Schierman is a Palouse landscape photographer, capturing hundreds, sometimes over a thousand photos every day. Sunset and sunrise are almost always spectacular as are the shadows on the land. The diversity of the terrain and the daily color changes of the fields and seasons is something everyone should experience more than once.
This is where the funding will go:
-Each of the existing farm buildings need some type of interior or exterior repair or remodel to create a more aesthetic and functional rustic resort ambiance. The interior and surrounding exterior spaces need to be available for relaxing, entertainment, and multipurpose guest use. Generally speaking, the buildings need roofing repairs, interior/exterior addition, concrete floors, lumber, flooring, insulation, walls...the list goes on, but it's not impossible, so we'll start with the most necessary priorities, like roofing repairs that need to be done before winter, creating guest and volunteer quarters, and making multipurpose studios and lounge areas in existing buildings. 
-At a minimum, permanent restrooms with indoor and outdoor showers need to be built and connected to a new septic system and drain field engineered for public use.
If funding is successful, at least one private cabin or bunkhouse will be built.



This campaign will provide building materials, furniture, fund equipment rental, septic system and plumbing, update and expand electrical, and install ambient property lighting. Even at the funding requested, expenses will have to be juggled incredibly carefully since it is the bare minimum needed to open with accommodations for guests. The Schiermans and volunteer crew will take on as much work as possible to decrease labor costs so more funding can go toward materials. 
Extra funding will benefit the property immensely and will provide more amenities now versus later. This could include construction of more private guest houses and potentially more luxurious rustic resort amenities (like a sauna and spa or big outdoor kitchen) and expansion of the park grounds depending on your votes and contributions. This is a collaborative effort to create the retreat atmosphere you yearn to experience on the Palouse. However, you are welcome to sit back and watch the progress without adding input too.If funding comes up short, the development process must start with the most important building enhancement requirements - however, the park may not be able to fully open to guests or host events as soon as everyone would like. It's safe to say you want to experience the park as soon as possible and probably more often than you realize.
The
 goal is to utilize green and reclaimed materials, alternative energy, 
sustainable practices, and intelligent design everywhere possible. This 
development is being designed with care to be gentle on the environment 
and blend in to the surroundings.
The successful campaign will have a lively open-house party with local talent for completion celebration. You are welcome to visit and tour or camp on select dates during construction and celebrations. 
When this project is complete you will have created an astounding and permanent rural destination experience in the Pacific Northwest.
Farm Buildings
-Schierman Barn is being designated as a rec hall for social gatherings, acoustic concerts, private events, workshops, and indoor games. Currently it contains Billiards, Darts, Foosball, Ping-Pong, and a giant set of Jenga with more to come.
-The "Machine Shed" is on it's way to becoming a large multipurpose backstage warehouse for meetings and indoor social functions with bar, loft lounge, and indoor stage with a big open layout.
-The shop complex will be renovated and expanded to house multipurpose studios and the connected "blacksmith shop" and bunkhouse will become a gear rental and repair shop. Parts of it need new roofing and remodel badly before winter.
-The farmhouse is being redesigned as a club house with guest loft, catering kitchen, offices, and media lounge.
-The 1920's carriage house will serve as a front desk and Palouse travel kiosk with local maps, photos, sightseeing, unique local travel destinations, the history of the property and surrounding area, and guided tours of the Palouse. 
-"Windmill Hill"-The hillside field with a windmill centerpiece is now a large lawn amphitheater.
-8 acres of field will be turned into large lawns and landscapes for camping, drive-in concerts and ope-air events.-There are several private campfire pits and full-size outdoor game courts placed around the property for additional leisure and recreation amenities. Currently it hosts Bocce Ball, Croquet, Horsehoes, Kubb, and Basketball with more coming soon.
-A big, year-round pit greenhouse is being planned for organic garden food. A major goal is to serve guests fresh veggies and herbs, homemade stews and soups, handmade breads, local seafood, locally sourced meats, herbal blended butters, wood-smoked delights, and free-range eggs,  as well as local Palouse beers, wines, and hand-crafted alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages.


Property Line 

Detailed map of buildings and south gathering spaces 

Green- new buildings, stages, and covered sidewalks; white- existing buildings 

Road development, cabin placement, and new 1/2 acre pond

Roads, cabins and lawn parking for events (top of picture)
The Palouse is starting to gain recognition as the "Tuscany of America" by photographers and travel writers. 
This photo by Tom Schierman is the Northern corner of Schierman Sanctuary, and shows some of the hillside in the foreground where the new guest cabins will be sited. Picture sitting on the front porch with this view.
Schierman Sanctuary is nestled in soft rolling hills, but the rough 'scablands' of the great Missoula floods are right out the back door- Less than fifteen minutes away is a unique perspective of the wild West. The massive glacial floods created a mess of interesting landscapes with lakes, rivers and waterfalls. It's not hard to imagine outlaws and Indians in the Palouse scablands. 
 Schierman Sanctuary exists to bring people together to collaborate on creations that enhance the health and happiness of society. Plus, opening Schierman Sanctuary to guests is tremendously important because it keeps the Schierman family working on the farm without having to commute to a job elsewhere, and it permanently secures the nearly 100 year-old Schierman farmstead as a place for relaxing and entertaining by covering large expenses. Your support will make a huge impact for like-minded people interested in securing a privately-owned country destination. It will provide a base for people around the globe to experience the Palouse region, provide local jobs, and bring guest amenities off the drawing board. This venture will always promote local communities and strive to boost local economies while advocating sustainability and environmentalism. 

The Schierman Sanctuary Team
Tom Schierman (father and official property owner) has been planting and expanding the park for 40 years. He fancies himself the 'park ranger'. When he began planting there was hardly a tree on the property, now there are too many to count and the park is rich with abundant life. When Tom moved home from college the farmstead was a typical wide-open Palouse farm. Nothing special. He babied rows of tiny trees all around the farmhouse until they were big enough to transplant around the property permanently. He has photographed the entire growth and expansion since he started as a younger man. Something special indeed. In the last five years these three men planted over 1500 trees and shrubs from their own private nursery to expand the landscape. 
James Schierman (32) has been involved with farming, gardening, and tree planting since very young. He was born in the family farmhouse in frigid February on a water bed and first weighed on a sausage scale. He moved home from college in 2003 following his heart back home and a freedom for his imagination. He is the unofficial 'property manager' and development visionary creating and designing guest cabins, deciding road and infrastructure placement, new landscape design, water feature creation, existing building remodel, guest amenities, websites, and property infrastructure.
Jon Schierman (23) has also been involved with the growth of the park since he was very young, and has been a critical groundskeeper helping to irrigate, garden, mow, create new tree groves, and a great deal of other landscape maintenance and property enhancement. He is elemental in the effort to transform the farm to open the property to the public.
Countless friends and family have been tremendously beneficial to the creation of Schierman Sanctuary, and while not naming any names here, the gratitude remains strong. You will all receive special acknowledgement and perks for helping bring this project to the world.
The perks of being a contributor are robust: guest stay, discounts, private group camping, guest cards and lanyards, invitation to private weekend parties, permanent mention in the resort guest directory and on main kiosk, access to behind-the-scenes newsletter with photos and videos, the entire farm history with photos and videos, and a weekly voting opportunity. Funding this campaign practically makes you an owner and puts you on the guest list for all events.Everyone can chip in
Understandably, not everyone can contribute that wants to, if you want to see this project unfold, get the word out to everyone everywhere and make plans to experience it in the future.
Please share it everywhere by using the Indiegogo share tools!
Your new Palouse destination awaits!

story:
Short Summary

Save the Nanners! Have you ever heard of Panama Disease? Panama Disease is a fungus affecting banana production worldwide.  But the disease will not only have an affect on the world's favorite fruit, but more importantly the communities that harvest them as their primary resource.

The Impact

Save the Nanners! Is a campaign to save our bananas and the communities that export them.  40% of profits will go toward banana worldwide research.  

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Or follow us on instagram at savethenanners

    Or like us on facebook at https://www.facebook.com/pages/Save-the-Nanners...

story:
Pe' Sla is an area in the Black Hills of South Dakota (just west of Rapid City) that is considered by the Lakota people to be the Center and heart of everything that is. It is part of our creation story. It is a sacred place. We perform certain ceremonies at Pe' Sla which sustain the Lakota way of life and keep the universe in harmony. This area is partly owned by the Reynolds family. They plan to auction off almost 2,000 acres on August 25, 2012 to the highest bidder. It is likely that the state of South Dakota will put a road directly through Pe' Sla and open up this sacred place for development. The seven bands of the Lakota/Dakota/Nakota Oyate (people) aka Oceti Sakowin (Great Sioux Nation) have a collective effort to buy as much of Pe'Sla as we can at this auction (although we also believe that the land cannot be owned and that our sacred places were illegally taken by the United States). Yet we are trying to work within the current U.S. laws to regain custody of our sacred sites and prevent future road and industrial development. Our sacred ways must be protected and passed on to our future generations so that our children may live. This area of the Paha Sapa (Black Hills) is also home to many plants and animals who should also be protected. In fact, many consider that the area should possibly be a historical site, which would also assist in protecting it from future development as well. As Lakota people, our ancestors prayed here, at Pe' Sla, at certain times of year, when the stars aligned. We cannot go elsewhere to pray. We were meant to pray here. This is what they do not understand. Please help the Lakota people. "Let us put our minds together and see what life we can make for our children." Chief Sitting Bull, 1877 We have a group of young professional Native people that are dedicated to the promotion of education, health, leadership, and sovereignity among our indigenous Nations. Our goal is to assist in any way possible the purchase of Pe' Sla and other sites by a collective effort of the seven bands of the Oceti Sakowin (Great Sioux Nation) - the Lakota/Dakota/Nakota people. All proceeds from this campaign will go towards that effort. This area would be open to tribal nations for ceremonial purposes. The plants, animals, water, and air in the area would be respected and honored. Please see http://www.lastrealindians.com/category/chase-i... for more information. We thank you for your hope in the future.

We are hoping to buy as much of the sacred sites as possible. Currently for sale is 1,942.66 acres which is in 5 tracts (300 - 440 acres each).  It is diffcult to say how much this land would be sold for as developers may increase the true western "value". 

The Rosebud Sioux Tribe has designated $50,000 for the purpose of purchasing Pe' Sla land.  By contributing to the effort of all the Sioux Tribes, we aim to purchase at least some of the tracts, if not all.  Many of the Sioux Tribes continue to exist in poverty and do not have a thriving casino-based economy as the media may have portrayed.  Yet we continue to fight for what is sacred, because it matters!

UPDATE: Auction was cancelled on August 24, 2012 by the owners. The land is still being offered for sale by private sale.

story:
Short Summary

Institute of Ecotechnics, UK, has undertaken an expedition documenting the current statues of fisheries of the Mediterranean rim.  Oral historian Johanna Eurich has been spearheading interviews, with a videographer/photographer and local translators.  Over 70 interviews of fishermen, shipbuilders and other community members have been filmed.

The Museu de Valencia d'Etnologia and Museu Maritima, Barcelona, are planning exhibitions commencing in 2014 based on this Institute of Ecotechnics expedition. 

I joined the expedition as cultural specialist and expert photographer/videographer starting in June 2013 traveling to Spain, Sicily and Tunisia.  Like most NGOs, the project pays only travel and lodging costs but not out of pocket expenses. With the funds raised, I can continue to offer my prfessional expertise free of charge for a project important to the survival of the Mediteranean way of life.

Since 2001, I have worked with cultural, humanitarian and sustainability inititiatives providing expertise in photography and video storytelling in areas of intangible cultural heritage throughout the Mediteranean, the Arctic, and deserts of North Africa/Middle east.  I have worked in the field with Bedouin, berbers, Tunisian fishermen, acrtic explorers, etc.

What I Need & What You Get

I am raising the funds needed for cash expenses during the expedition, only.  I offer my professional services free of charge.

Contributors will follow along on every expedition with live posts filled with stories and photos...the people we meet and behind the scenes...this material is exclusive to contributors. For larger donations, limited edition photos prints and exclusive invitations to the final exhibit make you a part of the project!

With your support, I can provide the high level of quality, professionalism and field expertise that project's of this nature typically require but cannot afford.  My work has supported expeditions all over the planet and have been featured in NatGeo, VOATV, Country Life, UNESCO and more.

The Impact

We live on the Water Planet with a dynamic and complex biosphere. The worldwide crises of pollution and species loss affecting oceans and waterways emanates from human activities, and in turn, profoundly affects our daily lives. These activities in turn spring from values that define relationships between cultures and the hydrosphere- oceans, groundwater, lakes, glaciers, rivers and streams.

The Expedition seeks to understand dynamics of the ethnosphere (the global web of cultures), their consequences, intended and unintended, and how they affect our biosphere. Oral history has been recognised as a practice that reveals unmediated ground truth of women and men whose lives create local and global history. A documentation of oral history offers insight into experience and events of specific times and places.

Other Ways You Can Help

Het the word out...get involved in learning more about the crisis we face.
