story:
Sharing the journey of The Buzz Tour

In 2014 The Buzz Tour walked 1,400 miles for four months around England dressed as a bee to 'pollinate change'. Together, the bees examined the different tactics people are using to change the culture not the climate.  We want to turn the inspiring and fascinating video footage into a short documentary which will be made freely available to community groups to help inspire other people in their work. 

The funding will all be put towards video editing. The projects we visited were all over the country and spanned a wide range of tactics and we want your help so we can publicise them.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Editing the footage is a very time consuming process. We've got the people, we just need the money
  • As a thank you for supporting this film we will send you a copy of the finished documentary
  • Those making larger donations will also receive a copy of the book

Independent storytelling

We are independent and volunteer our time to do this work so that the great stories from the journey can be told. The journey is a unique look at what people in England are contributing to tackling climate change beyond being a consumer - a story that the mainstream media is not telling.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word and tell your friends and family to help us
  • The book is out to buy in May, so order a copy from the website at buzztour.org
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to help build the campaign

Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

The principal investigator, David Swenson, received his PhD in 1975 from the University of Wisconsin and is now semi retired in the Phoenix Arizona area. He has been involved in a multiplicity of different projects which require problem-solving and outside the box thinking. This project will be carried out to support the work of Brien Foerster, of Cusco Peru, who has been involved in the study of ancient people and their associated megalithic buildings. Samples of andesite stone from Tiwanaku and Puma Punku that have come from the megaliths will be shipped from Peru. David will photograph, measure and forward the samples to the PRIME laboratory at Purdue University for analysis and dating of the stone based on beryllium-10 production from cosmic rays by way of accelerator mass spectrometry. The purpose of this campaign is to establish an approximate date for the quarrying and machining of the megalithic structures in that region.

This project is important to determine if an ancient civilization with advanced machining technology had produced the megalithic buildings thousands of years before written history occurred. The fine work that was carried out could not have been done by a primitive people using stone hammers and copper chisels, because of the absolute precision of the stone.

Contributors to this project will be an important part of determining the truth about our ancient history and our world that is not taught in schools or universities. The method used to determine the age is a relatively new technology that has been well proven. It is capable of revealing dates up to millions of years ago. It is time to shake loose the structured thinking and lack of critical analysis of human history. 

The information we obtain will be revealed to our supporters first, and will be placed in the public domain.


What We Need & What You Get

We are requesting a total of $4500 for this project. The investigators will not receive any of the monies personally. Each sample that we send in will cost us $1310 in charges from Purdue. This is a research project, but is not funded by the National Science Foundation, therefore our expenses will be under the research column (https://www.physics.purdue.edu/ams/rosetest/pri...). The breakdown for these charges are listed below:

10Be only

Research

Crushing and grinding

130

Quartz separation and purification

375

Chemical preparation (BeO)

345

AMS measurement for Geo sample

460

Total:

1310

The funds requested will be for three independent samples ($3930), Indiegogo administrative fees ($315), sample shipping ($120) and videography costs for dissemination of information ($135).

Since we are running a very tight budget, the only perk we can promise donors to the campaign is that they will learn the results of the study as soon as we get them from Purdue. Thus, they will come out in three stages.  You will have the satisfaction of knowing that you have shaken paradigms on human history.

If we fail to meet our goal, we will test as many samples as we can with the funds, and seek supplemental funding to bring us up to the nearest amount needed. If we achieve more than the goal, we will continue to evaluate more samples.

The Impact

The impact of this study on human thinking will be dramatic. It will help make sense of some of the ancient texts, including the Sumerian writings and stories in the Bible. If there was a society with high technology in prehistory, this may be an opportunity for us to begin to recapture or perhaps reverse engineer that technology to improve the lives of everyone on the planet.

David Swenson and Brien Foerster have had successful careers in identifying anomalies, problems, inconsistencies and providing solutions and answers.  Successful application of the techniques in this project will open the door to a clearer definition of the ages of other megalithic buildings and structures, including the Easter Island statues, the Pyramids, and other unusual buildings found around the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people can contribute money, but that doesn't mean they cannot help. One way that would benefit us is to let all of your contacts on your social networks know about this project.  Word-of-mouth can be a very powerful tool in obtaining funding.

The Impact
The impact of this study on human thinking will be dramatic. It
will help make sense of some of the ancient texts, including the Sumerian
writings and stories in the Bible. If there was a society with high technology
in prehistory, this may be an opportunity for us to begin to recapture or
perhaps reverse engineer that technology to improve the lives of everyone on
the planet.
David Swenson and Brien Foerster have had successful careers in
identifying anomalies, problems, inconsistencies and providing solutions and
answers.  Successful application
of the techniques in this project will open the door to a clearer definition of
the ages of other megalithic buildings and structures, including the Easter
Island statues, the Pyramids, and other unusual buildings found around the
world.
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people can contribute money, but that doesn't mean they
cannot help. One way that would benefit us is to let all of your contacts on
your social networks know about this project. 
Word-of-mouth can be a very powerful tool in obtaining funding.

story:
Hello,

The OUR-C Foundation Mission:
We seek to aid in the conservation of  marine ecosystems through the education of both youth and adults from coastal urban settings.


Why is this so important to us?
 Many urban youth are not exposed to the many ways they can enjoy our oceans while also working to conserving this beautiful resource that surrounds them!

We are spearheading educational events & online programs that will not only introduce the joys of recreational & scientific diving, but coral reef and marine life stewardship as well, to those that normally are not introduced to such opportunities.

The OUR-C Foundation believes it’s wise to work together in educating our younger generation about the ocean and it‘s impact on our lives.

 The OUR-C Foundation has begun our 4 week online Endowment Fund Raising drive!

The Purpose of an Endowment Fund:
  The OUR-C Endowment is a fund that is restricted to using the interest made while the principal investment stays intact. In other words only the interest from the fund can be spent, not the principal that anchors the endowment.  Only a portion of the interest or earnings from the endowment (5%) is spent on an annual basis in order to assure that the original donor funds will grow over a period of time.

Perks of an Endowment Fund:
  • An endowment fund ensures that our organization will have sustainability and staying power for years to come!
  • An endowment fund helps us to be less reliant on government and it's budget cutting nightmares!
  • Every gift (donation) maintains its power and isn't just a one time gift! 


The Impact of YOUR donation!

  • You will be opening the doors to many urban youth who will begin to engage in the conservation efforts that are currently taking place!
  • You will opening the doors of recreational & scientific diving to urban youth!
  • You will be supporting coral reef and marine life conservation & education efforts for both youth & adults!

The OUR-C Foundation is pleased to be partners with :
  • D.W.P.  (Diving With a Purpose) & Y.D.W.P. ( Youth Diving With a Purpose) programs that award diving certification scholarships and educational opportunities to minority youth. www.divingwithapurpose.org
  • www.Reef.org - We are a field station for this organization and will go out spread the word about the conditions of our local coral reefs. We will also provide supplies for local divers to conduct field surveys of reef conditions and fish populations.
  • The Oceanic Urban Research Center - A private Christian school that is geared toward marine life and coral reef stewardship. This learning facility also opens the possibilities of ocean related careers to urban youth.

Other Ways You Can Help

Financial funding and support is awesome but there are many other ways that you can help:

  • Share the word and make some noise about our campaign.
  •  Use the Indiegogo.com share tools!
  • Pray for us! - We are strong believers in prayer!
  • Marine Biology or Dive Industry related gifts donated to our online fundraising raffles! - Join the other contributors!

Thank you for believing in us!

Mr. Fritz Moore
Founder/C.E.O. of The OUR-C Foundation 
A Florida non profit organization.: The OUR-C Foundation Home Page
 (954) 353-3439  : office

The OUR-C Foundation
P.O. Box 21546
Fort Lauderdale, Florida
33335

story:
UPDATE:

We are amazed and extremely thankful for all of our generous supporters who helped us reach our funding goal! Our first blog on the project is live here, and above is the trailer for the final video we are working on now. 
We still have a lot of work left to process the data and produce the video, and any funding not needed for this project will go into a new "special projects fund" we're establishing to help enable us to cover the costs of future missions like this one. Sponsoring the project will also secure your place in the credits and you can get some fantastic memorabilia like our limited edition mission patch.Thank you!

The Project

SkyTruth is teaming up with Space for All  for a skytruthing mission over the massive Bakken shale oil and gas fields in western North Dakota.  We're planning to launch a sensor package from the ground to the edge of space tethered to a high altitude balloon rig, courtesy of Space for All.  We will combine on the ground observations with detections from the balloon rig and measurements we are making from space to measure the amount of natural gas flaring there.  This will help us test the accuracy of our satellite-based flaring detections so we can do a better job of monitoring and reporting on the amount of environmentally damaging (and unnecessary and wasteful) flaring that happens in the Bakken and elsewhere in the world.  The more good data we can collect on when, where, and how much, the more we can help groups that are working to reduce and eliminate it. This is what we mean by skytruthing – using remote sensing and mapping to understand and change the world. 

Read more about the Bakken and oil shale fracking in this great piece by National Geographic: The New Oil Landscape

SkyTruth's  view of the Bakken from space.  The red stuff at the upper left is rig lighting and flaring from oil and gas drillers working the Bakken Shale.  The bright area on the right is the city of Minneapolis.

Here's what flaring in the Bakken looks like from the ground

This is what the balloon rig looks like in flight

What We Need

So what we need to do is buy all the gear, get our dedicated and all-volunteer team out to Williston, ND, assemble the sensor rig, get the helium we need for the balloons, launch the rig, collect the data and make a fun-filled video of the whole thing.  Then we come back to Shepherdstown to crunch the data, publish our data,  edit the mission video and congratulate ourselves on a job well done, while we figure out which jacket to put our stupendous new mission patches on.


What we're asking you to help with is the cost of transportation for our team of 5 volunteers and the equipment we need to buy for the mission.  

  • $1,000 for out of pocket travel costs (we're carpooling on the road trip out there, living in tents, and we don't eat much) 
  • $1,500 for equipment (balloons, helium, electronics for the sensors, cameras)

All told we need $2,500 to cover the base cost of the mission


But... if we can raise an additional $4,000 then we can get this super cool FLIR e40 infrared camera that will help us tell the difference between flaring and rig lights, as well as helping us look for methane releases.

And if we raise even more than that, we can do another mission!  Next time maybe over the Athabascan Tar Sands in Canada, mountaintop removal mining in Appalachia, or maybe just somewhere tropical...

What's the Point?

At SkyTruth, our motto is "If you can see it, you can change it"  By making the impacts of oil and gas drilling more visible and more measurable, we believe that we (that's we the concerned public) can change them.  Most of the wasteful flaring and venting can be dramatically reduced by obligating operators to capture the gas and related liquids and turn them in to useful products, thereby offsetting new natural gas drilling elsewhere in the country.  Or they can generate electricity on site with it.  Actually there are loads of good alternatives available, it's just that flaring off the gas is the cheapest (and dirtiest).

How Can I Help?

Please support our passionate and talented engineers as they devote their skills, time and energy to making the world a better place.  You can make a donation by selecting your contribution level on the right. We are a 501c3 nonprofit, so if you live in the United States your entire contribution is tax deductible, except for the cash value of the mission patch, which we will have for you by the time we ship them.

If you're totally jazzed and want to help, but you just don't have the cash, we total understand.  You can still help out.   Share this page with as many people as you can.  Read the recent Washington Post coverage of SkyTruth and share that.  And if you want to try a little skytruthing yourself, you can contribute a little bit of your time and energy to our FrackFinder project.

Mission Patch

The Limited Edition Mission Patch will look something like this .  So ok - it's just a doodle on  a whiteboard, but we have a real volunteer designer working on it, we promise. It's going to be totally awesome.


The SkyTruth Team,  left to right:  David Manthos, Teri Beibel, Paul Woods, and founder John Amos.

Space for All team and volunteers, launching a balloon rig

Mission Patch
The Limited Edition Mission Patch will look something like this .  So ok - it's just a doodle on  a whiteboard, but we have a real volunteer designer working on it, we promise. It's going to be totally awesome.

story:
Our names are Adulin Prophete and Wis Enry Denis. We are international SEED students at Fox Valley Technical College in Appleton Wisconsin, earning associate degrees in Environmental Technology. Both of us matriculated here from Haiti in 2012 through the CIED program, administered by Georgetown University for USAID Haiti on behalf of young people from rural Latin American or Caribbean communities who have faced extreme economic hardship and have demonstrated promising leadership potential.

We are the developers of the Clearway Project - a project that will provide sustainable solid waste management in Trou-du-nord, in Northeast Haiti. The project will include environmental education at schools, garbage collection for recycling and compost from individual households and the construction of 3 restrooms for public use.



This is be the first solid waste management program with recycling, compost, and environmental education in this community. This project will begin in June after our graduation from Fox Valley Technical College.

We need your help to raise $5,000 to cover the cost of materials for the public restrooms and to set up the environmental education program.

Aim:

The aim of this funding is to provide the 2000 people of Trou du Nord with the equipment and necessary education to implement a sustainable solid waste management for the future generation.

The introduction of a sustainable solid waste management project in Trou du Nord will contribute to a cleaner local environment and will help the community maintain potable surface and ground water, healthy soils, and clean air for healthier living in this community.

Problem

The disposal of municipal solid wastes is one of the most serious problems facing the 21st century. Waste generation is on an increasing trend due to exponentially increasing population growth, which renders waste management as a significant problem. Solid Waste Management in Trou du Nord is currently in a critical condition. Collection rates are about 13% in this community. This generates a permanent environmental impact on the natural resources, such as water, air, etc. (Ministry of Public Works, Haïti).

The accumulation of solid waste within this municipality, especially in the drainage systems, causes not only a menace to human health but also a serious risk of flooding during the rainy season. The population center of Trou du Nord Center has about 2000 people and 400 houses and has no waste collection system.

The riverfront…

This situation became worse after Haiti experienced an earthquake on January 12, 2010. Many people left the Capital to establish themselves in small towns and many of the displaced from Port-au-Prince and the surrounding areas have migrated to this municipality. Therefore, there is currently a significant increase in population. This increase in population is the main factor of the augmentation of solid waste. Garbage thrown in the street or in open space creates a public health hazard, while waste dumped near rivers, lakes and streams contaminates the water supply.

Drainage canal


How the fund will be used:

Opening event for project introduction in Trou du Nord Soccer Park Poster

Printing for flyers and t-shirts.

Equipment rental.

Buy materials and pay workers to build public toilets

Environmental education program (Handbook for learning activities, projector, Wireless Photo Printer Scanner Copier, and Portable Tripod Projector Screen)

Buy 300 bins (recycling and trash bin).

Creation recycle collection center

Creation of community compost site.

The money will also fund a community-wide clean-up, three public bathrooms, and also fund a solid waste and recycling collection system that will also create local jobs. 

Impact

·  A sustainable solid waste management project will contribute to a cleaner local environment, maintaining pure surface and ground water, healthy soils, and clean air.

·  A clean local environment will immediately benefit the most vulnerable groups of society whose livelihoods often depend on the natural resources available locally.

·  Recycling and composting activities can generate many environmental and economic benefits. For example, it will create jobs and income, supply valuable raw materials to industry, produce soil-enhancing compost for agriculture, reduce the need to site or build more landfills and combustors, and prevent greenhouse gas emissions.

If we do not reach our funding target the money that we do raise will be used to teach environmental education in 3 elementary schools.

If you cannot contribute financially help us by sharing this campaign with your friends, family, work buddies and push a link out through your social media networks PLEASE. If  you would like to know more about the Clearway Project contact us at p.adulin23@gmail.com or wisdenis909@gmail.com 920 475 9291.

The business plan was developed at Fox Valley Technical College with Joanne Gorski from Sustainable Insights. 

Collaborators:

story:
People need to see that change is possible – and to see a way forward, we aim to make that happen!

THE ISSUE:

Our oceans are at the point of crisis; scientists have reported that in the last 50 years we have lost over 90% of the global shark population due to overfishing and shark finning. Sharks as apex predators play a critical role in marine ecosystems, and their decline is having catastrophic consequences.
By journeying around the world and documenting the story of the people who are actively tackling these issues, we hope to create a tool that will be invaluable in inspiring the UK to join this growing conservation movement. 

OUR CAMPAIGN AIMS:

Communities and ordinary individuals around the world are leading the way in the movement to save sharks; pushing for protection through the creation of marine reserves and shark fin bans, however awareness of this critical issue in the UK is currently lacking and many people are apathetic.
Our aims are three fold; Through this journey we hope to meet and establish a global network of these innovators, the sum of who's work is collaboratively combating a difficult issue. Through documenting their stories we aim to raise vital awareness as well as promote positive attitudes; celebrating successful campaigning as a way of getting people excited about being a part of something and making it achievable.

Ultimately we want to generate this participation in the UK; to inspire and enable action within communities that would not normally be involved in shark or marine conservation. Instead of making a film that focuses on the terrible issue of shark extinction; we aim to turn a story of disaster into a story of solutions by documenting the efforts of the pioneers tacking the problem!

Most vitally; these actions will protect sharks, which will in turn benefit the balance of global ecosystems, which will benefit us all. 

                           

SUMMARY:

Our project has a three part approach:

1. BUILD THE NETWORK - Through traveling on this expedition we hope to meet and establish a global network of these innovators.

2. DOCUMENT POSITIVE APPROACHES - Through documenting their stories with a general audience in mind, our documentary will  tell stories of people and communities tacking the issue. Our film will follow successes, and  positive approaches - celebrating successful campaigning as a way of getting people excited about being a part of something and making it achievable.

3. GENERATE UK PARTICIPATION - Building a UK movement through film screenings! inspiring action within communities that would not normally be involved in shark or marine conservation.

     

WHY CONTRIBUTE?

By contributing your support to this project you will become a part of this movement for good, your support will enable us to complete this essential work and your participation will allow us to reach as many people as possible. Through this film - and through showing that change is possible, together we can inspire people to be involved and build a new generation of creative conservationists.

This project is not just about producing a film its about building a tool for a positive movement.

The magnitude of this project cannot be overstated; this will be beneficial to more than just the shark conservation movement, as it will empower communities to utilise their skills to generate positive change in many areas.

If you agree with the following, you'll love this project... 

  • You want to watch a film that portrays hope and a positive way forward for a difficult and little known issue that has massive impacts.
  • You want to help communities share their successful campaigns from around the world.
  • You believe that community is important.
  • You believe in empowering communities to share their stories and have their own voice. 
  • You would like to follow our adventure during our travels around the world..
  • You love documentaries with beautiful cinematography.
  • You like receiving exclusive behind the scenes photos and videos.
  • You love travel and have an adventurous spirit!

WHO WE ARE:

 Fin Fighters are a new UK based shark and marine conservation organisation.

We are a very ambitious! and have several large campaigns lined up for the next 5 years, most notably the Fin Free by 2023 campaign – which is working towards eradicating shark fin from the UK entirely by the year 2023. This would include a total ban on the trade and distribution of shark fin at a government level.


 We are also working on a transparency campaign that would see fish and chip shops across the UK stop the sale of shark, as well as a collaborative project that is monitoring shark fisheries and working to establish catch limits/sizes within the EU of various species of shark; including deep sea sharks.

CAMPAIGNS:

                                                         

     

Due to the efforts of our Fin Fighting community group (Fin Free Cambridge) in 2013 we achieved the miraculous! Cambridge became the UK's first city to officially condemn shark fin. Through lobbying the city council and petitioning the community we were able to secure the first ever backing of a council to protect sharks....which was HUGE!

                               

Fin Fighters promote co-operation, and we want to work with other groups to achieve change as dynamically and effectively as possible, to this effect we have recently worked with The Black Fish on a 3 week investigation in Morocco, to uncover potential illegal shark fishing as well as general monitoring of the shark fishery's along the coast. In this investigation Fin Fighters was able to take part in the citizen inspector network and trial techniques that will enable training of future Black Fish Citizen Inspectors.

TESTIMONIAL FROM WIETSE VAN DER WERF -DIRECTOR OF THE BLACK FISH:

"These passionate individuals are set on a course to make a profound
impact on shark protection for the years to come. Securing the first
ever backing of a local council in the UK, Cambridge turned fin free
last year. The campaign has since gone nationwide and we put our bets on
the Fin Fighter approach making the UK largely shark fin free within the
decade."

"The coming years will see much needed ambition and action - for
conservation of one of the world's most iconic species. Be at the
forefront of protecting what is dear to this planet. Help protect sharks
by helping build Fin Fighters into the force it needs to be.
Working with Lou and Phil at Fin Fighters has been inspirational, fun
and simply productive. Stuff gets done when Fin Fighters are around. If
you are looking to support the type of organisation that gets stuck in
and does whatever is necessary to protect this fragile earth for the
generations to come - look no further. Fin Fighters are here. Get
onboard, join or support. For the sharks - it’s now or never." Wietse.

 We have not been around for long.....but we are making an impact!

Our work has also been featured in several conservation magazines; most notably the Ecologist, the Greenzine, and Schnews. 

WHAT IS OUR INDEGOGO GOAL?

We’ve set our goal at £20,000. You might be asking why such a low figure, surely this is no where near enough for a round the world expedition?

Well if we can, we would love to raise more than this because being a new organisation has its drawbacks.....most notably funding is very hard to come by! But there are a lot of things we’d like to do if we had the means, there’s no question about that. Any extra funding will enable us to not only make the best documentary we physically can, including more locations and more individuals to connect with, but it will allow us to have much more of an impact when we return and start to screen it.     

Your contribution will cover our filming expenses, help cover our production costs, and support our screening tour! We are also very committed to reducing the environmental impact of this project as much as possible, including offsetting where this is not possible.  Your contributions will not only help us meet our low environmental impact goal but will also ensure that the final film project is produced as ethically as possible.

We hope to travel to a variety of places on this expedition in order to connect with as many different people and cultures as possible, we believe that including approaches to saving/protecting sharks from as many places as we can we will help us build a stronger more unified message and a wider network will be created.

We will travel to shark hotspots in; Australia, China and Indonesia, to the USA where in Florida and the Bahamas we will meet scientists who are bravely bridging the gap between science and activism, to Hawaii where due to public petitioning sharks have become protected, to Costa Rica; where one man is standing alone against illegal finning and Canada where the Fin Free movement began. 

GOODIES AND TREATS!

In return for your support, we've created some exciting perks to show our gratitude! For example, you can choose a photo print from our travels, or better yet,  receive a handwritten postcard form us selected in every country we visit! 

You could be the proud owner of our very special limited edition T-shirts or tote bags, our stickers added to laptop or guitar case will make you the envy of all your friends! You could even own a signed painting or drawing  by Phil Root who is not only a co-director on this project but also an acclaimed international artist . Or if your feeling like you want to get in on the action...... you could even send a small mascot for us to take on the road and we’ll document its journey around the world....maybe even send it swimming with sharks,  and of course we have  producer credits, and many more treats!  

Other Ways You Can Help:

FOLLOW THE PROJECT:

  • If you make a contribution, you’ll be sure to get regular updates as we document our project!
  • Help us spread the word and get social!  Follow us on Facebook and Twitter and check out our website.
  • Sign up for our newsletter on our website to get updates on our project and info on how to get involved and become a Fin Fighter.

                  THANKYOU!
story_txt:
People need to see that change is possible – and to see a way forward, we aim to make that happen!


THE ISSUE:

Our oceans are at the point of crisis; scientists have reported that in the last 50 years we have lost over 90%
of the global shark population due to overfishing and shark finning. Sharks as apex predators play a critical role in marine
ecosystems, and their decline is having catastrophic consequences.
By journeying around the world and documenting the story of the people who are actively tackling these issues, we hope to
create a tool that will be invaluable in inspiring the UK to join this growing conservation movement. 










OUR CAMPAIGN AIMS:
Communities and ordinary individuals around the world are leading the way in the movement to save sharks;
pushing for protection through the creation of marine reserves and shark fin bans, however awareness of this
critical issue in the UK is currently lacking and many people are apathetic.Our aims are three fold; Through this journey we hope to meet and establish a global network of these
innovators, the sum of who's work is collaboratively combating a difficult issue. Through documenting their stories we aim to raise vital awareness as well as promote positive attitudes;
celebrating successful campaigning as a way of getting people excited about being a part of something and
making it achievable.
Ultimately we want to generate this participation in the UK; to inspire and enable action within communities that
would not normally be involved in shark or marine conservation. Instead of making a film that focuses on the terrible issue of shark extinction; we aim to turn a story of disaster into a story of solutions by documenting the efforts of the pioneers tacking the problem!

Most vitally; these actions will protect sharks, which will in turn benefit the balance of global ecosystems,
which will benefit us all. 
                           


SUMMARY:
Our project has a three
part approach:
1. BUILD THE NETWORK -
Through traveling on this expedition we hope to meet and establish a
global network of these innovators.
2. DOCUMENT POSITIVE
APPROACHES - Through documenting their stories with a general
audience in mind, our documentary will  tell stories of people
and communities tacking the issue. Our film will follow successes,
and  positive approaches - celebrating successful
campaigning as a way of getting people excited about being a part of
something and making it achievable.
3. GENERATE UK
PARTICIPATION - Building a UK movement through film screenings!
inspiring action within communities that would not normally be
involved in shark or marine conservation.

     

WHY CONTRIBUTE?

By contributing your support to this project you will become a part of this movement for good, your support will enable us to complete this essential work and your participation will allow us to reach as many people as possible. Through this film - and through showing that change is possible, together we can inspire people to be involved and build a new generation of creative conservationists.
This project is not just about producing a film its about building a tool for a positive movement.
The magnitude of this project cannot be overstated; this will be beneficial to more than just the shark conservation movement, as it will empower communities to utilise their skills to generate positive change in many areas.




If you agree with the following, you'll love this project... 

You want to watch a film that portrays hope and a positive way forward for a difficult and little known issue that has massive impacts.
You want to help communities share their successful campaigns from around the world.
You believe that community is important.
You believe in empowering communities to share their stories and have their own voice. 
You would like to follow our adventure during our travels around the world..

You love documentaries with beautiful cinematography.
You like receiving exclusive behind the scenes photos and videos.
You love travel and have an adventurous spirit!

WHO WE ARE:

 Fin Fighters are a new UK based shark and marine conservation organisation.
We are a very ambitious! and have several large campaigns lined up for the next 5 years, most notably the Fin Free by 2023 campaign – which is working towards eradicating shark fin from the UK entirely by the year 2023. This would include a total ban on the trade and distribution of shark fin at a government level.

 We are
also working on a transparency campaign that would see fish and chip shops across
the UK stop the sale of shark, as well as a collaborative project
that is monitoring shark fisheries and working to establish catch
limits/sizes within the EU of various species of shark; including
deep sea sharks.
CAMPAIGNS:
                                                         
     
Due to the efforts of our Fin Fighting community group (Fin Free Cambridge) in 2013 we achieved the miraculous! Cambridge became the UK's first city to officially condemn shark fin. Through lobbying the city council and petitioning the community we were able to secure the first ever backing of a council to protect sharks....which was HUGE!
                               
Fin Fighters promote co-operation, and we want to work with other groups to achieve change as dynamically and effectively as possible, to this effect we have recently worked with The Black Fish on a 3 week investigation in Morocco, to uncover potential illegal shark fishing as well as general monitoring of the shark fishery's along the coast. In this investigation Fin Fighters was able to take part in the citizen inspector network and trial techniques that will enable training of future Black Fish Citizen Inspectors.
TESTIMONIAL FROM WIETSE VAN DER WERF -DIRECTOR OF THE BLACK FISH:
"These passionate individuals are set on a course to make a profoundimpact on shark protection for the years to come. Securing the firstever backing of a local council in the UK, Cambridge turned fin freelast year. The campaign has since gone nationwide and we put our bets onthe Fin Fighter approach making the UK largely shark fin free within thedecade."


"The coming years will see much needed ambition and action - forconservation of one of the world's most iconic species. Be at theforefront of protecting what is dear to this planet. Help protect sharksby helping build Fin Fighters into the force it needs to be.Working with Lou and Phil at Fin Fighters has been inspirational, funand simply productive. Stuff gets done when Fin Fighters are around. Ifyou are looking to support the type of organisation that gets stuck inand does whatever is necessary to protect this fragile earth for thegenerations to come - look no further. Fin Fighters are here. Getonboard, join or support. For the sharks - it’s now or never." Wietse.

 We have not been around for long.....but we are making an impact!

Our work has also been featured in several conservation magazines; most notably the Ecologist, the Greenzine, and Schnews. 
WHAT IS OUR INDEGOGO GOAL?








We’ve set our goal at £20,000. You might be asking why such a low figure, surely this is no where near enough for a round the world expedition?
Well if we can, we would love to raise more than this because being a new organisation has its drawbacks.....most notably funding is very hard to come by! But there are a lot of things we’d like to do if we had the means, there’s no question about that. Any extra funding will enable us to not only make the best documentary we physically can, including more locations and more individuals to connect with, but it will allow us to have much more of an impact when we return and start to screen it.     



Your contribution will cover our filming expenses, help cover our production costs, and support our screening tour! We are also very committed to reducing the environmental impact of this project as much as possible, including offsetting where this is not possible.  Your contributions will not only help us meet our low environmental impact goal but will also ensure that the final film project is produced as ethically as possible.








We hope to travel to a variety of places on this expedition in order to connect with as many different people and cultures as possible, we believe that including approaches to saving/protecting sharks from as many places as we can we will help us build a stronger more unified message and a wider network will be created.
We will travel to shark hotspots in; Australia, China and
Indonesia, to the USA where in Florida and the Bahamas we will
meet scientists who are bravely bridging the gap between science and activism, to Hawaii where due to public
petitioning sharks have become protected, to Costa Rica; where one man is standing alone against illegal
finning and Canada where the Fin Free movement began. 
GOODIES AND TREATS!






 In return for your support, we've created some exciting perks to show our gratitude! For example, you can choose a photo print from our travels, or better yet,  receive a handwritten postcard form us selected in every country we visit! 
You could be the proud owner of our very special limited edition T-shirts or tote bags, our stickers added to laptop or guitar case will make you the envy of all your friends! You could even own a signed painting or drawing  by Phil Root who is not only a co-director on this project but also an acclaimed international artist . Or if your feeling like you want to get in on the action...... you could even send a small mascot for us to take on the road and we’ll document its journey around the world....maybe even send it swimming with sharks,  and of course we have  producer credits, and many more treats!  



 Other Ways You Can Help:
 
GET IN TOUCH:You can reach us at info@finfighters.orgFeel free to email us with any questions or comments you may have. 
We are super keen to hear from you and we know how important it is to have all your questions answered, so just get in touch! We would love to hear from you if you are interested in becoming a Fin Fighter or supporting our efforts in any way.
FOLLOW THE PROJECT:

If you make a contribution, you’ll be sure to get regular updates as we document our project!
Help us spread the word and get social!  Follow us on Facebook and Twitter and check out our website.
Sign up for our newsletter on our website to get updates on our project and info on how to get involved and become a Fin Fighter.

                  THANKYOU!

story:
Hi I'm Anna. I campaign on clean energy at Friends of the Earth.

We're running a competition for schools as part of our campaign "Run On Sun". One lucky primary school will win free solar panels. And we need your help to fund them. 

Schoolkids from hundreds of schools across the country are busy with their creative entries for our competition. They're all hoping to win their school free solar panels because they know that clean energy is good for people and the environment - and it will save their school up to £8,000 a year.

And there'll be no losers. Only one school will win the solar panels that you're helping to fund. But contributing to something fun like this will help us promote the benefits of solar power to other schools. And we'll give them the know-how which will make it easier for them to unlock the benefits of solar power.

So please dig deep to make this a resounding win for clean energy. The kids know how important solar is to their future. Let's not let them down.

Here's a video about how solar power has transformed a real school in Britain This is Saltaire Primary School in Bradford. They've already got solar power. Take a look at this film to see how it's really inspiring the school and the kids... 

Where your money goes

Primary schools across England, Wales and Northern Ireland are now entering our competition to win a solar installation. They’re getting really creative with their entries showing how solar power would help their school.

Every penny you help raise will go towards the solar installation for the winning school.

We need to raise £15,000 – but the more we raise, the more we can help other schools.

Run on Sun is Friends of the Earth's campaign to make it easy for schools to run on solar power – and save bags of cash to spend on pupils.

story:
Look Out Shell!

The People’s Platform, now known as the Solar Pioneer, is anchored in Elliott Bay just a thousand yards from Shell’s colossal Polar Pioneer.

On May 16th, we were at the center of the largest kayak-based protest in history, the Paddle in Seattle, to stop Shell from drilling in the Arctic.

Coast Salish canoes rafted up with us and indigenous speakers and performers rocked Shell to its core all day long.

Since then, we’ve kept the Solar Pioneer out on the water for 3 weeks, projecting your messages to Shell and showing amazing documentaries that expose Shell's crimes all over the Earth.

We still have plenty more to project, including Sweet Crude and Gasland.

Incredible musicians have played the Solar Pioneer’s sound stage - with many more bands lined up in the wings.

We aim  to keep the Solar Pioneer in here in  Elliott Bay as long as Shell’s Arctic rigs are here. We only need 7 grand to make it happen. Everything beyond that will go to making the Solar Pioneer rock even harder and supporting our awesome crew.!

Check out our schedule of events at MosquitoFleet.US. Thank you so much for being a part of this historic moment with us.


Perks

$5: Deckhand
Welcome aboard! You'll be publicly listed on the Mosquito Fleet and Other 98% websites as an official crew-member of the People's Platform.

$10: Give Shell Hell
We blast your personal message to Shell onto our giant projection screen. The shorter and pithier your message, the better. Example: "SUCK it Shell! ...but not outta the Arctic." Once you have made your contribution, send us a direct message on Indiegogo with some fresh hell for Shell.

$25: Mosquito Fleet Sticker
The Mosquito Fleet is a volunteer crew of kayaktivsts that are swarming against Global Warming in the Salish Sea. Get your sticker and fly the flag, mateys!!

$50: Mosquito Fleet T-Shirt
The Mosquito Fleet has formed to paddle Big Oil's dirty rigs and tankers out of the Seven Seas. Get your t-shirt and join the Fleet. Arrrrrgh!


$50: Solar Power to the People T-Shirt
What the Hell Shell? Next time try solar.


$50: ShellNo T-Shirt
The ShellNo Kayak Flotilla captured the imaginations of people all over the world. Wear the symbol of a globally recognized movement. Snag a sweet t-shirt and let the world know how little you care for Shell.


$100: Mosquito Fleet Hoodie
Let the whole world know that you're rolling deep with the Mosquito Fleet.


$100: Solar Power Hoodie
Perfect for cool nights on the Solar Pioneer.


$250: First Mate's Pack
Take the clothes off our backs. You get both hoodies and two t-shirts.


$500: The Captain's Pack
Get 2 First Mate's Packs. You could donate them, give some away as gifts, or take a page from Shell and just keep them all for yourself. No judgement.


Budget

Some of the most innovative engineers in the Pacific Northwest have helped us outfit the Solar Pioneer. Thanks to past fundraising, we've installed and are currently operating 27 solar panels to power the barge; we have also already covered the cost of our giant projector and other light show equipment, including a rocking sound system.

Our goal of $7,000 would keep the 4000 square foot Solar Pioneer out on the water in action against Shell for 2 more weeks. 

If we don't meet our goal, we will use whatever we do raise to keep the People's Platform out for as long as possible. If we exceed it, any funds not needed for the operation of the Solar Pioneer will go toward long-term movement-building in the Pacific Northwest.


Recent Press Coverage

  • Grabbing Paddles in Seattle to Ward Off an Oil Giant, The New York Times, May 11, 2015. 
  • Mayor: Port needs new permit to host Shell oil-drilling fleet, The Seattle Times, May 4, 2015, Front Page.
  • Kayaks vs. Shell Face Off In Seattle, Al Jazeera America, Apr. 29, 2015
  • 'Cold welcome' for Arctic drilling rig's arrival, The Seattle Times, Apr. 17, 2015, Front Page.
  • Can a Flotilla of Kayaks Block Shell's Arctic Drilling Rigs in Seattle?, The Stranger, Apr. 8, 2015, Front Page.
  • 'Kayaktivist' teachers train for Shell protest, KING 5 News, Apr. 23, 2015
  • Shell Oil Arctic Drilling Rig Arrives Off Port Angeles, KUOW (NPR) News, Apr. 17, 2015

story:
This Full Length Version of Synthetic Forests and the 4-minute trailer are available at
asilentforest.info


Synthetic Forests, provides an in-depth investigation into the devastating effects GE trees will have on our health and the environment.

The film features interviews with leading scientists and activists who discuss the irreversible impacts genetically engineered trees will have if released into our ecosystems.  The documentary will be a tool that we use together to challenge this destructive technology. It will provide critical, up to date information for viewers familiar with these trees as well as for viewers who are learning about genetically engineered trees for the first time.  To have the maximum global impact, and with your help, Synthetic Forests will be available free online.

A note from Ed Schehl, Director, Raindancer Media:

I have been making environmental documentaries for more than 20 years. When I made Food for Thought in 1998 it was one of the first videos to tell the story of GMO foods and their dangers. Then Raindancer Media, Global Justice Ecology Project, Three Americas and Earth Links came together in 2007 to produce A Silent Forest in which Canadian Scientist David Suzuki passionately and eloquently warned that GE trees could be developed and released if we were not vigilant. Now with GE trees in the ground for testing and the pending release of many genetically engineered tree species for fruit and fuel, it was time to commit to update A Silent Forest and bring its cautionary tale into the present. 

We have a new matching grant of $1,500 that will triple all contributions between $5 and $50 during the final two weeks of our campaign.


"The rush to apply these ideas is absolutely dangerous because we don't have a clue what the long term impacts of our manipulations are going to be..."   Canadian Scientist  Dr. David Suzuki, from our 2007 film, A Silent Forest - The Growing Threat of Genetically Engineered Trees.


Many groups including Global Justice Ecology Project, the Campaign to Stop GE Trees, World Rainforest Movement and The Center for Food Safety have been actively fighting the development and release of GE trees. There are 200 groups in the worldwide Campaign to STOP GE Trees alone. But powerful global forces anticipate massive profits in GE trees and are trying to circumvent sound science and opposition. Corporations in the US and Brazil have requested government authorization to release  hundreds of millions of genetically engineered eucalyptus. Many other species of trees, such as apple, pear and chestnuts are planted in hundreds of test plots around the world and will soon be ready for release as food or fuel if they are not stopped by our informed actions.

Rainforest Action Network, Biofuelwatch  and many other groups have documented the damage that non-GE Eucalyptus Plantations and Palm Oil plantations have created. Our documentary will benefit greatly from the excellent reports provided by The Center for Food Safety and numerous other international groups. Herbicide-resistant GE tree plantations will damage soils, pollute water, increase chemical use, poison wildlife as well as kill birds and beneficial insects. These unnatural ecosystems can also create "Super-pests": insecticide-resistant insects that have few remaining natural predators.

Because trees can be  genetically engineered to grow faster, resist toxic chemicals, and kill insects, they are expected to increase corporate profits as well as expand the number of industrial plantations. Combined, these efforts would bring about the loss of millions of acres of native forests worldwide.  They would be replaced by plantations of cloned trees growing at accelerated rates, devoid of wildlife or understory plants, and rapidly taking nutrients from the soil and diminishing groundwater.

Synthetic Forests will also show, in detail, how GE Eucalyptus and GE Poplar plantations, will accelerate the devastation of indigenous communities. Because many GE tree plantations will likely be placed in tropical forests, the impacts on these on local communities will be especially severe, increasing illegal land grabs and disrupting intimate relationships with native forests and the sustainable economic benefits the forest provides families.

GE Pollen can drift hundreds of miles! 

If communities in the Southeast United States do not learn about, organize and STOP the requested unrestricted release of 500 million GE eucalyptus trees, inhaled pollen could perhaps take away the choice to live GMO free, forever.

Without an informed public genetically modified apples, pears,plums and citrus trees could be unknowingly sold in our markets, just like the unlabeled GE Hawaiian Papaya. Genetically Engineered apple trees being tested in British Columbia, Canada and Washington State could contaminate non-GE trees allowing these GMOs to enter our food supply as well as cripple farmers' ability to ship their crops to other countries.  Organizations working against these developments need as many educated consumers as possible on their side, and the companies funding this GE research, planting these trees now, need to be strongly warned not to proceed.  The more people that understand and educate others about the very real risks of GMOs, the less investment there will be in GE trees.

Presented in English, Spanish and Chinese, hundreds of thousands of people learned about genetically engineered trees while watching A Silent Forest. Now, because of  your donation, millions of viewers will see GE trees for the disaster they are and become empowered to halt them before they can ever become orchards and forests.    

Please make your tax-deductible donation now!

Whether or not you are able to donate, please share a link to our campaign through social media and emails.  

How your contributions will be used for our campaign
We have completed many hours of research and have 12 amazing interviews, but there is much more to do. Your tax-deductible donations will be used to pay for filming, editing and postproduction.  It will also be used for graphics, animation, travel for interviews, and a limited run of DVDs.  These DVDs will be used for distribution to schools from elementary to university, libraries, organizations and individuals.  (Most people will watch the free online version, but we anticipate groups will want to show the film in public forums and will request DVDs).


Photography Credits
Photos for this campaign have been provide by Orin Langelle, Ed Schehl and Creative Commons

 Video Production Updates
Thanks to Dr. Tyrone Hayes from UC Berkeley (pictured below) and Paul Towers from Pesticide Action Network for taking their time to be interviewed and share their research as it relates to pesticides and tree plantations. And our thanks to Hawai'i SEED, and the Center for Food Safety's new office in Hawaii for helping us to complete these new interviews.

Thanks to Three Americas and all the customers at the Farmers' Market in Aptos California who have bought their fairly traded organic coffee and made their donations possible!

Then Raindancer Media, Global Justice Ecology Project, Three Americas and Earth Links came together in 2007 to produce A Silent Forest in which Canadian Scientist David Suzuki passionately and eloquently warned that GE trees could be developed and released if we were not vigilant. Now with GE trees in the ground for testing and the pending release of many genetically engineered tree species for fruit and fuel, it was time to commit to update A Silent Forest and bring its cautionary tale into the present. We have a new matching grant of $1,500 that will triple all contributions between $5 and $50 during the final two weeks of our campaign.


"The rush to apply these ideas is absolutely dangerous because we don't have a clue what the long term impacts of our manipulations are going to be..."   Canadian Scientist  Dr. David Suzuki, from our 2007 film, A Silent Forest - The Growing Threat of Genetically Engineered Trees.
Many groups including Global Justice Ecology Project, the Campaign to Stop GE Trees, World Rainforest Movement and The Center for Food Safety have been actively fighting the development and release of GE trees. There are 200 groups in the worldwide Campaign to STOP GE Trees alone. But powerful global forces anticipate massive profits in GE trees and are trying to circumvent sound science and opposition. Corporations in the US and Brazil have requested government authorization to release  hundreds of millions of genetically engineered eucalyptus. Many other species of trees, such as apple, pear and chestnuts are planted in hundreds of test plots around the world and will soon be ready for release as food or fuel if they are not stopped by our informed actions.


Rainforest Action Network, Biofuelwatch  and many other groups have documented the damage that non-GE Eucalyptus Plantations and Palm Oil plantations have created. Our documentary will benefit greatly from the excellent reports provided by The Center for Food Safety and numerous other international groups. Herbicide-resistant GE tree plantations will damage soils, pollute water, increase chemical use, poison wildlife as well as kill birds and beneficial insects. These unnatural ecosystems can also create "Super-pests": insecticide-resistant insects that have few remaining natural predators.
Because trees can be  genetically engineered to grow faster, resist toxic chemicals, and kill insects, they are expected to increase corporate profits as well as expand the number of industrial plantations. Combined, these efforts would bring about the loss of millions of acres of native forests worldwide.  They would be replaced by plantations of cloned trees growing at accelerated rates, devoid of wildlife or understory plants, and rapidly taking nutrients from the soil and diminishing groundwater. 
Synthetic Forests will also show, in detail, how GE Eucalyptus and GE Poplar plantations, will accelerate the devastation of indigenous communities. Because many GE tree plantations will likely be placed in tropical forests, the impacts on these on local communities will be especially severe, increasing illegal land grabs and disrupting intimate relationships with native forests and the sustainable economic benefits the forest provides families. 

GE Pollen can drift hundreds of miles! 
If communities in the Southeast United States do not learn about, organize and STOP the requested unrestricted release of 500 million GE eucalyptus trees, inhaled pollen could perhaps take away the choice to live GMO free, forever.
Without an informed public genetically modified apples, pears,plums and citrus trees could be unknowingly sold in our markets, just like the unlabeled GE Hawaiian Papaya. Genetically Engineered apple trees being tested in British Columbia, Canada and Washington State could contaminate non-GE trees allowing these GMOs to enter our food supply as well as cripple farmers' ability to ship their crops to other countries.  Organizations working against these developments need as many educated consumers as possible on their side, and the companies funding this GE research, planting these trees now, need to be strongly warned not to proceed.  The more people that understand and educate others about the very real risks of GMOs, the less investment there will be in GE trees.

Presented in English, Spanish and Chinese, hundreds of thousands of people learned about genetically engineered trees while watching A Silent Forest. Now, because of  your donation, millions of viewers will see GE trees for the disaster they are and become empowered to halt them before they can ever become orchards and forests.    
Please make your tax-deductible donation now!
Whether or not you are able to donate, please share a link to our campaign through social media and emails.  
How your contributions will be used for our campaignWe have completed many hours of research and have 12 amazing interviews, but there is much more to do. Your tax-deductible donations will be used to pay for filming, editing and postproduction.  It will also be used for graphics, animation, travel for interviews, and a limited run of DVDs.  These DVDs will be used for distribution to schools from elementary to university, libraries, organizations and individuals.  (Most people will watch the free online version, but we anticipate groups will want to show the film in public forums and will request DVDs).
Photography CreditsPhotos for this campaign have been provide by Orin Langelle, Ed Schehl and Creative Commons
 Video Production UpdatesThanks to Dr. Tyrone Hayes from UC Berkeley (pictured below) and Paul Towers from Pesticide Action Network for taking their time to be interviewed and share their research as it relates to pesticides and tree plantations. And our thanks to Hawai'i SEED, and the Center for Food Safety's new office in Hawaii for helping us to complete these new interviews.

Thanks to Three Americas and all the customers at the Farmers' Market in Aptos California who have bought their fairly traded organic coffee and made their donations possible!

story:
QUICK OVERVIEW:

This campaign was created to prevent an ecological disaster in a little town in Russia called Ostashkov. The city is currently drowning in trash and we decided to put an end to this. Please watch the video above to find out how we plan to do it!

After that, check out our progress:

BTW, Super celebrity supported us! Will you?

https://twitter.com/MarkRuffalo/status/53272624...


Couple of pictures of how it was done! 

==============================================================

THE GOAL HAS BEEN MET! We are very happy and excited to announce that we have collected $15000, all thanks to you! Woohoo! Also, we didn't want to jinx it before, but now its safe to say that a local outdoor media company noticed our project from the very start and agreed to reserve a nice spot and put up a billboard for us before the campaign actually ends! So lets send rays of happiness to those guys as well, even though they decided to stay anonymous ;) In other good news - the billboard is now in the printing phase and is scheduled to appear on the 10th of November! We will let you know about the exact location in a separate post! Lets hope that this works and DiCaprio really sees and likes it (along with our website)! We hope this happens to ensure that the stretch goals to save Ostashkov from an ecological disaster will also be met! Anyways, first things first! Lets wait for a #likefromleo ;)

==============================================================

Guys, you are just amazing! We are only 1,5K away from our dream! We thank each and everyone of you! 

==============================================================

THE STORY

Hi, my name is Artem, I am from Moscow Russia. This summer my friends and I decided to visit lake Seliger where we camped on the outskirts of a town called Ostashkov. We found out that the city is drowning in trash. So I came up with an idea of how to save it!

I designed a simple solution for primary sorting at home - a trash bag that allows for sorting inside your regular trash bin.

THE BILLBOARD

The concept of sorting isn't popular in Russia and this has to change. I decided to change that and in order to do so - I am seeking support of a world famous protector of the environment - Leonardo DiCaprio. If he likes my idea, everybody else will follow suit and Lake Seliger will become a clean place once again!

To get Leo’s attention and explain my idea to him I plan to put up a billboard in LA, where he can actually see it. The billboard will contain a link to my website. This is going to cost $15000 and here is what its gonna look like:



REWARDS:

Your pledges are very important to help this project kick off! To show our gratitude we came up with several reward options and would like to present them to you:


STRETCH GOALS

Getting Leonardo to like my website will allow to get more coverage and therefore - more funding. If that happens, I plan to use that extra money to fund a full scale cleaning initiative in the city of Ostashkov and across all Russia.

Stretch goals include:

When we reach $20000 - educational billboards will be printed and put up in Ostashkov. Also, several lectures will be held in schools

Upon reaching $70000 we will commit to arranging at least 5 sorted waste collection points around Ostashkov.

Reaching $250000 will allow us to upgrade the equipment at the main sorting facility in Ostashkov to increase the output.

If we raise more than $500000 we will be able to launch our own “sorting-at-home” trashbag production line

story:
The ocean is Earth's primary life support system.

The ocean makes 70% of the air we breathe, and the clouds that give us fresh water to drink.  The ocean stabilizes our climate, and supports the life of every living thing on Earth.   Over 1.2 billion people around the world rely on the ocean for their daily source of protein.    

Without the ocean, our planet would look like Mars.

Today our ocean is sick.  Its most productive ecosystems are dying, its coastlines and beaches are being destroyed, and its waters are polluted.   Plastic waste clogs the worlds 5 gyres with an estimated 40 million tons in the Pacific alone.   In the last 100 years - and especially the last 50 - we've lost 90% of the big fish and half the coral reefs.   Sea floors look like war zones, and there are dead zones - vast swaths of ocean that can no longer support life - spreading throughout the marine realm.    While the ocean makes up 70% of the Earth's surface, today a mere 2.8% is under any form of protection.  Only a handful of people around the world are aware that the ocean, our life support system,  is in big trouble.  

There is hope.   We can fix it. Today we possess the scientific ingenuity and expertise to restore fisheries, and to clean up pollution.  We also have the ability to engage global audiences on a vast scale to create markets for alternative products, spark innovation and raise huge sums of money for the ocean.   Right now we are at a sweet spot in time.  What happens in the next 10 years is more vital to the next 10,000 than at any other point in our history.

                   

The Ocean Campaign is a global movement supported by a new generation of passionate individuals, world renowned scientists, and ocean experts who have banded together in order to protect our greatest resource, the ocean.  The Ocean Campaign will:

  • Ignite global awareness
  • Drive behavior change & influence policy
  • Deliver an estimated $1 billion+ to secure marine protected areas by funding the work of a coalition of NGOs - from World Wildlife Fund, Conservation International, Oceana, The Nature Conservancy, Wildlife Conservation Society, Seacology, Mission Blue, Oceanic Society, and many more - around the globe working to place 10% of the ocean under protection by 2020 and 20% by 2030, fund species conservation, and engage in pollution clean up.

Launching globally in May 2015.   We're working now on creating a global brand, building a powerful digital platform, activating sponsors and partners, and creating an engaging public relations strategy to enable us to launch and build the movement and make huge impact for the ocean. 

We need your help.   Funds raised through crowd funding will be used to help us make a sizeable splash, and put major funds into ocean conservation.   

Join the movement and spread the word. Let's make history.

Campaign Committee

Tyler Burrow, William Detwiler, Conrad Dornan, Yves Durif & Valerie Levine, Dr. Sylvia Earle, Bernard Fowler, Nan Hauser, Julian Hoenig, Kevin iro, Jimmy Jagger, Rachid Kallamni, Jack Macdonald & Leah Wood, Mungo Meehan, Topper Mortimer, Rupert Murray, Beth O'Donnell, Hartley Rogers, Josh Reynolds, Alexandra Richards, Sheila Rooney, Andres & Lauren Santo Domingo, Earl Slick, Vito Schnabel, Lynne Volkman, Barry Wacksman, Tyrone Wood

#theoceancampaign

story:
ATTENTION: Please read the recent update for project status!

Pallas’s Fish Eagle

Pallas's Fish Eagle (Haliaeetus leucoryphus) is the most poorly studied eagle within the Northern Hemisphere. Virtually nothing is known about the species' non-breeding habitat requirements. Even worse, there has never been a study examining the seasonal movements of this elusive bird. Prior to the 1900’s, Pallas’s Fish Eagle were common throughout a large portion of Asia, extending west to east from the Caspian Sea to China, and north to south from Russia to India and Myanmar. Now, the species is extinct in Myanmar and along the Caspian Sea. The remaining population is classified as “globally vulnerable” by the International Union for Conservation of Nature’s Species Red List. Mongolia’s population is critically endangered with an estimated thirty breeding pairs in the entire country. Loss of habitat and prey, human disturbance, and agricultural chemicals are believed to be responsible for the severe drop in population over the past 100 years.

The Expedition

This January, myself and a group of local volunteers at the Pinjore Vulture Breeding Center will set out for Harike Barrage in Punjab, the northwest Indian state that shares a border with Pakistan. We will trap these elusive eagles with padded leg traps (tested on human fingers to avoid injuries to the bird) and birdlime, a sticky water-soluble substance placed on a bamboo pole near carcass bait. Birdlime is an effective technique used to capture the Pinjore Breeding Center’s endangered vultures. Upon capture, we will fit Pallas’s Fish Eagles with GPS-PTT Teflon ribbon backpacks designed to fall off after a few years. This will track the birds by Argos satellite systems and allow us to see their location every two hours with an accuracy of up to 10 m.

This following summer I will continue on to Mongolia to repeat the study with the northern population. Please continue to support us as we move on to the second part of the project (www.indiegogo.com/PFE-Mongolia).

The locations collected will allows us to finally understand when the Pallas’s Fish Eagles depart from their nest territories and where they spend the non-breeding season. You can be one of the first to unravel this mystery alongside dedicated researchers from around the world.

To acomplish this expedition, we need your help. Each satellite unit costs $4,000.00 and a year of ARGOS data collection is ~$1,000.00 a year per unit. Our goal is to have a minimum of two transmitters for India and two transmitters for Mongolia. However, the more backpacks we have, the more we'll learn. Additional expenses incurred will also include international travel, in-country travel, trapping materials, and backpack materials. Your support for this project is crucial to its success! Learn alongside us as we explore the Northern Hemisphere's least understood eagle species!

The Researchers

 My name is Marla Steele, a doctoral student majoring in Biology at the University of Arkansas. I am conducting an exciting project under the supervision of Dr. Sundev Gombobaatar (Director of the Mongolian Ornithological Society and head of the Ornithology Lab at the National University of Mongolia) and Dr. Vibhu Prakash (Director of the Pinjore Vulture Breeding Center and former Principal Scientist for the Bombay Natural History Society).

Raptors of the World by James Ferguson-Lees and David Christie initially inspired my interests in this majestic bird. While reading the section on Pallas’s Fish Eagle, I came across something I had never seen before: a home range map covered in question marks. The more I tried to uncover regarding this unusual lack of information, the more apparent it became that this bird remains misunderstood. Its population is dropping at an alarming rate. Unfortunately, we cannot develop an effective conservation plan because we do not even know where it migrates to six months out of the year.

With a new sense of purpose, I contacted my Dr. Sundev Gombobaatar (Dr. Gomboo), whom I met while presenting my undergraduate research on Japanese raptor migration at the Asian Raptor Research and Conservation (ARRCN) meeting in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. He fully supported my interests and we began to plan the study. Upon further reading, I realized that the eagles in the Mongolia and India breed at completely opposite times of the year. Dr. Gomboo and I concluded that the Indian eagles might be a completely separate population with their own unique breeding and migration habits. In order to understand these perplexing differences, we needed help.

 Last January, I completed a few initial surveys of protected national parks in India for Pallas’s Fish Eagles while establishing relations with the park managers. This allowed me to receive permission to enter protected habitat that was inaccessible to the general public and increase awareness of the eagles’ plight. I also met with the Director of the Pinjore Vulture Breeding Center and former Principal Scientist of the Bombay Natural History Society (One of India’s oldest, publishing scientific societies) Dr. Vibhu Prakash. Dr. Prakash studied Indian raptor habitat requirements and Pallas’s Fish Eagle were one of his study species. Upon hearing our proposal, Dr. Prakash agreed to work with us on behalf of the Bombay Natural History Society, thus providing the final integral link to the project. This not only allowed us to create a more thorough study, but also established a new and exciting partnership between four different organizations in three different countries!

 The research is an international partnership between researchers from the University of Arkansas, India’s Bombay Natural History Society, the Mongolian Ornithological Society, and the National University of Mongolia.

story:
2 Years ago my husband and I started a dog rescue. We put our heart and souls into this rescue. Recently a neighbor complained because we have pit bulls. The local shelter came out and told us that we have to get everything up to code and get rid of most of the dogs or they would seize them.

 Now our local shelter kills 71% of everything that comes thru the door. Especially pit bulls. So we have been trying our best to get the dogs adopted out or sent to other rescues. This has raised alot of unexpected expenses. On top of that I was hurt in an accident recently which left me bedridden for awhile and unable to work. We have rarely gotten any donations in these last 2 years and done most everything out of pocket.

Now we are desperate. We have nothing left and are losing our home. If we lose our home before we can get these dogs adopted out they will go to Memphis Animal Shelter and be euthanized.

I have raised these dogs, some of them from puppies, I have nursed their wounds, held them when they were scared, taught them to trust humans again, and mended their broken hearts. I would do anything to keep them from being taken to the pound.

We need $3000 to pay off the mortgage and make the necessary repairs to our home and yard to buy these dogs some time. Because if we are homeless, so are they, and we can't help them if we have nowhere for them to go.

Please, please help if you can. Every dollar, every cent helps more than you could ever know and more than I could ever put into words.
