story:
Utopization - Changing The World

There can be little doubt that the world is currently in a state of turmoil, primarily because of overpopulation, and that this turmoil is likely going to increase in the future. With a population of more than seven billion, and increasing at a rate of more than six million people every month, there will be a greater and greater demand being placed on the finite resources available to satisfy global needs. The world's population is also moving into an era of enhanced awareness of each other, and with this awareness comes a demand for greater equality in the standard of living between nations. No longer will developed nations be able to exploit with impunity the less developed nations of the world, purely to satisfy their own selfish needs. A reckoning is coming, or here.

The overpopulation issue is probably the most serious problem facing us today. While there are many other issues of concern, ranging from global warming and climate change through poverty, freshwater depletion, and civil unrest, it is overpopulation that is the root cause of our turmoil. It is the size of the human population that the earth can support that we must confront, and resolve.

In an attempt to address the issue of global overpopulation and the multitude of problems associated with it, the concept of utopization was developed.  Utopization is an invented word that was fabricated from two words, utopia and civilization, and is intended to reflect the advancement of humankind to societies that are based on the limitations of our planet, and the best behavioural characteristics of our species. Utopization reflects the perfection of human societies in a Utopian World.

Accomplishments To-Date

The concept of utopization was developed by Leonard W. Mottus over a two-year period to address the issue of global overpopulation. Dr. Mottus is a behavioural scientist with extensive experience in multi-disciplinary environmental impact studies. He has also worked in finance, in marketing, and in various other public service businesses.

Concurrent with the development of the utopization strategy, and in order to facilitate explaining the concept, Dr. Mottus wrote the book "Utopization - From Chaos To Utopia". In 482 pages, this book addresses the issue of global overpopulation by providing a perspective of the problem from our historic past, through today, and into the future. Then, a strategy for confronting the problem is presented that will function as a starting point to move us towards a Utopian World.

This book was published in December 2012, and marketing commenced in January 2013.



Over the last two years, this book has been sent to the leaders of 160 nations with small populations, and to several non-governmental organizations (NGOs) and individuals who have a global footprint and are uniquely qualified to participate in this vision for the future.  We have also been active on social media (Facebook and Twitter), expanding an awareness of this program to the global community. Now, it is time to move to the next phase of this program, and to activate a multi-media marketing campaign - the reason for this crowdfunding application.

The Next Step

It is believed that the groundwork for this utopian program has now been set, and that we can proceed to the next phase of this program, as follows:

  • Follow-up communications to the initial 160 nations contacted;

  • Targeted follow-up of select nations, especially those that have a high probability of rapidly becoming a Utopian Nation. Hopefully this will include one-on-one meetings with senior personnel;

  • Pursue a public-speaking campaign, starting locally and expanding as funds and demand dictate; and

  • Commence multi-media marketing using TV and radio presentations, initially in North America and expanding as warranted.

The amount of money we receive from this crowdfunding application will determine how far we can progress on this program. If we reach the identified target of $100,000, we believe that we will be able to successfully establish a utopization mind-set in the global community. If we receive less, we will move the program as far as possible, and try to progress further later. If we receive more, we will accomplish more.

One final point. If we can get one or more nations to commit to this utopian strategy, there will be the need for more money because we will need to establish an official utopian organization. This however is a good thing, because at that point, the world will be on the path towards a better future.

Achieving Utopia

With utopization, the issue of overpopulation will be of critical importance, and it will be confronted head-on.  Today, however, it is virtually ignored, but why?

It is almost inconceivable that there is no widespread concern about the number of people in the world, and the need to do something about it.  Overpopulation issues are everywhere, with extremes in the number and size of slums around the world, famine and unwarranted deaths in many countries, and social unrest and uneasiness everywhere about providing the basic needs for survival.  How can anyone be oblivious to the issue of overpopulation?  This is an unbelievable situation, but it is actually happening today.

That being said, it is not hard to imagine why overpopulation and population control is not given serious consideration by people and nations today.  When it comes to human reproduction and the imposition of some sort of control on breeding behaviour, problems are unavoidable.  Whether through basic human sexual impulses, religious implications, or social necessities, population control is difficult to implement.  This, however, must change.

It is vital that overpopulation be moved to an elevated level of awareness in the global community as soon as possible.  There is no avoiding the fact that when there are too many people placing a demand on limited resources, chaos results.  Overpopulation must be a concern that is recognized by all, for if it is not, the likelihood that an amiable world may be achieved will disappear.  We simply must learn to control our numbers, and utopization may be the way.

Confronting The Challenges

To-date, there has been little progress on finding any leader who will commit to the concept of utopization, in spite of the fact that it is logical, and the right thing to do. It is obvious that the world is in a mess, but nobody is doing anything significant about it. However, we believe that if we can ingrain a few macro factors into the mind-set of decision makers, progress will be. These factors are;

• ACCEPT the fact that we have an overpopulation problem now, and it is increasing;
• ACKNOWLEDGE that man lives within the laws of nature, and that while we may be able to manipulate our place in nature somewhat, we cannot remain aloof forever;
• UNDERSTAND that limited resources do impose limits on populations of all types, including humans;
• LEARN to recognize and appreciate the signs of overpopulation, especially the existence of slums, and the need by a people to rely on foreign aid;
• APPRECIATE that it is possible to attain a good life for all of a nation's people if they live within their means and resources;
• BE PREPARED to start on the journey towards a Utopian World by concentrating on one or more small nations, and then growing by example and through success; and
• DO NOT expect the United Nations or any large nation to come to the rescue. Population control is a contentious issue, and achieving consensus within large groups will be difficult.

These considerations will probably form the backbone for a strategy to address the issue of global overpopulation, and must be integrated into the mind-set of anyone who becomes involved in this utopian program.

Once we acknowledge the macro factors mentioned above, we can move on to understanding the problem before us, and to finding a possible solution. The website www.utopization.com provides an introduction to this issue, and the material in the book "Utopization - From Chaos To Utopia" provides a detailed explanation of what me must/should/could do now (see http://www.utopization.net/books.html). It is time  to control our numbers, and utopization may be the way.

Other Ways You Can Help

If we are going to be successful in introducing the concept of utopization to the world, we need to get the word out. We need to communicate the attributes of the strategy on a global scale, and social media must be aggressively utilized. In this regard, please follow us on Facebook and Twitter and share/retweet our postings. Also, don't forget the Indiegogo share tool. The more exposure we can get, the better.

One final point. As this program develops, we will need to establish a core group of multi-disciplinary professionals to develop the terms and conditions of the program, and to implement it. If you, or someone you know, may be interested in participating in this venture, please complete and submit the form contained in the following link:

http://www.utopization.net/grassroots-participants.html

If we are successful in advancing this program, there will be several positions to be filled, both globally and within  specific countries. Details will be communicated to every grassroots participant in our database when positions become available.
story_txt:
Utopization - Changing The World There can be little doubt that the world is currently in a state of turmoil, primarily because of overpopulation, and that this turmoil is likely going to increase in the future.  With a population of more than seven billion, and increasing at a rate of more than six million people every month, there will be a greater and greater demand being placed on the finite resources available to satisfy global needs.  The world's population is also moving into an era of enhanced awareness of each other, and with this awareness comes a demand for greater equality in the standard of living between nations.  No longer will developed nations be able to exploit with impunity the less developed nations of the world, purely to satisfy their own selfish needs.  A reckoning is coming, or here.
 The overpopulation issue is probably the most serious problem facing us today.  While there are many other issues of concern, ranging from global warming and climate change through poverty, freshwater depletion, and civil unrest, it is overpopulation that is the root cause of our turmoil.  It is the size of the human population that the earth can support that we must confront, and resolve.
 In an attempt to address the issue of global overpopulation and the multitude of problems associated with it, the concept of utopization was developed.  Utopization is an invented word that was fabricated from two words, utopia and civilization, and is intended to reflect the advancement of humankind to societies that are based on the limitations of our planet, and the best behavioural characteristics of our species. Utopization reflects the perfection of human societies in a Utopian World.   Accomplishments To-Date The concept of utopization was developed by Leonard W. Mottus over a two-year period to address the issue of global overpopulation. Dr. Mottus is a behavioural scientist with extensive experience in multi-disciplinary environmental impact studies. He has also worked in finance, in marketing, and in various other public service businesses.
Concurrent with the development of the utopization strategy, and in order to facilitate explaining the concept, Dr. Mottus wrote the book "Utopization - From Chaos To Utopia". In 482 pages, this book addresses the issue of global overpopulation by providing a perspective of the problem from our historic past, through today, and into the future. Then, a strategy for confronting the problem is presented that will function as a starting point to move us towards a Utopian World.
This book was published in December 2012, and marketing commenced in January 2013.



Over the last two years, this book has been sent to the leaders of 160 nations with small populations, and to several non-governmental organizations (NGOs) and individuals who have a global footprint and are uniquely qualified to participate in this vision for the future.  We have also been active on social media (Facebook and Twitter), expanding an awareness of this program to the global community. Now, it is time to move to the next phase of this program, and to activate a multi-media marketing campaign - the reason for this crowdfunding application.
  The Next Step 

It is
believed that the groundwork for this utopian program has now been set, and
that we can proceed to the next phase of this program, as follows:

Follow-up
communications to the initial 160 nations contacted;
Targeted follow-up of select nations, especially those that have a high probability of
rapidly becoming a Utopian Nation. Hopefully this will include one-on-one meetings with senior personnel;
Pursue a
public-speaking campaign, starting locally and expanding as funds and demand
dictate; and
Commence multi-media
marketing using TV and radio presentations, initially in North America and
expanding as warranted.

The amount
of money we receive from this crowdfunding application will determine how far
we can progress on this program. If we reach the identified target of $100,000, we believe
that we will be able to successfully establish a utopization mind-set in the
global community. If we receive less, we will move the program as far as
possible, and try to progress further later. If we receive more, we will
accomplish more.
One final
point. If we can get one or more nations to commit to this utopian strategy,
there will be the need for more money because we will need to establish an
official utopian organization. This however is a good thing, because at that
point, the world will be on the path towards a better future.
Achieving Utopia
With utopization, the issue of
overpopulation will be of critical importance, and it will be confronted
head-on.  Today, however, it is virtually
ignored, but why? 

It is
almost inconceivable that there is no widespread concern about the number of
people in the world, and the need to do something about it.  Overpopulation issues are everywhere, with
extremes in the number and size of slums around the world, famine and
unwarranted deaths in many countries, and social unrest and uneasiness
everywhere about providing the basic needs for survival.  How can anyone be oblivious to the issue of
overpopulation?  This is an unbelievable
situation, but it is actually happening today.
That
being said, it is not hard to imagine why overpopulation and population control
is not given serious consideration by people and nations today.  When it comes to human reproduction and the
imposition of some sort of control on breeding behaviour, problems are
unavoidable.  Whether through basic human
sexual impulses, religious implications, or social necessities, population
control is difficult to implement.  This,
however, must change.
It is
vital that overpopulation be moved to an elevated level of awareness in the
global community as soon as possible. 
There is no avoiding the fact that when there are too many people
placing a demand on limited resources, chaos results.  Overpopulation must be a concern that is
recognized by all, for if it is not, the likelihood that an amiable world may
be achieved will disappear.  We simply must
learn to control our numbers, and utopization may be the way.
Confronting The Challenges 

To-date, there has been little progress on finding any leader who will commit to the concept of utopization, in spite of the fact that it is logical, and the right thing to do. It is obvious that the world is in a mess, but nobody is doing anything significant about it. However, we believe that if we can ingrain a few macro factors into the mind-set of decision makers, progress will be. These factors are;
•	ACCEPT the fact that we have an overpopulation problem now, and it is increasing;•	ACKNOWLEDGE that man lives within the laws of nature, and that while we may be able to manipulate our place in nature somewhat, we cannot remain aloof forever;•	UNDERSTAND that limited resources do impose limits on populations of all types, including humans;•	LEARN to recognize and appreciate the signs of overpopulation, especially the existence of slums, and the need by a people to rely on foreign aid;•	APPRECIATE that it is possible to attain a good life for all of a nation's people if they live within their means and resources;•	BE PREPARED to start on the journey towards a Utopian World by concentrating on one or more small nations, and then growing by example and through success; and•	DO NOT expect the United Nations or any large nation to come to the rescue.  Population control is a contentious issue, and achieving consensus within large groups will be difficult.
 These considerations will probably form the backbone for a strategy to address the issue of global overpopulation, and must be integrated into the mind-set of anyone who becomes involved in this utopian program.
 Once we acknowledge the macro factors mentioned above, we can move on to understanding the problem before us, and to finding a possible solution.  The website www.utopization.com provides an introduction to this issue, and the material in the book "Utopization - From Chaos To Utopia" provides a detailed explanation of what me must/should/could do now (see http://www.utopization.net/books.html). It is time  to control our numbers, and utopization may be the way.

Other Ways You Can Help 
If we are going to be successful in introducing the concept of utopization to the world, we need to get the word out. We need to communicate the attributes of the strategy on a global scale, and social media must be aggressively utilized. In this regard, please follow us on Facebook and Twitter and share/retweet our postings. Also, don't forget the Indiegogo share tool. The more exposure we can get, the better.
One final point. As this program develops, we will need to establish a core group of multi-disciplinary professionals to develop the terms and conditions of the program, and to implement it. If you, or someone you know, may be interested in participating in this venture, please complete and submit the form contained in the following link:
http://www.utopization.net/grassroots-participants.html
If we are successful in advancing this program, there will be several positions to be filled, both globally and within  specific countries. Details will be communicated to every grassroots participant in our database when positions become available.

story:
Let's Be Honest...

We have been tenaciously pursuing higher education for the past few years. Hard work (in the classroom and on the clock), long nights, early mornings, thousands of pages of text and research papers - we're ready to pat ourselves on the back! We want to see our own backyard, the United States. We share a passion for nature and enjoy camping and hiking on a regular basis. We also have a flare for exploration, visiting new cities whenever we have the chance. That being said, experiences are not free. We are simply struggling to fund this dream. But we don't want to just ask you for your money, though; we want to do something meaningful, productive, and helpful to the world around us. For each donation made, we would like to do an act of service, whether it's handcrafting a jewelry item from recyclable material, planting a tree or helping you with your garden, or spending the day at a community service organization of your choice! Help us to not only accomplish our goals but also give back!

The Impact

Most of the money we receive for this campaign will go towards traveling costs and camping fees. We are planning on spending the majority of our time outside, appreciating all of the natural wonders that the United States has to offer, so rest assured that the money we earn is necessary and won't be spent frivolously.

One of the amazing things about your donations is the fact that not only will your money go towards making our dream come true, but it will also go towards a higher cause, whether that be recycling, creating more green space, organizing a community clean-up, or spending a day volunteering. We truly want to pay it forward. All acts of kindness should be rewarded with more acts of kindness, therefore for any amount of money that you donate, we plan to donate some of our time to helping others.

The Roadtrip

From Augusta, GA to the Grand Canyon.
From the Grand Canyon to Los Angeles, CA.
From LA to Yosemite National Park.
From Yosemite to Redwood Forests.
From the Redwood Forests to Seattle, WA.
From Seattle to Yellowstone National Park.
From Yellowstone to Denver, CO.
From Denver back to Augusta, GA.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone has the funds to contribute, but if you would like to help us out, here is something you could do that would make us really happy:

Spread the word! With a click of a button we're on your Facebook page, your Twitter account, Youtube, etc. And with that comes more acknowledgement and possibly more donations.

story:
In the California Sierra Nevada Mountains, one hundred and sixty acres of pristine untouched wilderness is known as Stone Bear. Clear rushing rivers wind through the majestic Mountains providing home to an abundance of wildlife, wildflowers and crystal clear waters. Not only does this land exist wild and undisturbed it also provides a space for community growth since 1999 with an established small eight cabin resort aimed at promoting unity and sustainability. Adults and children share their art, craftsmanship, and ancestral knowledge carrying on traditions that are at risk of being lost. Hand crafting clothing and tools, the community of Stone Bear carries on skills passed down through generations and allows children to grow while at the same time valuing their roots and their strong connection to nature. This sustainable community, acres of wilderness, and gallons of pure running water are in danger of being destroyed.  We need your help to save it!

The Stone Bear Vision:

In response to the changes of the world in the last 15 years, a powerful vision is emerging for a new kind of economic community created from the roots up, based upon the principles of common wealth, compassionate stewardship and evolving peace.

Like most visions worth realizing, this dream is too great for any one person to manage alone, so we call out now for your support.


"You can be alive for a certain amount of time but there is a stark moment when you become awake."


The Land of Stone Bear is a place of abundant water that is as pure as we know. It holds a long history of gathering people to it, dating back to the days of the Native Americans and the Nishinam people. Here they held “Big Times” where they gathered to tell stories in order to build community and to know their neighbors.

The time we are in now needs centers that bring people together to allows individuals to take what they learn back to their own individual homes and develop those relationships in their own communities. The Land of Stone Bear is one of those centers. A positive and constructive contribution to the world, our intention is all hands on deck. Not just on this piece of land and this community, but on the planet and with the youth. We are ready to do what it takes to make sure the Human species continues to live happily on this beautiful planet, and to actively create a world that serves ALL life. Not just human life, but ALL life.


Economic Sustainability

The facility acts as a place for education, workshops and personal development camps, funded through the production of events, gatherings, donations and a membership base to support it.  We are creating an earned income business model that creates revenue while protecting the land and working in a responsible and sustainable way. These revenue streams can be found in the many features of the land like the campsites available on the property, the potential for recreation attractions like music festivals, zip lines, backpacking tours, nature walks, photography and more!  The crystal clear water that flows endlessly through the mountains is a priceless resource and the practice of sustainable farming and permaculture along with many other avenues promise to generate consistent and increasing income. One of the MANY attractions to the land is the Ancestral Technology classes that are offered where individuals can learn ancient techniques of making clothes, tools and working with the earth.

Ancestral skills are integral and primal in our make up. These skills help us deal with the complexities of the modern world and help us slow down and focus on what it is we are  doing. People in todays world are desperate to own technology and not be owned by it; so we offer you a place to disconnect from the constant stress of life and reconnect with something deeper and more valuable than what most people know of today.

Along with the Ancestral Technology classes we have the Creative Nature Club.  This group is there to help people find their creativity in nature and within themselves. How to create things and find the artist within is a very special experience while sharing skills with other to help them develop, or even to develop yourself.

The youth are our future!

When children come out into nature they learn how to interact with the world, to touch and to feel and to root themselves. They learn how to be in a community in a world where communities are fragmented and mysterious. Young people desperately need a place to learn and grow and be nurtured. Especially kids who have been termed out of foster care who need nurturing and mentoring. We strive to create a place for these kids to come and be welcome.


It is not All or None.

It's not that we turn our back to the modern world and have to make everything by hand.  But, the ability to share and have a center like Stone Bear where people can come and play; a sort of primal, practical play. With the full range of the ancestral skills from flint knapping, to building our own tools, to making our own clothing and footwear. That is what Stone Bear is about.


We need to find that wisdom in our species. We seem to have forgotten it. So in a way we are an educational place to create a school of remembrance  to remember our place within the water cycle of earth.

The source and goals of the ancestral skills training is bringing us back to the water within. Building the subtle connection with our self, and our self is really water. Ancestral technology rebuilds that relationship and pulls us out of the earth amnesia we seem to have falling into while reminding us that we are water and there is only one water.

Where there is no water there is no life.


Our ability to remember that and own our responsibility is the goal and the hope of our promise.

-Calling all air, earth, fire and water communities; teachers, students and working visionaries; builders, gardeners, musicians, dancers and change makers.

-Applying philosophies from Ishi to Ostrom; Ghandi to Game Theory.

-Creating the "next best step" Peacevolution community, a highly practical template emerging from our watershed wisdom and applied for the joyful benefit of future generations.

-To live in a land and not destroy it, but to be responsible for our actions and care for it.

“When the blood in your veins returns to the sea, and the earth in your bones returns to the ground, perhaps then you will remember that this land does not belong to you, it is you who belongs to this land.”

Even if you are unable to contribute financially, your support, positive energy and sharing of this campaign is priceless!  Please share this with EVERYONE you know in hopes that they are able to help contribute in their own way to make this amazing vision a reality.

story:
We were given the capacity to speak, think, create, build and help; and I really think that I have't yet used this to my fully capacity and here is my opportunity. Please help me make a difference.

Short Summary

The video above is of a previous project that a charity called Raleigh International has carried out in Nicaragua; this charity runs meaningful sustainability projects around the world which are designed to create a positive impact in the communities they are in. This year, I will be going on a 7 week expedition to Borneo in June to work on community and environmental projects in places where support is needed. 

I will be getting stuck into valuable projects, working in some of Borneo’s most remote villages and will be volunteering on projects to improve the environment, health and educational services, helping to make a real difference. And I will also take part in challenging treks through jungles in Borneo and some open water diving as part of an underwater clean-up. It will genuinely be simple living with sleeping in on the floor, bathing in rivers and access to flushable toilets once every 3 weeks! 

The expedition will cost quite a bit of money, but I'm hoping to raise some of it with your support. I am really excited for this expedition, because I know this charity will allow me to make a genuine difference in people's live. And it will also make a difference to wildlife and endangered species, whose habitats and entire existence has dramatically changed over the past few years because of our impact on the environment.

Your kind contribution will go towards..

  • My flight to Borneo and a flight back home
  • Equipment for projects
  • Food and water for 7 weeks
  • Cost of vaccinations and kit

The Inspiration

Humans are an incredible species, we’re considered to be the most intelligent species on the planet but it seems as though were headed towards unintentionally destroying our own planet. More than 1 billion people lack adequate access to clean drinking water. Throughout the world, 170 million children suffer from malnutrition, more than 100 million never attend school, 230 million have no access to secondary education, and almost 250 million work to pay for their own needs and those of their families.

In terms of wildlife, the oceans are dying in our time; by 2048 all of our fisheries will be dead. Water will become the new oil, nations will soon be going to war over it. 10,000 entire species are wiped out every year, and we are now facing the 6th mass extinction in history. 

This can all be changed by a change of heart and a willingness to make a difference.

The impact

I will be shaving my hair and using any sponsorship money to work towards this cause, as for my hair I will be donating it to a charity called the Little Princess Trust who make wigs for children who have lost theirs to cancer. 

In 2011, Raleigh volunteers built:

·75 eco-sanitation units
·56 sanitation units
·20 bio-gas units
·15 gravity-fed water systems
·9 schools
·9 houses
·5 community centres

Positively benefiting 10,652 people in the communities in which they worked

Thank you for taking the time out to read this and please donate to my cause if you are able, otherwise you support and encouragement is more than enough! 

I know my target seems impossible to meet, but I hope to get some of the way there with your help, please spread the word in any way you can and tell people about my campaign. Hopefully they will be inspired to help!

Hopefully they will be inspired to help!

story:
Hi there!

My name is Natalia Botero and I work with Macuáticos Colombia Foundation, a non-profit organization dedicated to the study and conservation of aquatic mammals in Colombia. Most of our research efforts have focused on humpback whales in the Colombian Pacific, although we also work with several dolphin species and the West Indian Manatee. 

We have been studying this population of humpback whales since 2009 when we first registered seven cetacean species in coastal waters of Tribugá's Gulf as part of an inventory study. Then, in 2013, we monitored the spatial distribution, social and acoustic behavior of the species during the breeding season. An important component of this project was the assessment of the impact of whale watching tourism and vessel traffic on the animals. When commercial or whale watching boats approached the whales, individuals responded elusively 27% of the time; mostly due to an inadequate approach or following maneuvers. 

Although what is depicted by the photograph above may seem like a very exciting experience, this is precisely the kind of whale-tourism interaction that we are trying to prevent. In this case, two surfers jumped off a whale watching boat and into the water with a group of approximately seven whales. This was a competitive group, where several males were competing for a receptive female. In this context, the animals can behave aggressive and quickly change direction, which could have been very dangerous for both the whales and the tourists. 

Now that we have some evidence that whale watching can have some negative effects on the whales that come to Colombia to mate and nurse their young, we need YOUR generous support to help us protect them. We believe that the best way to create a long-lasting conservation effect is to work in association with the local communities. An alliance with the whale watching operators in Tribugá's Gulf will help us achieve our goal to carry on a long-term research program while supporting sustainable economic alternatives for the local communities.


Our main goal:

Evaluate the possibility of integrating scientific research and whale watching tourism in order to support a long term monitoring program focused on humpback whales that will overcome the prevailing information gaps and support alternative economic strategies for the local communities in Tribugá’s Gulf, Colombian Pacific. 

Our specific objectives: 

- Examine the conservation impact of whale watching and artisanal fishing on the behavior and habitat use of wintering humpback whales around Tribugá’s Gulf. 

- Assess the potential use of community based whale watching as a platform for scientific research and environmental education. 

- Describe the patterns of behavior, social structure and spatial distribution of Humpback whales during the breeding season. 

- Associate with the local communities to develop educative and cultural activities that value their traditional knowledge and promote the conservation of natural resources in the region.


How are we going to achieve those goals? 

1. Environmental Education

We will visit the seven villages that comprise Tribugá’s Gulf and develop a series of workshops that will facilitate cooperation between researchers and tourism operators. Additionally, we will complete different environmental education activities, including writing/drawing contests, games, cultural manifestations, beach cleanings, and projection of movies/documentaries. During boat trips, the research team will monitor the type of approach and maneuvers of whale watching vessels. When sighting a group along with another boat(s), the heading and speed, as well as changes in diving pattern and surface behavior, will be recorded to describe the behavioral response of the animals. This information will provide feedback for the workshops that will be implemented with whale watching operators of Tribugá’s Gulf.

2. Boat trips
A minimum of 60 boat surveys will be made during the breeding season of humpback whales (mid June-mid November). Additional trips will also occur opportunistically as researchers will be available to join fishermen and/or whale watching operators.   After sighting a group, the boat will approach until an estimated distance of 100m, behind or parallel to the animals. Information about group size, age classes, surface behavior, diving patterns, heading, position and oceanographic/climatic conditions will be recorded. A single hydrophone will be deployed when the boat is stopped or whenever singers are detected. Photographs of the caudal fin will be taken to complement Macuáticos’s photo-id catalog. Individuals will be classified as part of the same group if they maintain physical proximity and exhibit coordinated surface behavior.

 


How are the funds going to be used?

Your generous contribution will support the successful completion of this project by covering some of the boat surveys (fuel, boat rental, boat driver: US$ 9,000.00), environmental education and community work (on-site travel, office supplies, arts and crafts supplies: US$ 2,000.00), and activities in support of the research team (housing, groceries and food preparation, travel to the field site: US$4,000.00).

Jeez! We realize that is a lot of money! But, something important to keep in mind is that our study area is quite remote and difficult to access, and this ultimately affects fuel prices. Although some of these expenses may be reduced if an alliance with the whale watching operators develops during the season, most of the fuel and boat operator expenses are necessary to describe aspects of the behavior and habitat use of humpback whales during the breeding season.

The expenses projected for environmental education within the local communities are considerably higher when compared to previous years. Materials will be needed for several kinds of events, including office supplies (note pads and writing utensils) and arts and crafts supplies for environmental education with local children (play dough, crayons and construction paper).  

But, don't you think we forgot about you! We have awesome goodies to share with you to show our gratitude! Small contributors will get awesome merchandise from Macuáticos Colombia Foundation including some of our best quality photos, t-shirts, coffee mugs and a sample of the humpback whale song recorded in 2013! In case you are feeling generous, feel free to get excited because the rewards keep getting better! For example, some of the whales included in our photo-ID catalog can be named after you (talk about leaving a legacy in this world...). Also, the one and only  Flip Nicklin, photo expert for National Geographic®, will sign two copies of his book "Among Giants: A life with whales"!!!! Finally, our two "Ultimate Whale Explorers" level contributors will have the chance to join us in the field to see some of the most amazing creatures on the planet in all their glory. Just a fair warning: if you do join us, you may experience a hard time readjusting to a whale-less routine back home. 


What happens if we don't reach our goal?

Life is hard! But, we will make the most out of what we have. Our organization is fully committed to the conservation of marine mammal species in Colombia, mainly by conducting scientific research and engaging in a meaningful cooperation with the local communities. We have made significant progress in the past and now we need your help to consolidate our research program into a long-term study that is going to be more likely to achieve a long-lasting conservation effect in this key location of the breeding area of humpback whales in the Southeastern Pacific. 

 

Sounds great, but why is this important?

Information gaps concerning marine mammals are still common in Colombia, mainly due to focalization of research efforts and the disconnection with local whale watching. While significant progress has been made in Tribugá’s Gulf with previous projects completed by Macuáticos Colombia Foundation; conservation benefits could be greatly enhanced by joining efforts with whale watching tourism. Workshops in the local communities will promote a sustainable balance between economic priorities and conservation needs. Research surveys will provide additional detail on the spatial distribution, social structure, and behavior of humpback whales. This study will facilitate the development of a long-term study platform that will be more likely to have long-lasting conservation benefits. 

Between 2009 and 2013, Macuáticos Colombia Foundation has received support from many organizations and volunteers. Among the international organizations to support our work we highlight the generous contributions of Cetacean Society International, Rufford Small Grants for Nature Conservancy and Idea Wild. Their support has been key to gradually overcome the information gaps about humpback whales and other cetacean species, which ultimately motivates greater conservation benefits. The current project is a step further in the right direction, connecting science and local communities for the benefit of the entire ecosystem. 


Other ways in which you can help us! 

Don't think we are just material girls (and boys!). You can also help our project by sharing this campaign on the social media: Facebook, twitter, google+, you name it! So, please don't forget that even the smallest actions can set a powerful movement in motion!! Thank you for your time and contribution, in whatever shape or form!
story_txt:
Hi there!My name is Natalia Botero and I work with Macuáticos Colombia Foundation, a non-profit organization dedicated to the study and conservation of aquatic mammals in Colombia. Most of our research efforts have focused on humpback whales in the Colombian Pacific, although we also work with several dolphin species and the West Indian Manatee. We have been studying this population of humpback whales since 2009 when we first registered seven cetacean species in coastal waters of Tribugá's Gulf as part of an inventory study. Then, in 2013, we monitored the spatial distribution, social and acoustic behavior of the species during the breeding season. An important component of this project was the assessment of the impact of whale watching tourism and vessel traffic on the animals. When commercial or whale watching boats approached the whales, individuals responded elusively 27% of the time; mostly due to an inadequate approach or following maneuvers. Although what is depicted by the photograph above may seem like a very exciting experience, this is precisely the kind of whale-tourism interaction that we are trying to prevent. In this case, two surfers jumped off a whale watching boat and into the water with a group of approximately seven whales. This was a competitive group, where several males were competing for a receptive female. In this context, the animals can behave aggressive and quickly change direction, which could have been very dangerous for both the whales and the tourists. Now that we have some evidence that whale watching can have some negative effects on the whales that come to Colombia to mate and nurse their young, we need YOUR generous support to help us protect them. We believe that the best way to create a long-lasting conservation effect is to work in association with the local communities. story:
Hello and Happy Holidays!!  The Ufer Family has been waiting 8 long years to move to neighborhood where we can grow and play.  We are so looking forward to feeling  comfortable and giving the kids room to play and feel free to blossom.  We have finally made it and we move the end of January. 

As you know moving expenses can add up with inspections, closing costs, etc.  We are asking for a small donation if you can to our moving fund.  We appreciate you for your help and this summer you can come play at the private beach in our neighborhood and catch some huge fish!!!

Thanks Again for your help!!

The Ufer family of Colorado

story:
My story

My name is Sarah and I am a young mother who has an ecologic vision. I want to share that vision with all the families by creating and offering cloth diaper products and other eco-friendly toys and accessories that are affordable and localy made.

 

It all started when I got pregnant with my first child at the age of 18. I soon realised that cloth diapering wasn`t as accessible to all families and budgets as I thought it would be. My mother in-law, who is a creative sewer offered me to make the cloth diapers for my son and this is when Les p`tites foufounes vertes started. We realised that it was possible to make and sell cloth diapers at more reasonable prices without comprimising quality materials. By being flexible with payments and by offering various options and complete packages we are able reach out to every family with every type of budget. Making cloth diapers and other eco-friendly products accessible for every family is a must and my goal would be to see every single baby cloth diapered.

What we are looking to do here is gather enough money to cover the cost of redoing our website professionaly and maybe if we can get more money then our objective we could be more prepared (adds in newpapers, buying more material to create more products) for our upcoming expositions this summer.

 

Thank you!

 

Sarah

story:
Short Summary

The "Excellent Young Nature Lovers" - a group of grade ten students at Baleni Senior Secondary are creating positive change in their community! They are building a garden at their school and teaching younger students about the environment. The most amazing part... none of these youth have running water, electricity or many of the things we all take for granted. They are so dedicated to their education that some of them walk (no joke) 2-3 hours EACH WAY to get to school.  These youth will blow your minds - they are so inspiring, smart, creative... they have the ability to change the world!

This campaign is raising funds to send these youth on an educational hike through their own backyard (that many of them have never had the opportunity to see). The ThandaMandla (LovePower) Trek for Social Change will bring together educators and youth from around the world to spend 7 days hiking South Africa's Wild Coast and dreaming up brilliant plans for social change. Eco-tourism, leadership, empowerment, English, development, flora, fauna, culture, history, theories of change, love, power ... all will be taught along the way, in a multi-directional flow of education between "educators" and "participants". 

What We Need & What You Get

The money raised by this campaign will go directly to funding this project.  

75% will pay for the food, accommodation and supplies for the youth from Baleni

25% will go towards extra costs, like the support vehicle, and the cost of expenses for volunteers

The more we raise - the more youth we can bring!!! If we raise enough that the 25% needed for the extra costs is covered, then 100% of everything we raise from then on will go towards bringing more youth.

In return for your donation we have dreamt up some FUN perks that we'll offer you as an expression of our gratitude!! Because we truly do appreciate it!

The Impact

FUN Society is a registered Canadian charity and has been creating and delivering youth leadership and education programs for more than five years. We have won various awards for our work, have built everything from the ground up, with very little resources and are extremely passionate about making the world a better place. 

This program expands our reach to have an international impact. 

Pondoland, the area of South Africa where we will be trekking, is a UN Biodiversity hotspot that is like nowhere else on earth. Sadly it is under threat of being strip-mined for titanium. The damaging effects to the environment, culture and health of the local people would be devastating.

 The only way to keep mining out is for eco-tourism to thrive. Because of this, the principal of the local highschool created a tourism program, which the Excellent young nature lovers are part of.

The ThandaMandla trek for social change is a collaborative initiative being organized by FUN Society and Mtentu River Lodge, a small eco-lodge in the nearby community.  

This trek will raise awareness about the dangers of mining this coast, will give these incredible youth the chance to see their own backyard, and will provide a venue for dreaming up brilliant plans for social change.


The vision is for this to become an annual event, drawing more people to see this magnificent coastline and increasing the educational opportunities for local youth. All while building a multi-cultural, multi-generational dialogue on creating meaningful, positive change in this beautiful world. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to support us that is totally cool.  But maybe you could share it with your friends and spread the word about our campaign. 

If you are interested in volunteering with FUN Society, or even interested in joining us on the hike, contact me to chat about it - maia@funsociety.ca

story:
As many of you know I am in Ushuaia, Argentina for the month of January with the Earthship Biotecture Academy, building a self-sustainable demonstration house out of recycled materials. I also hope to travel up to Bolivia in February to volunteer with Conservation International. Lastly, before I head home on my flight out of Peru in March, I am volunteering with Eco-Peru, an organization which focuses on ecologically sustainable development and plans to build an earthship soon to house their center.  Additionally I am using this trip as an independent study research project for the final credits I need to graduate this summer with my degree in International Development at Portland State University.

http://www.earthship.com

http://www.eco-peru.org

http://www.conservation.org/where/south_america/bolivia/

You may also know that I have been studying and practicing permaculture, organic gardening, and plant medicine as well. In an effort to help fund my trip in South America I want to share my love of plants with my friends back in Portland, Oregon through the idea of a CSA style garden starts share!

Whether you just want a few plants in a patio container garden or a big backyard patch, I can get you started. When I get home in March I will be preparing seeds to starts in my greenhouse, and putting together garden starter shares of vegetables, herbs, and flowers. The plants will be distributed over April, May, and June, according to planting dates. Each share will come with plant care instructions, planting charts, and helpful tips. Additionally I am offering more indepth permaculture design consultation as well, teach you about the concepts of Earthship Biotecture, or negotiate a different compensation for your financial contribution towards my trip. 


Ushuaia is the southern most city in the world at the very tip of Tierra del Fuego. A few people from Ushuaia initiated a project to bring the Earthship Biotecture crew here to build an earthship in order to bring inspiration for building methods to handle the immense cold and harsh climate from living so close to Antarctica, as well as experiementing with natural ways to deal with the inadequate infrastructure for sewage water management of the city. As part of this project over 60 people from around the world converged here to learn about earthships and volunteer to construct one for the people of Ushuaia.

Earthships are radically sustainable buildings, constructed with natural and recycled materials such as car tires, soda cans, and glass bottles covered in the earth. The houses utilize passive heating and cooling through capturing solar energy in the biomass structure. They use solar panels and windmills for electicity, and rely on 100% rainwater catchment. The greywater and sewage produced from the house is contained and filtered through a series of planters which treat the water on site. The larger models have full gardens inside the attached greenhouse and are completely self sustainable, off grid, carbon neutral houses. Smaller earthships have been developed and built around the world using the same concepts but more suitable for developing nations and disaster relief shelters. The earthship is the brainchild of famous architect Micheal Reynolds, from Taos, New Mexico. 

So... 

I've spent all of my savings, and maxed out my credit card in order to fund this trip. I've put myself out on a limb because of my desire to learn and my confidence that this is one of the best decisions I've made in my life. I've come to the realization that I don't actually have enough money to accomplish all my goals on this trip, and I may have to cut it short without volunteering in Bolivia and Peru- so I've had to get creative. Hence, my idea to initiate a garden starter share project back in Portland.  My hope is that I can inspire people to grow gardens in trade for financial conributions to help me. 

I have a very meager budget, and I always live and travel very resourcefully. I set my goal at $500, which will help me buy food to prepare and cover some of my accomodations in dormstyle hostels. If I could reach $1000 it would make my trip much more comfortable with a bit of a safety net.

My hopes with this trip to South America is to continue to expand my skills and knowledge, while making connections and exploring options to work in South America in the coming years. My passion is teaching, working with plants, and helping people build resilient self sustainable communities through social equity and ecological stewardship. 

GARDENS!

Last year I buried myself in my garden and took pictures every step of the way. Many of you have seen some of those photos, or have been to my house and know my love of plants.  I want to share this love with you.  The garden shares will be distributed in 3 parts in early April, May, and June for staggered planting dates according to cool and warm weather vegetables.

However, I understand people my feel inspired to contribute to this cause, but do not have the time to tend a garden, so I have included alternate options for each level of contribution.  I am also open to further trade, so if you have an idea email me with a proposal and contribution level and we'll figure something out.

Also if you can't contribute financially, you can always help out by sharing this page with others.

Thank you so much for even reading this far!

The greywater and sewage produced from the house is contained and filtered through a series of planters which treat the water on site. The larger models have full gardens inside the attached greenhouse and are completely self sustainable, off grid, carbon neutral houses. Smaller earthships have been developed and built around the world using the same concepts but more suitable for developing nations and disaster relief shelters. The earthship is the brainchild of famous architect Micheal Reynolds, from Taos, New Mexico. So... I've spent all of my savings, and maxed out my credit card in order to fund this trip. I've put myself out on a limb because of my desire to learn and my confidence that this is one of the best decisions I've made in my life. I've come to the realization that I don't actually have enough money to accomplish all my goals on this trip, and I may have to cut it short without volunteering in Bolivia and Peru- so I've had to get creative. Hence, my idea to initiate a garden starter share project back in Portland.  My hope is that I can inspire people to grow gardens in trade for financial conributions to help me. I have a very meager budget, and I always live and travel very resourcefully. I set my goal at $500, which will help me buy food to prepare and cover some of my accomodations in dormstyle hostels. If I could reach $1000 it would make my trip much more comfortable with a bit of a safety net.My hopes with this trip to South America is to continue to expand my skills and knowledge, while making connections and exploring options to work in South America in the coming years. My passion is teaching, working with plants, and helping people build resilient self sustainable communities through social equity and ecological stewardship. GARDENS!Last year I buried myself in my garden and took pictures every step of the way. Many of you have seen some of those photos, or have been to my house and know my love of plants.  I want to share this love with you.  The garden shares will be distributed in 3 parts in early April, May, and June for staggered planting dates according to cool and warm weather vegetables.However, I understand people my feel inspired to contribute to this cause, but do not have the time to tend a garden, so I have included alternate options for each level of contribution.  I am also open to further trade, so if you have an idea email me with a proposal and contribution level and we'll figure something out.Also if you can't contribute financially, you can always help out by sharing this page with others.Thank you so much for even reading this far!

story:
FINAL CAMPAIGN UPDATE
Did you miss your chance to contribute to the Long Eddy river access through Indiegogo? The Conservancy is still raising money for the project--if you wish to contribute, just visit www.DelawareHighlands.org and click "Donate Now," send an email to info@delawarehighlands.org, or call us at 845-583-1010.

UPDATE 11/19
We are thrilled to announce that we have reached our initial goal of raising $5,000 for Long Eddy--but we're not finished yet! We have a new challenge from a generous donor! If we're able to beat our goal by another $1,000 (reaching $6,000 total), these contributions will be matched by an additional $1,000 donation! This means every dollar contributed toward this new goal will have double the impact.

What's the Story?

When we were out kayaking recently, we counted nine bald eagles, a great blue heron, and a kingfisher. Fish were jumping, and the rolling hills and valleys around us were lit up with the vibrant foliage of the season. We're all so lucky to call the Upper Delaware River region home, whether we live here year-round or look forward to our visits. And part of what makes us all so lucky is being able to access the river safely and easily.

Don't take our word for it, though. We asked Jeff Graff, an avid fly fisherman, for his thoughts:

"The Delaware River is a truly amazing natural resource and a fly fisherman’s dream.  It’s clear, clean  waters flow over cobble bottom long eddies and riffles that meander through the ancient, dark hills and hardwood forests of southern New York and northeastern Pennsylvania and hold abundant populations of healthy, wild rainbow and brown trout. Its prolific aquatic insect hatches of mayflies, caddis flies and stoneflies provide some of the best and most challenging fly fishing opportunities for  fisherman  in the United States.  

Creating and maintaining access to the river is essential, not only to fishermen interested in ensuring that the fishery remains vital and accessible to drift boats and wade fishermen, but also to other recreational users of the river such as canoeists and kayakers."

Which brings us to our point: The Long Eddy river access site in Sullivan County, NY needs some help. 


What Do We Need?

 The Conservancy needs your support to allow us to purchase the Long Eddy river access and boat launch in the town of Fremont, NY in Sullivan County and to make improvements to the site.

  • $20,000 will help us cover our out-of-pocket costs for purchasing the property, which will then be transferred to the New York State Department of Conservation for improvements and ongoing maintenance. But $5,000 will get us off to a great start (and we love to reach a goal)!
  • Every dollar you donate will go directly to the project, whether or not we reach our entire $20,000 goal. YOU are contributing directly to your community--and to the local businesses that will benefit from more tourism dollars as folks take advantage of the river access. (Who wants to join us for a paddle from Buckingham to Long Eddy?) 
  • Read our press release.

Who Are We?

The Delaware Highlands Conservancy, a nonprofit land trust in the Upper Delaware River region, works in partnership with landowners and communities in New York and Pennsylvania to conserve our natural heritage and quality of life. We've protected more than 14,000 acres of land to date, are members of the Better Business Bureau, and a nationally accredited land trust with the Land Trust Alliance.  We meet national standards for excellence and for upholding the public trust, and have the expertise and sound ethics to assure conservation solutions work well in ways best suited for our region. We even made a movie about it:


The Sullivan County Division of Planning has identified the need to improve this access as part of their Local Waterfront Revitalization Program. It is an important site for fishermen, fishing guides, river outfitters, boaters, and other river users. Purchasing and improving this parcel would give residents and visitors to our region much-needed improved access and easier parking, and would bring positive economic benefits to Long Eddy, the town of Fremont, and the whole river corridor. Open Space Institute is helping with a zero interest loan for a portion of the purchase (www.osiny.org).

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us get the word out about our campaign! Share our Indiegogo page, our Facebook page at http://www.facebook.com/DelawareHighlandsConservancy, or learn more about us on the web at http://www.DelawareHighlands.org.

Did you enjoy the short films? Find more of Christopher King's work at http://www.endless-echo.com.

story:
HELP MAKE OUR WORLD BETTER!

We can’t wait any longer it’s time to start the process of turning things around. Even if you read no further, the video should have convinced you: that Green buildings save money, is healthy for our environment and will create Millions of Jobs. With your help we can build a strong company that will be at the forefront of helping to rebuild our climate. We intend to make it our goal to inform, help get financing in place, connect all the certified contractors with owners and build a website that can make this entire process seamless.

Too often taxpayers who could benefit from the deductions and credits might not be aware of them, and in most cases are missing out on substantial savings that are available to remodel existing homes and workplaces to save energy and, as a bonus, get most of the work funded by the Federal Government; while at the same time help heal our planet.

Our company will make all this possible, while making connections with numerous funding sources for green building including grants, tax-credits, loans, or others; which are available at the national, state, and local levels. There is more than $23billion dollars available to help fund this aggressive venture and we would like to show America how to access it.

We will link the client with the applications to obtain such funding; link them to a list of certified contractors in their area; as well as, offer partnerships where those who partner with us can sign up people in their area that are eligible to get any of our services . 

Our company promotes Smart Growth, which relates to sustainable development that serves the economy, the community, and the environment by reducing waste, emissions and consumes less energy than conventional building standard practices.  This will support healthy communities while creating economic development and jobs. Our goal is to infuse technology with nature while on a mission to help heal our planet.

Did you know…?

The rate of Global Warming is not a natural occurrence, but it is the result of human activity?

For example:

The amount of sewage Americans dump into their waters (16 tons) every minute of every day.

The number of plastic bottles thrown away by Americans every hour is 2.5 million.

U.S. buildings contribute to 38.1% of the nation’s total carbon dioxide emissions.

The development of clean energy, including solar wind, and geothermal energy helps reduce the trend of global warming and its effect on the atmosphere and reduce the overall impact on our environment, on human health and the economy.

All funding raised will help us  launch our program in early 2015.  100% of the funding we receive will go directly to developing and launching this project and help you incorporate green building concepts into your home and buildings.

We are running out of time to turn things around…. Contribute Today!!!!!

Our goal is to raise the consciousness of the homeowner to address the issues of planetary survival.  We will show homeowners and building owners how to treat their property as a “SYSTEM” by becoming 50% more efficient, cut the cost of their utility bills drastically and help maintain the natural ecological balance in the environment.

Our total fundraising goal is $150,000 (by February 2015). 

Timeline: Goal is to launch in Spring  2015.

Your contribution will help us to build our program for launch.  We need the following:

    • Graphic Designer to design our Website

    • Website Architect

    • Program Development

    • Application Developer/Programmer

    • Outreach and Implementation Team

    • 24hr Call center

    • Internet security

    • Research Team

    • Licenses/Bond/Insurance

    • International Registrations

    • Office equipment

    • Lawyer Retention

    • Advertisement

Phase 1:  Build general website for launch.  

Phase 2:  Develop materials and outreach plan for the launch.

Phase 3: Create a Call Center

Phase 4: Develop a research team

Phase 5: Launch Party

Phase 6: Start signing up customers

Your contribution will help us with Phases 1thru 6, the building and launching of our program.  Even if we don’t reach our goal here, we will be moving forward and building our program, however it will take us longer.

We don’t have time to wait……, so please contribute whatever you can and help us spread the word.  We are on a mission to healing our planet.

We look forward to hearing from you and working together to make our project a success!!

Feel free to send us any ideas that may help us get the word out and how we can help Americans start saving the planet and start saving money.

LET'S LEAVE A CLEAN PLANET FOR OUR CHILDRENS' CHILDREN!!

story:
On April 11th, we plan to bring 1,000 students and young people to Augusta to demand an economy that works for people and the planet. We are calling this action Generation Climate Rising.

Maine Students for Climate Justice is a coalition of climate justice groups from schools across Maine. As a coalition, we aim to elevate the voices of youth in the climate dialogue by sharing resources and taking collective action. We believe that all real solutions to climate change must address the systemic inequities currently present in our energy system, which lead to the disproportionate impact of toxic industries on low income communities, indigenous communities, and communities of color.

We are calling for no new fossil fuel infrastructure to be built in the state of Maine. Climate change already harms residents in Maine, especially those reliant on the marine, agricultural and winter industries. Globally, indigenous people and people of color are most directly impacted by the human rights abuses of the fossil fuel industry. People all around the world are resisting extreme energy extraction related to fossil fuels. The youth of Maine stand with these impacted communities, and together we will win a fossil free future. 

Help us spread this vision throughout the state. Your donation will help us support students of all economic backgrounds to participate in our event through travel support. It will also help us cover the costs of organizing.

story:
The annual “Willamette River Clean Up and Summer River Float Celebration” event will be on July 18th, 2015. Our 2014 River Events were again a tremendous success, in great part due to the generous support of our sponsors. The funds that are raised are used to promote and maintain the Willamette River’s salmon, trout, and wood ducks. We need your support to continue our projects and help the other organizations that are also working to improve the urban streams and the Willamette River.


Our past donations include:  

  • Gift Cards donation from the Mo’s Family Restaurant

  • Oregon Freeze Dry

  • Kraft Foods

  • Oregon State University

  • Natural Grocers

  • Ninkasi  

  • McMenamins Corvallis

  • Coffee Culture Partnership

  • StarBucks Corvallis Volunteers

  • and many other local venues!


In 2014, we participated and held events and education workshops that:

  • Promoted stewardship and education

  • Cleaned up Oregon beaches

  • Restored urban stream habitats

Examples:

  • Gardening with Mushrooms Workshop conference

  • Partnered with over 200 Girl Scouts Troops for the stewardship and education event

  • World Oceans Day, June, 2014

  • Recruited over 40 volunteers

  • Let's Preserve canning workshop

  • Bee education and pollinator awareness workshop to help save the bees

  • More than 130 pounds of waste were removed from Oregon beaches

  • Gene Whisnant, District 53 Representative joined the effort in full support of the education that was taking place at World Oceans Day! 

  • The Sequoia Creek Restoration Project

  • Media coverage reached over thousands of State & City newspapers all around the World!


In 2015, we will continue to clean up urban streams, restore habitats, and promote environmental stewardship and education.

We need your support to advance our effort.

  • A $5,000 donation to the Planting Trees to bring back the stream Canopy, for Temperature control.  

  • A $5,000 donation to help Plant Native Plants to help restore the Chinook Salmon, Microorganisms, and Wood Ducks

  • A $2,000 donation to help repair stream banks, litter removal, mycoremediation, fungi strategies, and soil testing.

  • A $1,000 donation to help with advertising like t-shirts, posters, gloves, boots, and administration fees.

  • A $500 donation to help with kayak giveaway raffle, and other door prizes

  • A $100 donation to help with feeding our volunteers

  • $50.00 A name your own donation, or favorite stream

  • $50.00 A donation to associate your name to the streams you support


Organization Background:

The Ocean Blue Project Foundation has recently evolved from Planting Seeds Inc which was formed on July 3, 2002. We are a state registered 501(c)3 nonprofit organization. Corporate donations of merchandise, gift certificates, cash and discontinued merchandise are vital to our auction! It’s a great opportunity to market new products and we make sure our donors are well mentioned throughout the auction. We again expect attendance to approach 500 Stewards of Oregon.

As our auction has grown, so has the variety of items available. In addition to equipment for the stream, we offer youth education, mushroom kits, shirts, reusable cups, gift certificates and more. We would very much appreciate your support in helping maintain and promote the Mill Race Creek, Sequoia Creek, Dixon Creek, and the Willamette River. Together We Have The Power To Save The Fish Habitat in the Streams.

Dear Supporter, 

I am pleased to submit this proposal for general operating support for Ocean Blue Project. We are a registered 501(c)3 nonprofit benefit corporation. We would not be the non-profit organization that we are today without the rivers, urban streams and Oregon beaches! We will continue to give back for the rest of our life what the rivers have already given us. 

We are deeply grateful for all the community and media support that enables us to continue our work with our Oregon Beaches, Rivers, and Urban Streams. Our volunteer base has grown more than we expected and we are now able to clean up more rivers at a faster pace.

Our mission is to foster connections between communities, science and nature, so that together we can protect urban streams, rivers, and ultimately, the world's oceans. We are currently operating at the scale of 40 events a year, with more than 200 volunteers, and covering thousands of acres of streams.

Although our resources are limited, we make the greatest possible impact. We have restored habitats for Oregon native plants and species, such as ducks and bees. Every year, we reach out to schools to teach children about our streams. We initiate internship programs with Oregon State University to further their research endeavors.

We have seen tremendous evidence of our impact in our streams and communities over the past four years. We have only begun to realize our organization’s potential in helping the environment.

Thank you for considering this significant investment in OBP.

Sincerely,

Richard Arterbury, President

story:
What We're Doing

My wife and I decided to build a carriage house for my brother (Jordan in the picture) who is an adult with disability. We want to provide him with the independence of his own building, while being available as caregivers.

Once we decided to build this for Jordan we knew that we wanted to do it in as sustainable a fashion as possible. Some of the initiatives that we are incorporating in to this project:

  • Composting Toilet (don't judge)
  • Earth Tubes (heating/cooling system using pipes buried in the earth)
  • Rainwater Harvesting (for laundry, irrigation, and the dishwasher)
  • Super Insulated Envelope (double thick walls, and triple pane windows)

You can read a little more about the thought process behind the different green technologies that we're using here

But there is one more piece that we need help with in order to fund...

Solar Panels!

Part of trying to make this a NetZeroEnergy building is installing solar panels to compensate Jordan's energy needs.

Right now it costs approximately $800 to install a solar panel and our goal (for now) is to install 12 panels. This would cost us about $9,600. 

If we can not install all 12 to start, we will put in as many as this funding allows us. The roof that we have built can accommodate at least 24 panels and the beauty of this product is that we can install more as we get a better understanding of how much energy Jordan needs and as we can afford to add them.

What It Means in the Community

While our initial motivation for this project was family, we always knew that green building would be an important part of this undertaking. I was surprised to find that there has not been more of this kind of building in our province, British Columbia.

With the help of En Circle Design Build Inc this building is only the 8th project registered for the demanding Living Building Challenge. The Living Building Challenge is the most advanced green building certification program in the world. Buildings and neighbourhood’s that meet the challenge must demonstrate that their project is, among other things, NetZeroEnergy, NetZeroWater, contains no bio-accumulative toxins, promotes healthy living, and is beautiful.

Our hope is that the visibility of this project will make green building a little less "weird" for people and a little more attainable.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't help with cash, we absolutely appreciate your interest. If you know of anyone who you think is interested in this subject, spread the word! I'm also keen to connect with anyone in the media who shares an interest in this field.

Thank you for taking the time to read this.
story_txt:
What We're Doing My wife and I decided to build a carriage house for my brother (Jordan in the picture) who is an adult with disability. We want to provide him with the independence of his own building, while being available as caregivers.
Once we decided to build this for Jordan we knew that we wanted to do it in as sustainable a fashion as possible. Some of the initiatives that we are incorporating in to this project:



Composting Toilet (don't judge)

Earth Tubes (heating/cooling system using pipes buried in the earth)
Rainwater Harvesting (for laundry, irrigation, and the dishwasher)
Super Insulated Envelope (double thick walls, and triple pane windows)

You can read a little more about the thought process behind the different green technologies that we're using here
But there is one more piece that we need help with in order to fund...   Solar Panels! Part of trying to make this a NetZeroEnergy building is installing solar panels to compensate Jordan's energy needs.
Right now it costs approximately $800 to install a solar panel and our goal (for now) is to install 12 panels. This would cost us about $9,600. 
If we can not install all 12 to start, we will put in as many as this funding allows us. The roof that we have built can accommodate at least 24 panels and the beauty of this product is that we can install more as we get a better understanding of how much energy Jordan needs and as we can afford to add them.
 
  What It Means in the Community While our initial motivation for this project was family, we always knew that green building would be an important part of this undertaking. I was surprised to find that there has not been more of this kind of building in our province, British Columbia.
With the help of En Circle Design Build Inc this building is only the 8th project registered for the demanding Living Building Challenge. The Living Building Challenge is the most advanced green building certification program in the world. Buildings and neighbourhood’s that meet the challenge must demonstrate that their project is, among other things, NetZeroEnergy, NetZeroWater, contains no bio-accumulative toxins, promotes healthy living, and is beautiful.
Our hope is that the visibility of this project will make green building a little less "weird" for people and a little more attainable.

 
  Other Ways You Can Help Even if you can't help with cash, we absolutely appreciate your interest. If you know of anyone who you think is interested in this subject, spread the word! I'm also keen to connect with anyone in the media who shares an interest in this field.
Thank you for taking the time to read this.

story: As we roll into the summer months in Saudi Arabia, temperatures reach as high as 125 Degrees farenheight! There is nothing to do except stay inside. My goal is that people donate a measly 1$ to fund my entertainment over the summer. This may go to exercise machines to even video games, all i'm hoping to do is have a good summer. The reason I am here in Saudi is due to my parents... There is barely anyone to play with! Reaching this goal would also allow greater contact between me and my relatives, as well as my friends back home. Leaving me with a fun summer!
