story:
English:


The aims of the Foundation Cosmomímesis are in the social, cultural and environmental fields, looking for a balance that improves the quality of life for men, women and nature.


We are a non profit organization, developing educational, reforestation and environmental projects, among other topics of vital importance nowdays, in order to spread, share knowledge and promote awareness and participation regarding to this areas. 


To accomplish our goals, we rely on the dialogue between different kind of knowledges, participation and practical learning, through workshops, comunitarian work days and talks in Bogotá city and its surroundings. To learn more about our work visit us in Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Fundaci%C3%B3n-C...


Spanish: 
Los fines de la Fundación Cosmomímesis, son de interés social, cultural y ambiental donde se encuentre un equilibrio para el mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de hombre y naturaleza.


Somos una organización sin ánimo de lucro, que desarrolla proyectos comunitarios y educativos en las áreas de educación ambiental, reforestación, alimentación sana y otras temáticas que consideramos de vital importancia en la actualidad, a fin de difundir, transmitir y generar conocimiento, sensibilidad y participación en la sociedad frente a estas áreas. Ello, partiendo del diálogo de saberes y la práctica, mediante desarrollo de talleres, charlas, proyectos y jornadas de trabajo comunitario en diferentes zonas de Bogotá y sus alrededores.
story_txt:
English:
The aims of the Foundation Cosmomímesis are in the social, cultural and environmental fields, looking for a balance that improves the quality of life for men, women and nature.

We are a non profit organization, developing educational, reforestation and environmental projects, among other topics of vital importance nowdays, in order to spread, share knowledge and promote awareness and participation regarding to this areas. 

To accomplish our goals, we rely on the dialogue between different kind of knowledges, participation and practical learning, through workshops, comunitarian work days and talks in Bogotá city and its surroundings. 

To learn more about our work visit us in Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Fundaci%C3%B3n-C...
Spanish: 
Los fines de la Fundación Cosmomímesis, son de interés social, cultural y ambiental donde se encuentre un equilibrio para el mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de hombre y naturaleza.

Somos una organización sin ánimo de lucro, que desarrolla proyectos comunitarios y educativos en las áreas de educación ambiental, reforestación, alimentación sana y otras temáticas que consideramos de vital importancia en la actualidad, a fin de difundir, transmitir y generar conocimiento, sensibilidad y participación en la sociedad frente a estas áreas. Ello, partiendo del diálogo de saberes y la práctica, mediante desarrollo de talleres, charlas, proyectos y jornadas de trabajo comunitario en diferentes zonas de Bogotá y sus alrededores.

story:
Act Now! Justice for Africa!

For youth in Africa, this is a time of extreme environmental crisis, continuing exploitation of land and resources, and severe pollution exported from other countries. Africa has also faced some of the most devastating weather anomalies in recent decades.

Preventing this devastation is closely linked to decisions made at a global level, and we must act now! This is why we believe it is vital to strengthen the African Youth Voice and African participation as a whole at the UN Earth Summit in June.

Alpha from Kenya, James from Malawi, and Njideka from Nigeria, in the video above, have the opportunity to participate at the Rio+20 Summit and side events, including the Peace Child World Youth Congress, so please help us raise money for our travel costs, and give us the chance to speak out for the Future We Want!


Why should we go to the United Nations Earth Summit?

In order to influence our key political leaders and decision-makers, the powerful people-stories and impacts to human life must break through the coporate lobbying and vested interests steering the process so far:

Our livelihoods and access to basic food and water are diminishing at a very scary rate, and since Africa is the world's youngest continent, we are the largest group affected - young people under the age of 30 (who make up 70% of the population of Africa).

June wiil be a key turning point in Earth history, where serious decisions about our future on this planet will be taken. 

The conference is popularly known as Rio+20, 20 years on from the pivotal 1992 Earth Summit, which led to conventions on Biodiversity, Climate Change, Deserts and Forests.

By supporting us in our fundraising, you can help us change the game at Rio, and make sure that the world's poorest have a place at the table and a voice in these international negotiations. Thank you so much!

  

Who we are & What we need...

We're all young activists and campaigners in our own contexts, so we're doing our utmost to collect donations for our expenses once in Rio. So our key ask from this fundraising page is for you to contribute to the costs of our flights:


Alpha works with the Kenyan Youth Climate Network, CWS youth and Communication for Change, as well as water & tree-planting projects.

Nairobi, Kenya --> Rio, Brazil = $1995 (USD) or ~£1230 GBP

 

 

Njideka is Postgraduate student of Environmental Management and WASH project Officer at Bread of Life Development Foundation.

Lagos, Nigeria --> Rio, Brazil = $1890 (USD) or ~£1160 GBP

 

 

James is a Country Director for Advocacy Initiative for Development (AID), and works on the everychild project and sustainable forestry.

Lilingwe, Malawi --> Rio, Brazil = $2515 (USD) or ~ £1550 GBP 
 
 
 

What we'll be doing...

The World Youth Congress runs from 4-13th June, then we'll be taking part in the Youth Blast! - a massive mobilisation and global networking event for global youth to share ideas and projects. After that the People's Summit will bring together thousands of activists and NGOs from around the world from 15th-23rd June, focussing in around the final UN negotiating days (20-22nd June).

We'll be joining in side events, workshops & demonstrations throughout the time in Rio, making sure that world leaders form the 192 member states hear the voice of the African youth!
 

Please give what you can and help us spread the word!

This is a real chance for youth in developed and developing countries to connect, to develop new friendships and work together for the future we want. If you're an activist in the global North, we'd love your support if you could send this fundraising call our to your networks, we'd be so grateful! If 200 people can donate $20 dollars, we are there! Please email, tell your friends, family and work colleagues, and help us in a united call for global justice at the 2012 UN Earth Summit.

Thank you so much!

story:
Who we are and what we do

The Tethys Research Institute is a non-profit research organisation supporting marine conservation through science and public awareness, founded in 1986 and headquartered at the Civic Aquarium of Milano, Italy. Tethys’ main goal is the conservation of the marine environment, achieved through the provision of scientific knowledge to conservation policy, the participation in the international conservation process, and public awareness.

In 1991 the Tethys launched the Ionian Dolphin Project (IDP) in the Inner Ionian Sea Archipelago (Greece), initially intended to be a long-term investigation of the ecology and behaviour of common dolphins in one of the species’ few remaining Mediterranean strongholds. During the ensuing decades the study documented the common dolphins’ sharp decline, in contrast to the more or less stable condition of the more adaptable bottlenose dolphins, and the presence of monk seal hotspots having a Mediterranean importance.

At the Ionian Dolphin Project, we aim to ensure the long-term viability of marine mammal species living in coastal waters of the eastern Ionian Sea. Our research is providing support to marine mammal conservation efforts, through actions including:

  • continued monitoring of dolphin groups and monk seals through field research methods including boat surveys and individual photo-identification, to detect population trends and identify critical habitat;
  • research on factors threatening the local ecosystems, particularly excessive fishing;
  • public awareness, education and capacity building initiatives (e.g. involvement of a large number of students and volunteers, dolphin events organised locally, public presentations, lectures at local schools, production of multimedia);
  • contacts and meetings with the local Authorities and fishermen organisations, aimed to raise awareness on the need of establishing measures to protect these charismatic species and implement existing regulations (e.g. to prevent illegal fishing);
  • dissemination of information in the scientific literature and delivery of management proposals to international agreements and bodies concerned with the protection of marine biodiversity.

A new research boat, will secure the ideal research platform for (at least) the next decade. We will be able to increase our research effort and coverage in areas where reports, collected through the IDP website (http://ioniandolphinproject.org), indicate important concentrations of marine mammals.

 

What We Need & What You Get

YOU can help us. We think that our work can make an important difference, but costs money. As a small non-governmental organization, we rely on the generous support received from people like you to sustain our important research and conservation efforts. We will be grateful for any donation, whether big or small. Any donation will make the difference. 

Funds raised through this crowd funding initiative will be dedicated to the acquisition of a new 7-m long rigid-inflatable boat equipped with a 200 HP 4-strokes outboard engine.

We have prepared a few perks for those of you contributing to this crowdfunding. Do not forget to claim them so you can get them immediately in your mailboxes in June. THANKS IN ADVANCE!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

May be you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help us:

Please, get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

Use the Indiegogo share tools!

ONCE AGAIN, THANKS A LOT FOR YOUR TIME AND FOR YOUR GENEROSITY.

story:
*UPDATE:  Thanks to our amazing community of supporters, we've officially passed our original goal of $10,000! That's double great news because it means we now qualify for an extension to keep this page up for longer. Help us reach $15,000 so we can fight even harder in 2020! 

----------

We just blocked a ship full of tar sands pipe, and we need your help to keep fighting!

In the early morning hours of November 5th, we took to the frigid waters of the Columbia River under the cover of darkness, blocking the arrival of a 24,000 ton ship carrying pipe for construction of the Trans Mountain Pipeline Expansion. Joined by our allies, we shut down the Port of Vancouver, WA for the better part of a day with a team of 25 kayakers, several small craft, and 7 brave climbers who chained themselves to the pier, forcing the ship to temporarily dock elsewhere, causing major subsequent delays for the shipment. 5 activists were eventually arrested.

 

This fight is far from over. That’s why we need your support so we can continue taking action. As a grassroots organization, it took nearly all the resources we had to make this action happen, but we refuse to stop! 

The Trans Mountain Pipeline Expansion is a blatant violation of indigenous sovereignty, directly threatening coastal communities and the stability of our global climate. If completed, the project would move an additional 590,000 barrels of tar sands crude every day, increasing oil tanker traffic in the Salish Sea by 700% and emitting 15 billion metric tons of climate pollution every year. Put simply: TMX must be stopped. 

Help us reach and exceed our goal of $10,000 so we can keep escalating the fight against Trans Mountain, and continue working to build a powerful grassroots movement for climate justice. 

Who We Are

The Mosquito Fleet is a regional network of activists fighting for climate justice and a fossil-free Salish Sea through creative on-water direct action and grassroots movement building. We're working to build a broad-based international resistance movement by directly confronting business as usual and supporting frontline communities with the tools to take action. 

What We Need

As a grassroots volunteer network, we do what we can with very limited resources, all of which go directly into our work. We put nearly all our resources into making this action happen, and we're currently stretched too thin to do all we're determined to accomplish in the coming months. In addition to paying for jail support expenses for the Patagonia 5 (arrested at our latest action), we need to repair boats, replace and repair lost and damaged equipment, winterize the Fleet with cold-weather safety gear, train new activists, and build our organizing capacity on the ground for upcoming actions.  And remember, your donation is tax-deductible, so please give generously!

Press

Young Climate Activists Chain Selves to Washington Pier Amid Pipeline Delivery, The Guardian, November 2019

Activists Arrested After Blockading Port of Vancouver in Pipeline Protest, Democracy Now!, November 2019

Five Arrested in Port of Vancouver Protest, The Columbian, November 2019

Activists Block Rail Line at the Port of Vancouver To Protest Canadian Pipeline, Oregon Public Broadcasting, October 2019

Learn more about the Mosquito Fleet on our website at www.mosquitofleet.us.

story:
What is Torex?
Toilet Paper with a Moisture Barrier
- The added feature to CURRENT toilet paper keeps hands dry when wiping.
Folding gives you the ability to maximize each square. You can use the same
square just by folding during your trip and still leave your hands dry. It increases
the absorbency of the current toilet paper on the market today. Scrunching is
over and folding is maximized!


- Septic and sewer safe, Torex's added layer acts like leaves in the sewer
system. It is rated safe (ASTM D6400) in most major countries, including the
United States , Canada and Australia.

- Five layers of Torex provide protection and maximize the absorbency of the
toilet paper to which it is added. Each square of Torex paper is equal to two
squares of two-ply basic toilet paper. The average person uses nine squares of
conventional toilet paper per visit. With Torex, we found we use 1 to 2 squares so
equal to 2 to 4 conventional.

- Because Torex confines moisture to a single side of the toilet paper, one side
can be made wet while the other stays dry—serving as an alternative to wet toilet wipes.

Why is our campaign to Upgrade Toilet Paper so important?
Everyday around 27,000 trees worldwide are essentially flushed down the toilet.  Think if we could not only cut that number in half but use farming and yard waste more effectively to reduce our personal waste.  Since Torex can be wetted on one side and used in place of wet toilet wipes, we can potentially end the ragging and blockage problems in sewer systems. The age old question and reason toilet paper was invented was so we didn't have to touch our waste and spread illness. Here I've done just that. No longer needing to gather a large handful of paper, we hope to lower the transmission of disease from those with less than desirable bathroom habits.

What Torex isn't:
- I am not producing toilet paper , this is a new feature in prototype we hope to improve the current toilet paper with on the market . The goal is to license this improvement or find a partner that has the manufacturing ability.

Who is Torex

Elizabeth Elswick, the inventor of the added feature is a stay-at-home mom to three girls and has been married to her husband for 13 years. She enjoys knitting, drinking wine, and obsessing about toilet habits.


Our goal with Torex

The first priority is to finish the patent process. We have filed a provisional patent, but the legal fees, research and prototyping costs to move forward are high. That is where you come in!

Once we have completed the patent process, we will be able to move forward
with licensing.

Risks and challenges:

Toilet paper is still being modified at home. That is why its only offered as a nice sized tester with access to a survey so that you get to see what you have funded. We have other talents to share so we can meet our goals.

To ensure we make this dream a reality so we are keeping goals realistic and simple. We will communicate any delays or setbacks along the way!

What You Get!
You get handmade items by Elizabeth or from people in Elizabeth's community. Check them out!




Thank you!

story:
The Situation

When Pope Francis released his encyclical, On Care of Our Common Home (Laudato Si’), he addressed not just Catholics but all citizens of the world.  He sent out a clarion call to the people of our planet to treat each other and the world we inhabit as gifts from God.

"The entire material universe speaks of God’s love, his boundless affection for us. Soil, water, mountains: everything is, as it were, a caress of God."—Pope Francis, On Care for Our Common Home (Laudato Si')

Most scientists agree that we are approaching a point of no return with climate change, so the time to act is now. The release of the encyclical, Pope Francis’ visit to the United States, and the upcoming United Nations Climate Change Conference are focusing the eyes of the world on this issue and we need to take action.

In spite of the urgency of Pope Francis’ message, his call to a conversion of spirit can be hard to hear over the clamor of modern life. In order to truly effect change, we must take the time to not only read his words but to reflect on them and take them to heart.

The Project

Creation at the Crossroads offers small-group, faith-sharing resources that examine the encyclical through the lens of prayer and Scripture. Created by RENEW International in conjunction with GreenFaith and the Catholic Climate Covenant, it will bring people of faith a conversion of spirit that will lead to greater action to care for our common home and all who inhabit it.

We know that we can make a difference, opening the eyes of Catholics and other people of faith to the significance of this timely issue. While people of faith know the importance of caring for human life, they do not always grasp that caring for all of creation is an integral component of that mission. Our people and our planet are inextricably linked. We cannot truly help one while contributing to the destruction of the other.

This issue is especially important to future generations who will inherit the world we leave behind. With outreach to colleges and high schools, we are working to engage students and young adults, many of whom are already involved in efforts to protect the environment.  Creation at the Crossroads will deepen their commitment and give them a tool to expand their efforts to others in their age group.

Where Will Your Money Go?

Your contributions will help us cover production costs of the book—layout, editing, translation, and printing as well as development of supporting resources to promote this initiative in parishes and campuses. We are committed to reaching as many people as possible with this important message, so the book will be available in both English and Spanish.

Help us change hearts to change the world, preserving our common home for generations to come.

About RENEW

RENEW International is designated as a tax-exempt 501(c)(3) not-for-profit organization under the Internal Revenue Service code.

RENEW International fosters spiritual renewal in the Catholic tradition by empowering individuals and communities to encounter God in everyday life, deepen and share faith, and connect faith with action.

RENEW International has over a 30-year record in revitalizing parish life in more than 150 dioceses in the United States, touching the lives of 25 million people through its ministry services. RENEW International has also reached many thousands outside the United States, having served people in 23 countries, across six continents and in 44 languages and dialects.

See more at: www.renewintl.org/renewearth

story:
Hi there,
I recently started working with the Renewable Community Initiative, a not-for-profit organization dedicated to promoting clean energy practices and to using renewable technologies to benefit local communities. Learn more about us here: renewablecommunity.org

Right now, we are working with the Eastport American Legion to help them go green, reduce their energy costs and allow them to act as an energy-producing community shelter during times of crisis. 
Designs for the first phase of this project, a solar power array, are already complete, but we need your help to raise funds so that we can begin installation. Donations will go directly to Renewable Commmunity for the purposes of this project.

As a reward for contributing to this cause, those who donate will receive a thank you email with a picture of me doing a mundane task, like drinking coffee or replacing the toilet paper roll. Those who contribute a little more will receive a signed photograph of me doing a mundane task. This is an incredible opportunity, as those photographs could be worth hundreds to thousands of dollars down the line, if kept in good condition.

story:
I am a film activist attempting to warn the worldwide community about the danger of the radiation coming from Fukushima. At least 4 nuclear reactors melted into the Pacific Ocean and jet stream in March 2011 but little was done to stop it or alert the people of the Northern hemisphere.  We have seen mutations and a spike in radiation-related deaths and illnesses since the accident. I have made several documentaries about the disaster.  Now I have set upon making a live action dramatic film to get the word out there as to what is really happening in Fukushima.  This is a bold attempt to inform the public from the danger they are not being alerted to by governments and most green groups even.   Please watch the trailer to our film called "The Department" and contribute to the production and distribution of the film.  We are halfway through filming and desperately require funds to finish it.  We have some volunteers but we are surviving on a skeleton crew and sometimes no crew at all.  Your contribution will help pay the actors and crew and get the film seen at film festivals .  I am the director, producer and writer of the film and have already spend thousands of dollars of my own funds to make this film.  We are setting a goal of $10,000.  Please contribute to this film and the health of the environment and to the well being of our kids and future generations.

Thank you for considering our campaign.

Andrew Vincent Tran

story:
We did it! Thank you so much to all the incredible friends, families and strangers who helped us on the way! We are seriously in awe and in honour of your generosity of spirit. Together we are transforming how children learn! Watch for updates, progress and pictures at OutdoorKindergarten.ca! 

Click the gallery tab above to watch all our media interviews, and see pics of senior kindergarten graduation!

We're Canada's first public outdoor kindergarten program, where children play and learn outside, regardless of the weather. In four years, we've established an incredible inquiry education-based program, founded on the work of our phenomenal teachers and our firm belief in the merits of outdoor education. In fact, we're a demonstration classroom where teachers come to from all over the world to learn. But if you've watched our video, you know that our classroom is mostly concrete! Equinox Outdoor Kindergarten needs a naturalized outdoor space–especially as we kick off full-day kindergarten this year.

Our history

Equinox is proud to be Canada's first public outdoor kindergarten and a Toronto District School Board (TDSB*) school. Each year, dozens of teachers from around the region and the world visit to learn more about our pioneering program. Like others who have come to observe this demonstration classroom, they discover an amazing program that reflects a growing body of research proving what many of us intuitively know–children benefit tremendously from learning and playing outdoors.

Our future

Equinox's outdoor kindergarten classroom will be transformed into a magical discovery area, complete with woodland gardens, a water garden, sandbox, miniature streams, stepping stones and a variety of trees.

  • Our first step is removing the concrete and setting the foundation. About $13,000 will be allocated to general site preparation, permits and drainage. 
  • Next we'll be adding the new natural surface, shade coverage and awning. That has been quoted at an estimated $9,000.
  • With the remaining $3,000, we'll start on the installation of native plants, trees and garden features. (Check out our perks for some of the awesome elements you can sponsor!)

If we're fortunate enough to exceed our initial goal, we'll use the additional funds to create a living willow structure and mixed material basket centre, and install a water play area. Building a naturalized educational environment is our way of leaving a green legacy for all of the students to come, and our way to serve as a model for urban schools around the world.

Together we can change the face of education, so that every child can play, learn and grow with nature. And it all starts with you.

Please make a donation–big or small–today. 

NEW PERK!

Plan for the happiest kid come September with the coolest lunch box on the schoolyard! We love that they're PVC, phthalate and BPA-free with a removable leak-proof insulated lining; little ones will love the big-kid messenger and backpack straps. Hurry! You can choose any colour, but quantities are limited!

HOW CUTE WOULD YOUR LITTLE ONE LOOK IN THESE?

Donate now to claim a pair of the world's best PJs, made right here in Canada by OM home. And of course you'll receive an exclusive video from the kids thanking you for your help building the new classroom. Hurry! Quantities are limited for this exclusive perk.

All perks will be fulfilled following the close of the campaign. Contributors who make a $100 or $500 donation will then be contacted to submit the name they would like to be engraved.

*Equinox Outdoor Kindergarten Committee does not reflect the views or opinions of the TDSB. If you have more questions, feedback, or other suggestions of how you can help, we'd love to hear from you.

We thank all of our generous supporters for their time and contributions.

FAQ

Does Equinox Outdoor Public Kindergarten follows the Ontario curriculum?

Yes, the Outdoor Kindergarten is part of the Toronto District School Board (TDSB) and follows all curriculum requirements, including those for early literacy and math. The inquiry-based educational model followed focuses on natural curiousity and nature as the springboard for all learning, and the importance of oral narrative and storytelling tradition. 

Do the children really go outside all winter?

Yes! Unless it's a severe weather condition, the children are outside. The key is to dress appropriately and keep moving. Of course, on the coldest days it's difficult for little hands to eat, and we come inside for snack time, rest, and other activities. The teachers respond to the needs of the children, and the transition to full-day in the fall will accomodate and indoor, early afternoon rest period.

story:
Effective Microorganisms (EM)  - MAKING ORGANIC EASY

Every year millions of pounds of insecticides, fungicides, fertilizers and chemicals are poured into our environment as a way to help grow our food.  Much of these chemicals end up not only in our food, but in us and in our waterways and soil.  

What if there was a way to grow our food and get better results without all of these chemicals?   There is!  It's called EM farming!

EM technology is the most advanced agricultural system used to grow bigger and healthier plants and to maximize yields.   Amazingly, EM does this in an organic way that is safe -- even a child could handle EM.  EM uses scientifically-proven techniques that blend beneficial microorganisms in a way that enhances the natural microbiology found in both our water and our soil.  That is when the magic happens!


[Pictured above are candy onions grown with EM.]

For one-tenth the cost of conventional chemical farming, the beneficial microbes in EM allow the nutrients in the soil to be more available to the plant, creating optimal conditions for healthy plant growth.

EM, which stands for Effective Microorganisms, is a live liquid microbial formula that is easy to apply, which gives you great results quickly and is easy on the pocket.

This Indiegogo campaign is not just about raising money for our fork lift and water processing equipment for the first EM manufacturing facility on the East Coast.  It is also about sharing information about EM with all of you.  Our environment is in trouble and we can't keep doing what we have been doing year after year.  It is time to use EM as a tool to grow our food, repair the soil and repair the earth! This is true farming for the future, true sustainability.

When we open our facility this spring, EM will be more available to people on the East Coast with lower shipping costs.  Also we will be selling activated EM which will also bring costs down. 


For the farmer and the gardener, EM provides for healthier plants. When you have a healthier plant, it is far less likely to attract insects. Also, a healthier plant is more resistant to problems with the weather. For you, this means much less frustration, and greater success for your hard work.

Click here to see tomatoes without disease grown with EM

Why buy EM?

Buy EM because you will get the best results for your crops, gardening, landscaping or other agricultural projects AND you won't be pouring tons of chemicals into the environment.  That is better for us and all the critters in the environment, the bees , the birds, the frogs, the butterflies, the entire soil food web!  We are all in this together!

Here are more of the many features and benefits you get with EM:

  1. Improves crop quality and yield
  2. Is certified organic
  3. Is safe to use; non-toxic, you can even drink EM it is so safe, or brush your teeth  with it!
  4. Is non-GMO
  5. Improves plant root development
  6. Increases beneficial microbial activity in the soil
  7. Gets plants off to a quick start.
  8. Makes it possible for plants to absorb more nutrition from the soil
  9. Creates vitamins, anti-oxidants, and enzymes that are used by the plant
  10. Builds up organic matter quickly in the soil
  11. Promotes soil formation and structure
  12. Improves the porous quality of the soil; when the soil is more porous it uses water more efficiently

And if those benefits are not enough, here are a few more reasons why EM is a game changer:

  • It composts organic matter in a quarter of the time
  • Clears out the drip tape for longer lasting use
  • Breaks down ammonia into ammonium. What does this mean? It turns the nitrogen in the soil into a slow release fertilizer that is more absorb-able by the plant and is less volatile.

Watch how composting is done.

How Can EM be of assistance to me?

Would you like to save money by growing healthier crops in a more sustainable way?

Would you like to be a happier farmer, with less worry, and more money in your pocket

Our farmer in Southern Maryland talks about how EM has helped him through the growing season.


[Plant Roots Without EM]

[Plant Roots With EM]

Do you want to grow a plant that provides more nutrition for your family?

Do you want to get your plants off to a quick start?

EM technology works with all plants. An EM program can help you with any crop, plant or soil issues you may have. Join the EM Revolution and lets change the way food is grown here in America.  The time for EM farming is now!

EM attracts beneficial insects!

Even MORE Uses for EM 

  • EM also works with animal waste: it reduces odor from animal waste; helps compost animal waste quickly; it converts animal waste into soil more quickly and easily.
  • EM is safe for animals to drink. It increases their grow out weights and promotes good animal health, including better feed conversion.
  • EM is an anti-oxidant, which prevents the rusting of equipment.
  • EM digests septic waste, and helps maintain your septic system at a lower cost
  • EM cleans water by dissolving concentrated wastes and nutrients; it increases the oxygen in water.

History of EM

EM, which stands for Effective Microorganisms, was invented by Dr. Teruo Higa, a professor of horticulture from Okinawa, Japan. Dr. Higa invented EM over a 20 year period. EM finally came to market in the 1980s. It is now used in over 130 countries around the world, for crop production, odor control, septic maintenance, water and soil remediation, wastewater treatment and people and animal health.

Bio:

Linda Miyoshi is the East Coast sales representative for Teraganix, LLC, the sole distributor for authentic EM products in the US and Canada. She has a degree in agronomy. As well, she has a broad background in health from being a nurse to a practicing acupuncturist and herbalist. Since 2009 she has been working with farmers to help them incorporate EM technology into their agricultural programs with great success. She is in the process of opening up the first manufacturing facility for EM on the East Coast to make Effective Microorganisms more readily available to farmers and gardeners as well as others who wish to contribute to a healthier environment.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Chris Alford, I have lived in nineteen states. Including military service and my mother chasing a career and the Bush administrations ( all three of them) have influenced me because of economic downturns. In 1988, I dropped out of college due to Reaganomics.  

The environmental issues that created the need for my project can be summed up as:

  • February 2011, The Fukushima nuclear power plant Tsunami
  • The Joplin, Missouri F5 Tornado devastating a town that was dear to me.  
  • Record high gas prices for the month of February 2011. 

These elements combined brought fear into me that global warming was real and an immediate threat to our way of life. All life on earth is affected by the climate disaster.  

What We Need & What You Get

We need $500,000, which we need donated. What's in it for you?
  • Donate $50: get a signed paper copy of my original provisional patent 
  • Donate $100: T-shirt signed by me of a photo of the first installation of the tower.
  • Donate $500: a signed poster of my initial provisional patent
  • Donate $1,500: A bronze Plaque per installation in the donors name on the tower itself. A video dedication signed by me of the dedication ceremony.
If we do not reach our goal your money will be refunded to you. 

The Impact

50% of all new energy installations built in 2013 worldwide were green renewable sustainable types of energy. 

  • America needs to take the lead in green energy
  • Fossil Fuel concerns have corrupted our nations political systems in pursuit of their next dollar. We cannot allow our nations future to be dictated by anyone so short sighted. 
  • This project will cut out the need for Fossil Fuels and give the world a new source of energy to look at. This will enable to ecosystem to repair itself.

Risks & Challenges

My greatest intent is to build a worker owned corporation. 

  • My greatest intent is to build a worker owned corporation. 
  • The economic power of big fossil fuel using corporation has created an economic inequity. This economic model would ensure prosperity and equanimity for all.
  • Having eleven different disabilities; proving that I can do this will show the world that all disabled people deserve equal treatment,   

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that you may not be able to contribute, there are other ways you can help:

  • View my videos on youtube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=93sk1HyxFSA
  • Like me on Facebook: repsuc@yahoo.com 
  • Follow me on Twitter: ChrisAlford17
  • Share my project with your friends and family.

Thank you for your time and support for my Chimney Flue Tower.
story_txt:
Short Summary My name is Chris Alford, I have lived in nineteen states. Including military service and my mother chasing a career and the Bush administrations ( all three of them) have influenced me because of economic downturns. In 1988, I dropped out of college due to Reaganomics.  
The environmental issues that created the need for my project can be summed up as:  February 2011, The Fukushima nuclear power plant Tsunami The Joplin, Missouri F5 Tornado devastating a town that was dear to me.   Record high gas prices for the month of February 2011.   These elements combined brought fear into me that global warming was real and an immediate threat to our way of life. All life on earth is affected by the climate disaster.     What We Need & What You Get
We need $500,000, which we need donated. What's in it for you?

Donate $50: get a signed paper copy of my original provisional patent 
Donate $100: T-shirt signed by me of a photo of the first installation of the tower. Donate $500: a signed poster of my initial provisional patent Donate $1,500: A bronze Plaque per installation in the donors name on the tower itself. A video dedication signed by me of the dedication ceremony. 
If we do not reach our goal your money will be refunded to you.    The Impact 50% of all new energy installations built in 2013 worldwide were green renewable sustainable types of energy.   America needs to take the lead in green energy Fossil Fuel concerns have corrupted our nations political systems in pursuit of their next dollar. We cannot allow our nations future to be dictated by anyone so short sighted.  This project will cut out the need for Fossil Fuels and give the world a new source of energy to look at. This will enable to ecosystem to repair itself.    Risks & Challenges My greatest intent is to build a worker owned corporation.

story:
Our project involves providing training facilities to the farmers in Pang village in the Parbat district of Nepal, and start farming of Jatropha curcas (Jatropha), a plant capable of yielding biofuel bearing seeds. We intend to achieve sustainable independent economic resource for unemployed manpower in the locality by  employing five local manpower in production of Jatropha seeds, and eventually motivate entrepreneurship in the locality to meet the current energy and fuel demands.

Through our work, we are addressing two of the main 21st century issues – demand/need of sustainable energy and unemployment. In the first 11 months of fiscal year 2010-11, Nepal imported petroleum products worth 683.95 million USD Rupees. Meanwhile Nepal also recorded a total export of 583.40 million USD (AEPC Nepal). Jatropha will become an alternative solution to meet the immediate need and demand of fuel in Nepal.

As the unemployment rate of Nepal is 47% (World bank), we will work to minimize it by hiring unemployed people. Parbat is one of the growing districts in Nepal. Therefore, it is vital to shape the population of the place so they are economically independent and are earning a sustainable living. Majority Nepalese population’s livelihood is agro-based, and Jatropha farming would be an ideal form of income generation. Initially, we will be targeting a community of Pang village in the Parbat district of Nepal.

Starting January 3rd of 2015, we want to start our foundation with locating a 5 acre land in Pang village owned by the local public school. Ideally, we would like to start at a venue with access to transportation to expedite material transportation.

Next, we would like to employ 5 locals who have been in search of work. Instead of migrating away from their hometown, we will offer those employed locals an alternative to stay and earn a living.

Simultaneously, with the help of experienced Jatropha organization from capital Kathmandu, we want to initiate planting seeds. We would be inviting volunteers from such organization to train employed locals on planting and growing of Jatropha plants. An average Jatropha plant takes specific periods to yield seeds and grow. We would need proper care from the employed locals during this time. Locals will be trained on how to look after the plant and learn about the plant.

After seeding, we plan to sell off the seeds to biofuel organizations in the capital Kathmandu. With the revenue collected, we plan to further invest on the plot of the land we already possess and facilitate the growing of existing Jatropha plant. Similarly, the revenue collected by selling the seeds will be used for the further development of the school's infrastructure. Upon the analysis of the work at the end of the first year, we will extend it in other communities as well, hence employing and empowering more unemployed persons.

The list of resources we need for our project are:

1.  Jatropha Seeds $300

2.  Travel expenses in Nepal $200

3.  Expenses for food and other resources during training at Pang $150

4.  Expences for Training facilities $150

5.  Miscellaneous expenses $100

6.  Total expenses: $ 900

As our project mainly includes planting jatropha, we will need around $300 to buy those jatropha seeds. Similarly, another important part of our project is getting training by collaborating with different organizations and then training the local villagers to plant Jatropha in a scientific way. As the project is going to be held in Pang, Parbat, we have to go there and stay in the field for ten days. Likewise, we need to transport seeds and other required material with us to the village, which adds us some cost. During the stay, we need some funding for our food and accommodation as well.

story:
Location:

Located just north of "Sinharaja" World Heritage Rainforest which is the last virgin Rainforest left in Sri Lanka, this 15 acre Rainforest acts as an important bio-diversity corridor between Sinharaja and the smaller Delwala Rainforest to the north. The region is habitat to more than half of the native flora and fauna of Sri Lanka and is a natural wonder and a bio-diversity hotspot. Once extending throughout the Wet-zone of Sri Lanka, the Rainforests are now just a fraction of its former range.


Who We Are:

We, Rainforest Protectors of Sri Lanka (RPSL), is a volunteer environmental organization registered under the Central Environmental Authority with a mission to protect the last remaining Rainforests of Sri Lanka.  We engage the people of Sri Lanka to protect the Rainforests through various initiatives such as native tree planting projects, education and awareness among villagers, and curbing deforestation through jointly working with law-enforcement officers.


Project:

Many unprotected lands surrounding Sinharaja Rainforest that were once part of a bigger Rainforest complex a few centuries ago are currently being sold and converted to Tea and Palm Oil plantations. These lands still contain virgin Rainforest millions of years old, but they are now at the mercy of new landowners who take no time to clear-cut the rainforest. 

Therefore, we have embarked on an ambitious project to purchase and protect these last Rainforests in private hands and to create bio-diversity corridors between the surrounding fragmented rainforests and the Sinharaja World Heritage Rainforest. 

Once created, the bio-diversity corridors will help promote genetic diversity by facilitating the movement of endangered wildlife, such as the Purple Faced Leaf Monkey, Sri Lanka Leopard, Barking Deer and many bird, amphibian and reptile species. 

Rainforest Protectors of Sri Lanka has identified suitable forested land for this project and constantly monitors availability of new land suitable for the bio-diversity corridor. Land will be purchased under a Trust for permanent protection of the flora and fauna.


Below is a satellite map of the Sinharaja World Heritage Rainforest (at the bottom) and fragmented Rainforest patches that have been clear-cut to the north. Currently a 15 acre virgin Rainforest on sale in the area "Fragmented Rainforest" is available for US$ 35,000 (see above photo). We are urgently raising funds to protect this beautiful rainforest from destruction as there have been offers to clear-cut the rainforest to grow tea. We are negotiating with the owner to buy and protect the land and will need to raise required funds before end of January. It would be a great loss if these Rainforests that are millions of years old and contain unknown species to science are destroyed.

https://www.google.com/maps/place/Sinharaja+Forest+Reserve/@6.4412231,80.4368765,30310m/data=!3m1!1e3!4m2!3m1!1s0x3ae3e76bd109d45f:0x8c0ef1010649701b


The Impact:

  • 100% of your donation will go directly towards purchasing and protecting the 15 acre Rainforest currently on sale
  • If we fail to raise needed funds to purchase the currently available land on time, collected funds will be used to purchase land in the future towards the same project in the region.
  • Creation of the bio-diversity corridors will be critical to the long-term sustainability of Sinharaja Wolrd Heritage Rainforest and will ensure safe passage to its inhabiting wildlife.

Sri Lanka Blue Magpie - Endangered Bird whose only home is Sinharaja Rainforest


Red Faced Malkoha - Endangered Bird whose only home is Sinharaja Rainforest


More Details:

To learn more about Rainforest Protectors and our projects, please visit our website below. Please share our website / Facebook page with your friends and help us protect the beautiful rainforests of Sri Lanka.
http://www.RainforestProtectors.org

story:
Un manual ilustrado con información completa sobre producción y conservación de semillas. Ayúdanos a imprimirlo y hacer que este valioso material llegue al mayor número de comunidades rurales, y así puedan continuar transmitiendo los conocimientos de nuestros ancestros.

An illustrated seed saving manual designed to share these skills to all. Help us print it so that this valuable material may reach thousands.

SOMOS SEMILLA es una Biblioteca Comunitaria de Semillas localizada en San Miguel de Allende, México que desde 2015 brinda acceso a semillas de variedades de cultivo de polinización abierta y adaptadas a condiciones locales a la comunidad. El amor por las semillas es el punto de unión entre la bióloga Sole Saburido, la artista visual Emily C-D y la agroecóloga Jenn Ungemach.

Juntas hemos dado vida a este manual, en colaboración con Ricardo Romero, Supervisor de Impacto de Programas de la ONG Sustainable Harvest International (SHI), que proporciona herramientas y asesoría técnica a familias campesinas centroamericanas. Ambas organizaciones apoyan el movimiento de Regeneración Internacional.

ABOUT US: SOMOS SEMILLA is a Community Seed Library located in San Miguel de Allende, Mexico, providing the community with open pollinated seeds adapted to local conditions since 2015. The love of seeds brings together biologist Sole Saburido,visual artist Emily C-D and agroecologist Jenn Ungemach. We created this manual in collaboration with Ricardo Romero, Program Impact Manager of the non-profit Sustainable Harvest International (SHI), which provides tools and technical advice to Central American farming families. Both organizations support the Regeneration International movement.

Gracias al incentivo inicial donado por SHI, hemos creado CULTIVA-COSECHA-COMPARTE: SEMILLAS PARA TODOS, un libro de 60 páginas con ilustraciones exclusivas realizadas en acuarela y con una gran rigurosidad botánica. Con esta campaña de financiamiento colectivo, solicitamos tu colaboración para alcanzar la cifra de $3,000 US ($50,000 MXN) que serán destinados a terminar el manual, una primera impresión de 1000 ejemplares y a sesiones educativas sobre conservación de semillas en San Miguel de Allende, utilizando el manual como material de apoyo. SHI ya se ha comprometido a trabajar con sus comunidades con este manual, asegurando que los manuales impresos serán utilizados por los productores de semillas y organizaciones de toda Centroamérica para crear bibliotecas de semillas.

OUR NEEDS: We created GROW-HARVEST-SHARE: SEEDS FOR EVERYONE, a 60-page book with botanically correct watercolor illustrations painted especially for this manual, with seed funding from SHI. We are seeking crowdfunding for $3,000 US ($50,000 MXN) for the completion of the manual, a first large order printing of 1000 copies and seed saving education in conjunction with the manual in San Miguel de Allende. SHI has already committed to work with their communities with this manual, thereby assuring these printed manuals will be used by seedsavers and organizations throughout Central America to create seed libraries.

El manual será impreso offset, a todo color, en un tamaño de media carta (14x21.5 cm), encuadernación rústica, con papel producido bajo normas de sustentabilidad y con materiales y mano de obra 100% mexicana. El texto va acompañado de tablas didácticas, ilustraciones explicativas, y 13 láminas de cultivos comunes en los huertos del todo el territorio Americano con fichas técnicas sobre producción, propagación, y conservación de semillas.

The manual will be printed in full color offset, 5.5x11 in, softcover, with paper produced under sustainability standards, 100% made in Mexico. The text is accompanied by tables, explanatory illustrations, and 13 full page botanical prints of common REGIONAL crops accompanied by technical data on seed production, propagation, and seed saving.

SOMOS SEMILLA ha operado durante dos años con un presupuesto reducido para distribuir cientos de variedades de semillas en la región a cientos de individuos y familias. A finales de 2015 "The Pollination Project: Seed Grants For Projects That Change the World” reconoció nuestra labor, y ahora nuestros esfuerzos están encaminados a apoyar el movimiento de conservación de semillas mediante la creación de materiales didácticos en español, muy necesarios. En marzo de 2017, SOMOS SEMILLA fue parte de la coordinación y organización del primer Encuentro Mexicano de Guardianes de Semillas. La reunión de guardianes durante 3 días reforzó nuestro deseo de llevar a cabo CULTIVA-COSECHA-COMPARTE, ya que nos reunimos con numerosos participantes que buscan información de fácil acceso sobre la conservación de semillas en español.

SOMOS SEMILLA has operated for two years on a shoestring budget to distribute hundreds of seed varieties in the region to hundreds of individuals and families. Recognized in 2015 by "The Pollination Project: Seed Grants For Projects That Change the World”, we now look to support the seedsaving movement by the creation of much-needed materials in Spanish. In March 2017, SOMOS SEMILLA was part of the coordination and organization of the first Mexican Meeting of Seedsavers. The 3-day gathering of seedsavers reinforced our desire to bring GROW-HARVEST-SHARE to life as we met with numerous participants looking to easily accessible information about seed conservation in Spanish.

La conservación de semillas es una práctica que ha acompañado a los seres humanos durante miles de años. Este arte que ha sido transmitido de generación en generación a lo largo de la historia, se ha debilitado en el siglo pasado por el énfasis de los gobiernos y las corporaciones en que la conservación de semillas requiere habilidades técnicas únicas que deberían estar en manos de unos pocos. Pero la realidad es que la conservación de semillas, si bien requiere de habilidades únicas, éstas pueden ser adquiridas por cualquier persona. Necesitamos tu ayuda para difundir estas habilidades, inspirando a más personas a desarrollar el amor por la conservación de semillas a través del arte. Existe una gran necesidad de materiales en español completos, con explicaciones que sean fáciles de seguir y llevar a cabo. Tu participación en nuestro proyecto significa que podremos distribuir gratuitamente hasta 500 de estos manuales a nuestros compañeros de SHI, mientras vendemos parte de las impresiones para autofinanciar nuestra Biblioteca Comunitaria de Semillas.

WHY DO WE NEED YOUR HELP? Seed saving is a practice that has accompanied human beings for thousands of years. Historically passed down generation to generation, the seedsaving tradition has been weakened in the past century by the emphasis by governments and corporations that seed conservation requires unique technical skills that should be in the hands of the few. Seedsaving does require unique skills- ones that ANYONE learn. We need your help to spread these skills. We need your help to inspire through art the love of seedsaving. Materials are desperately needed in Spanish that are easy to follow and carry out. Your buy-in to our work now means we can distribute up to 500 of these manuals free of charge to our partners at SHI while self-funding our local community seed library with sales of part of the overall printing.

Si no podemos conseguir la cantidad total que solicitamos, primero priorizaremos los costos de impresión sobre los fondos para las sesiones educativas. ¡Somos conocidos por nuestra creatividad para trabajar con un presupuesto limitado y continuaremos haciéndolo! Si no se alcanza el financiamiento total para la impresión, lo complementaremos con préstamos de miembros de la comunidad que serán reembolsados ​​con las ventas futuras del manual. Y si alcanzamos una cantidad mayor a nuestro objetivo, podremos aumentar el número de copias que se imprimirán.

If we are unable to raise the complete amount, we will first prioritize printing costs over the funds for educational outreach. We are known for our creativity in operating on a limited budget and will continue to do so! If the total funding for the printing is not reached, we will complement it with loans from community members that will be repaid with future sales of the manual. And, if we raise beyond our goal, we will be able to increase the number of copies to be printed.

La mejor forma de colaborar con el proyecto es ayudarnos a correr la voz y difundir la palabra. Por favor, comparte la campaña SEMILLAS PARA TODOS con familia y amigos. Visita nuestra página web y síguenos en Facebook. Conoce también la labor de nuestros compañeros de SHI, visita su página web. ¡Gracias por tu apoyo! Este esfuerzo está dedicado a los guardianes de semillas que siempre creen en un futuro mejor.

OTHER WAYS TO HELP? The best way to collaborate with the project is to help us spread the word. Please share the SEEDS FOR EVERYONE campaign with your friends and family! Visit our website and follow us on Facebook. Check out our the work realized by our partners at SHI. Thank you for your support! This effort is dedicated to the seed guardians who always believe in a better future.

La reunión de guardianes durante 3 días reforzó nuestro deseo de llevar a cabo CULTIVA-COSECHA-COMPARTE, ya que nos reunimos con numerosos participantes que buscan información de fácil acceso sobre la conservación de semillas en español.SOMOS SEMILLA has operated for two years on a shoestring budget to distribute hundreds of seed varieties in the region to hundreds of individuals and families. Recognized in 2015 by "The Pollination Project: Seed Grants For Projects That Change the World”, we now look to support the seedsaving movement by the creation of much-needed materials in Spanish. In March 2017, SOMOS SEMILLA was part of the coordination and organization of the first Mexican Meeting of Seedsavers. The 3-day gathering of seedsavers reinforced our desire to bring GROW-HARVEST-SHARE to life as we met with numerous participants looking to easily accessible information about seed conservation in Spanish.La conservación de semillas es una práctica que ha acompañado a los seres humanos durante miles de años. Este arte que ha sido transmitido de generación en generación a lo largo de la historia, se ha debilitado en el siglo pasado por el énfasis de los gobiernos y las corporaciones en que la conservación de semillas requiere habilidades técnicas únicas que deberían estar en manos de unos pocos. Pero la realidad es que la conservación de semillas, si bien requiere de habilidades únicas, éstas pueden ser adquiridas por cualquier persona. Necesitamos tu ayuda para difundir estas habilidades, inspirando a más personas a desarrollar el amor por la conservación de semillas a través del arte. Existe una gran necesidad de materiales en español completos, con explicaciones que sean fáciles de seguir y llevar a cabo. Tu participación en nuestro proyecto significa que podremos distribuir gratuitamente hasta 500 de estos manuales a nuestros compañeros de SHI, mientras vendemos parte de las impresiones para autofinanciar nuestra Biblioteca Comunitaria de Semillas.WHY DO WE NEED YOUR HELP? Seed saving is a practice that has accompanied human beings for thousands of years. Historically passed down generation to generation, the seedsaving tradition has been weakened in the past century by the emphasis by governments and corporations that seed conservation requires unique technical skills that should be in the hands of the few. Seedsaving does require unique skills- ones that ANYONE learn. We need your help to spread these skills. We need your help to inspire through art the love of seedsaving. Materials are desperately needed in Spanish that are easy to follow and carry out. Your buy-in to our work now means we can distribute up to 500 of these manuals free of charge to our partners at SHI while self-funding our local community seed library with sales of part of the overall printing. Si no podemos conseguir la cantidad total que solicitamos, primero priorizaremos los costos de impresión sobre los fondos para las sesiones educativas. ¡Somos conocidos por nuestra creatividad para trabajar con un presupuesto limitado y continuaremos haciéndolo! Si no se alcanza el financiamiento total para la impresión, lo complementaremos con préstamos de miembros de la comunidad que serán reembolsados ​​con las ventas futuras del manual. Y si alcanzamos una cantidad mayor a nuestro objetivo, podremos aumentar el número de copias que se imprimirán.If we are unable to raise the complete amount, we will first prioritize printing costs over the funds for educational outreach. We are known for our creativity in operating on a limited budget and will continue to do so! If the total funding for the printing is not reached, we will complement it with loans from community members that will be repaid with future sales of the manual. And, if we raise beyond our goal, we will be able to increase the number of copies to be printed. La mejor forma de colaborar con el proyecto es ayudarnos a correr la voz y difundir la palabra. Por favor, comparte la campaña SEMILLAS PARA TODOS con familia y amigos. Visita nuestra página web y síguenos en Facebook. Conoce también la labor de nuestros compañeros de SHI, visita su página web. ¡Gracias por tu apoyo! Este esfuerzo está dedicado a los guardianes de semillas que siempre creen en un futuro mejor.OTHER WAYS TO HELP? The best way to collaborate with the project is to help us spread the word. Please share the SEEDS FOR EVERYONE campaign with your friends and family! Visit our website and follow us on Facebook. Check out our the work realized by our partners at SHI. Thank you for your support! This effort is dedicated to the seed guardians who always believe in a better future.
campaign_city: San Miguel de Allende GTO, Mexico

story:
La communauté Facebook Ensemble contre les sables bitumineux, souhaiterait se donner les moyens d’imprimer des affiches et en faire des pancartes pour ses membres lors de la Marche du 21 avril, Jour de la Terre. De même qu’une bannière qui pourrait être utilisée à différentes occasions et de la publicité sur Facebook.

Objectif :

Trouver 100 donneurs de $5.00 et ramasser $500.00 qui sera utilisé de la façon suivante.

Production de 100 pancartes au logo d’Ensemble contre les sables bitumineux. (50 pancartes qui seront distribuées lors de la Marche du 21 avril/ Jour de la Terre + 50 autre, à utilisées ultérieurement.)

+ une bannière au logo de la page Ensemble contre les sables bitumineux.

+ frais de publicité sur Facebook afin d’accroitre le nombre de membres.

En échange de votre reçu de transaction, une pancarte sera remise aux 50 premiers à se présenter à nous lors de la Marche du 21 avril, Jour de la Terre, qui aura lieu à Montréal (Place des Festivals, Métro Place des Arts).

Nous vous attendrons devant les portes du Complexe Desjardins.

Nous vous attendrons devant les portes du Complexe Desjardins.

story:
Problem

We live in an age where everything from our computers to our disposable water bottles are made of plastic. It is all around us. But how disposable is that water bottle of yours?

Plastic takes hundreds of years to decompose, so despite throwing away that water bottle, it will still be around longer than you will. The current solution is recycling, but even with our best recycling efforts, 91% of plastics still end up in landfills in the US. That's over 29 million tons of plastic every year! In fact, conservative estimates indicate the world disposes of over 73 million tons of plastic in landfills every year.

Landfills across the world are filling up fast and often times more than 20% of the waste in a landfill is plastic. If we continue at this pace, we will need more landfills and where are we going to put them, in your neighborhood?

Image: Alan Levine

 

Plastics are everywhere in landfills!

Solution


PlasTek™ safely breaks down plastic molecules

The solution is a product called PlasTek™. PlasTek™ is an environmentally safe (Our team member Brock can even drink it!...trust us, it's no fruit smoothie) solution developed by Ph.D. chemists that is made from naturally occurring compounds that start decomposing plastics in a matter of months instead of hundreds of years.

As trash is thrown into a landfill, it will be sprayed with PlasTek™. Once the trash is sprayed with PlasTek™, it can be handled as normal and buried in the landfill. PlasTek™ will break the bonds of the plastic which will allow the naturally occurring bacteria in the landfill to digest it in 12-36 months.

Benefits

The first and most obvious benefit is that the plastics will break down at a faster rate and more space will be made available for a landfill. We estimate that we will save the average landfill over 80,000 cubic yards of space annually. This will allow us to increase the lifespan of current landfills, keep new landfills from being built, and keep your neighborhood safe from that horrible odor!

The second benefit is that the accelerated breakdown of plastic will cause an accelerated release of methane. Don’t think of this as a bad thing. All landfills are required to harvest this methane. Over 500 landfills in the United States use this methane from landfills to generate green energy and over 2000 landfills worldwide use this same technique. If you don’t think collecting gas from landfills is productive, landfills in 2009 alone collected over 13 billion kWhrs of electricity from methane gas! 

 

How landfills capture methane for clean energy!

PlasTek™ is expected to increase the amount of methane landfills will capture by 124% -- that's an average of 4.12 megawatts of additional energy per landfill! That's enough energy to power 4,000 homes. According to the EPA, this additional energy reduces carbon dioxide in the atmosphere by 19,480 tons. That's the equivalent of:

PlasTek™ can really help the environment!

Many renewable energy projects are held up by the government and never reach financial stability without heavy government support. Using PlasTek™ is not just environmentally friendly but also financially responsible. After speaking with over 80 landfills, this is not something they will use out of mercy for the environment, but also for the 136% return on their initial investment. In other words, landfills don't loose money using PlasTek™, they make money! PlasTek™ is profitable for landfills and it helps the environment!

PlasTek™ is a double win -- a win for the landfill, and a win for the environment.

Our Goal

Inviroment has won just over $100,000 in cash prizes from business plan competitions, including the Department of Energy's CU CleanTech competition. We need to raise $200,000 total in order to complete testing, including two pilot tests at landfills.

We have two landfills that have given us written permission to perform tests at their locations (Utah and Massachusetts). This is a mandatory test that will allow us to move forward with servicing other landfills. Until this pilot test takes place we will not be able to offer this service to any landfills due to cost and government requirements. After this test has taken place, we will be able to turn every landfill into a power producing and trash digesting machine!

We've raised over $100K, but we need your help to reach $200K!


The Team

The Inviroment team at an international business competition

Can a team of Ph.D. chemists, an entrepreneur, and three students make a difference in the world? We believe we can! With proven science to support our efforts, Inviroment is ready to change the way the world handles waste. We're so close to completing our goal to help the environment, and you can help by supporting us through Indiegogo!


The Rewards

Help save the planet by funding our Indiegogo project. Fund $25 or more, and you'll receive a personalized birthday message like the ones seen above from co-founder Brock Bennion!

Other rewards include:


Larger Images of Rewards

Inviroment Shopping Bag with Logo -- Stylish and Environmentally Conscious!

Inviroment Stainless-steel water bottle -- Hydrate without the plastic!


Inviroment 100% Organic Cotton T-shirt, Front


Inviroment 100% Organic Cotton T-shirt, Back

A 100% bamboo plaque recognizing your efforts to support the environment!

9"x12" (width x height)

40"x10.7" (width x height)

18"x14" (width x height)

40"x6.57" (width x height)

40"x8" (width x height)

Risks and challenges 

We have faced many challenges as we have developed this product, such as raising $100,000 in capital to fund PlasTek™. However, we have a dedicated team that is capable of surmounting the obstacles we foresee on the horizon. Below we have mentioned some of these obstacles.

Pilot Test Organization- We recognize that a large scale pilot test, such as the one we are proposing, is a time-consuming and complicated ordeal. It will take several weeks/months of planning and several months to actually complete the testing and record the data. It will then take a couple of months to analyze the data. We are fully prepared to put in the time necessary to make this test a success, and we have several industry experts and advisers that have committed to help us as well.

Environmental Concerns - PlasTek™ has no anticipated negative effects on the environment. However, one of the reasons why we are on Indiegogo is to raise the funds needed to complete our pilot tests. With these pilot tests on actual landfills, we'll be able to closely monitor any potential hazards. We've already spoken with two experts at the EPA, and they are excited about PlasTek™ and think it will greatly benefit the environment.

Mailing Rewards- Though we hope to send out millions of rewards to our faithful backers, we recognize that this will take up much of our time in the weeks following the conclusion of our Indiegogo campaign. We will be working tirelessly to get those rewards in the mail so you can have those as soon as possible. The estimated date of delivery is only a worst case scenario, and we will work to get those prizes to you even quicker.

story:
Save the Farm (from Drought)!

Every fall, thousands of Burqueños (Albuquerqueans, to non-New Mexicans) come to Rio Grande Community Farm's (RGCF) Maize Maze event for a country farm escape in the middle of the city. The event features corn mazes with environmental education themes, pumpkin patches, and seasonal celebrations.

And it's the farm's biggest annual fundraiser. By a long shot.

In this, the state's third consecutive year of drought, RGCF is coming up short on our corn maze. Literally. With minimal precipitation and no irrigation water, even our drought-resistant corn crop is not growing well.

As our way of saying thanks for 17 years of community support, we want to continue our farm's tradition of fall celebration. But this year, we need a little extra help! We've integrated Fall Festival and Mini-Maze tickets into our perks as a way to jump-start this year's fundraising festivities, which are more ambitious than ever! They include:

  • Sustainability Day (with cool interactive games and learning stations) 
  • Our First-Ever 5K Fun Run
  • The Grand Finale Pumpkin-Palooza Event and Costume Contest!

What We Need & What You Get

  • Rio Grande Community farm needs to raise $25,000 by October 27, 2013
  • These funds will help to finance the farm's 2014 operational expenses, including farm supplies, materials, and maintenance, personnel and programming costs, insurance, and logistical costs. Funds will also help to mitigate drought-related crop loss and help to purchase emergency water rights when necessary.
  • Should we not reach our funding goal, the farm will gratefully use these contributions for imperative farm operating costs.
  • In exchange for your support, we are offering a host of incentives to donors, from bumper stickers and totes to festival tickets, gift certificates, and even hot air balloon rides!

The Impact

RIo Grande Community farm is a 50-acre, non-profit urban farm located in the North Valley of Albuquerque, New Mexico. Our mission, to serve as a model of environmental stewardship, to grow food for the community using sustainable and organic methods, and to educate the community about agriculture and food issues, is served in the following ways:

  • We grow healthy, organic food for local schools, restaurants, and markets.
  • We offer membership and mentorship in a thriving community garden.
  • We maintain an urban wildlife habitat for migrating fauna. 
  • We provide fun and educational farm visits, and specialized workshops for both children and adults. 

With your help, the farm will be able to continue to serve the Albuquerque community in 2014 and beyond.

Other Ways You Can Help

Short on cash? Here are some other great opportunities to participate!

  • Post a link to our campaign on your website, Twitter, or Facebook profile (or e-mail the link directly to your rich uncle).
  • Volunteer to hand out event flyers, or work a 2-hour shift at the event itself.
  • Contribute an item to our silent auction.
  • Ask your employer to sponsor one (or all) of our events by providing funds, products, food and drink, or services, or even hosting a fundraising or promotional event!
  • Contact us at info@riograndefarm.org for more info on how you can help, or fill out this form to get you out to the farm faster!
