story:
13 October 2014 Update

The effort to make a proper 501(c)(3) of the Brechin Heritage Foundation continues, albeit at a snail's pace. We are, to be sure, continuing to move forward. We are incorporated in Florida, have our Board of Director's set up, bank accounts in place and paperwork in place for the IRS. It's just time.

For those who missed the campaign, but still interesting supporting our cause, you can do so by cheque if you would like. Please make your check payable to:

The Brechin Heritage Foundation
P.O. Box 700725
St. Cloud, FL 34770

If you are a member of the nUIaddon.com web site, please be sure to let us know what your user name is on the site so that we can give you free access to the supporter's pages and features.

27 January 2014 Update

With thanks to everyone who has done so much to help us get there, we have done it! We have reached our total funding goal for this leg of our conservation campaign: creating the non-profit. We have everything we need to complete the startup of the 'Brechin Heritage Foundation' and begin the true challenge of raising the funds to purchase this piece of primary rain forest and conserve it.

From this point forward, 100% of all proceeds received (over and above the fixed costs of the perks that are selected) will be dedicated to securing the binding contract on the property. We're on to our stretch goal! We know we won't achieve it in the remaining hours of this campaign, but every dollar we collect now moves us one step closer to that goal.

While we have achieved the primary goal of this specific campaign, we need to raise $300,000 to get a binding contract on the property. That's a tall mountain to climb and we need to start now. Please give and please know that from this point forward, every dollar is going straight toward that singular purchase. There are no salaries to be paid, no expense reports, no bills and no overhead... aside from the cost of your perks, every dollar now goes toward the conservation of this precious resource! Please, if you can, give. Even just $1 makes a difference. Do it.

And, with that, our heartfelt thanks to everyone who has participated in this labor of love. We've come a long way and we're building a dream, one that will make a lasting difference in the world for generations to come. We have you to thank for that. We are humbled by your support.

26 January 2014 Update

More happy news! We have reached our second funding goal of $2000 and now have sufficient funds to make our Federal application for 501(c)(3) status to the IRS. We are so excited to see this dream becoming reality. We cannot thank you enough.

At the time of this writing, we are just 65 hours away from the end of the campaign and just $500 shy of our total funding goal. Every $1 of help matters. Please give if you can.


6 January 2014 Update

We've done it! We have reached our first goal of $1000 and will be kicking off the filing process with the State of Florida and starting the work on our Federal application today. We can't thank everyone enough for your support and encouragement along the way. Thank you, thank you, thank you.

We are now off in pursuit of the second goal of reaching the $2000 mark so we can file our Federal application with the IRS. We're already over half way there and have no doubt we can succeed.

So, again, our sincere appreciation to all who have gotten us this far. We are on the way and we're going to do great things. We have you all to thank for that.


What We Are Doing

eco-geeks.org is the social media face, originally organized in the gamer community, of what we hope will soon be a full-fledged 501(c)(3) non-profit working to crowd fund responsible conservation, scientific research, education and public awareness. It's an idea born of passion for the outdoors and wilderness (eco), with a thirst for scientific knowledge and understanding (geeks), combined with a heritage of public service.

Founded upon a family history and tradition of military and public service, philanthropy, and a deep appreciation of the land, scientific understanding, and education, we are now seeking to build this effort to the next level through the creation of a non-profit organization dedicated to this task: The Brechin Heritage Foundation, Inc.

To that end, we are seeking to raise up to $2500 to help defray the legal, fiscal and bureaucratic costs of establishing a proper 501(c)(3) non-profit corportation through which we can achieve our stated goals. The mission statement for this new foundation is as follows:
  • The Brechin Heritage Foundation, in a continuation of generations of public service and charitable work, is a family run volunteer non-profit committed to intelligent conservation and preservation of threatened ecosystems, the support of scientific research and education surrounding the biodiversity they contain, and the development of public awareness of their intrinsic value through the creation of sustainable and accessible eco-friendly destinations and exploration programs.

In a nutshell, the foundation will be volunteer run in order to maximize the benefit it creates. Unlike most, the Brechin Heritage Foundation is not, and never will be, a cash cow for its founders and board members. We will volunteer our time and donate the office space, equipment and travel it takes to run it. 

We will take no salary. We will file no expense reports. 

We will, instead, give of our time, energy, talent and resources in order to make it a success. Why, after all, should we ask others to donate to the cause if we are unwilling to give fully of ourselves? 

We will provide the sweat equity and the infrastructure.
We ask of you only that you help us make it fiscally possible.


What We Need

Our needs are quite simple... we need to fund the cost of getting the 501(c)(3) incorporated and registered. Both the budget and the goals are very straight forward and modest:
  • Articles of incorporation: $125
  • Florida Secretary of State: $70
  • Federal Application: $500
  • IRS Fee: $850
  • Cost of perks: $750 (estimated)
  • IndieGoGo Overhead: $205 (estimated)

Total Budget: $2500

PLEASE GIVE! Even a $1 donation makes a difference. And, honestly, we would rather see 2500 people give $1 than see just one person give $2500. As much as this effort is about conservation, research and education, it is about awareness. Give what you can and spread the word... just a $1 donation and a few minutes sharing our links on social media and networking with family, friends and associates could reach our modest goal in a few hours.

Anyone, rich or poor, can afford a single dollar... just skip your next can of soda or cup of coffee and take a few seconds to make an enduring difference in the world and our future.



Perks

As an incentive and a thanks for your support, we are offering several perks to contributors. They are all listed at the top right of this page and described in detail below. We have bumper stickers, posters, safari hats, t-shirts and hoodies you can select to help show your support for our goals and to help spread the word. To make a contribution, just click on the perk you would like to receive and follow the bouncing ball. It will only take a moment to complete, your personal information will be safe, and you will make a positive difference. Again, even just $1 will help us reach our goal. Please give.

The donation amounts given for each perk are the minimum amount for that perk. It is the minimum contribution we need to be able to purchase and ship the perk to you and still be able to further the cause. You can choose to contribute more than the minimum mount, if you like, for any of the perks listed... just edit the dollar amount after you have selected the perk you would like to receive and set the amount you care to give. Likewise, you can choose more than one perk... just make a separate contribution for each that you would like to receive. The more you give, the closer to our goal we get.

*** Detailed information about the various perks ***
is provided in the "What You Get" section (below).

Note: we will file the Articles of Incorporation and develop the Federal Application as soon as we have reached the $1000 mark on this fundraiser. As soon as the Articles of Incorporation are filed, it is possible that additional donations from that point forward will be tax deductible. However, at this time, your donations are not tax deductible and there is no guarantee the IRS will either accept the application in the end or backdate eligibility for tax deductions. We will make the submission to the IRS when we reach the $2000 mark on the campaign (presuming the Federal Application is ready). If, and only if, the IRS accepts the application and backdates it to the date of incorporation (which is typical) will donations made after the date of incorporation be deductible. Donations made before the date of incorporation are not, and will not be, tax deductible. Please talk to your financial advisor if you have tax questions about this.


Stretch Goal

100% of any proceeds we raise above and beyond the budgeted goal will be turned over to the foundation and applied toward our principal goal of purchasing between 450 and 2000 acres of Costa Rican primary rain forest for conservation, research, education and exploration. We will be seeking to raise up to $3 million toward that goal in the end.

We have one property in particular and several others in the area targeted for conservation. It is our goal to buy as much of it as we can budget and transfer the land which has not yet been degraded to the Piedras Blancas National Park in Costa Rica for conservation. There is a short video in the "Impact" section (below) that talks about why this kind of conservation of primary rain forest is important. Please... watch it and share it.

Approximately 90 acres of the land situated between the unspoiled primary rain forest and the Golfo Dulce, already degraded as old cocoa and banana plantation and accessible only by boat, will be kept to develop a sustainable, off-grid, eco-lodge in order to support access to the western extent of the Piedras Blancas National Park with facilities for research, study, education and exploration as well as support for an eco-friendly travel destination. We have already retained [SPG] Architects, an architectural firm with a true understanding of sustainable design and development, to help us plan the lodge and develop the design and budget. You can see the initial concept drawings they provided us here (downloadable PDF).


The Impact

Your contribution and support can help us do great things for generations to come. Through your support of eco-geeks.org, and The Brechin Heritage Foundation, you can make a tangible difference in the future by preserving dwindling wilderness spaces, supporting the scientific understanding of the ecosystems they contain, fostering hands on education about these places and furthering public awareness as to their intrinsic value and beauty.

The Brechin Heritage Foundation is not about knee jerk environmentalism, cynical green 'initiatives' cloaking ulterior motives, or global warming alarm-ism, and certainly is not anti-capitalism. We are not political and have no dogs in the endless infighting between entrenched camps across the spectrum of activism. We are not here to rattle cages, make noise or disrupt lives. We are here to quietly achieve positive results.

We are about three very simple things: intelligent and responsible conservation of limited resources, research and education, and public awareness. We have no desire to lock up great expanses of nature and throw away the key. There's little value in that. Rather, we seek to protect eco-systems that are at risk and then support the study and understanding of those eco-systems. But, more than that, we want to make them accessible to the public and to promote appreciation and understanding of their richness, beauty and diversity.

It does no good to take a thing you hold precious, hide it in a box and throw away the key. What is the point of having it? In due time it will be forgotten, its value unrecognized and, eventually, it will be lost, stolen or simply rot away. Who but the keeper remembers, or cares, that this special thing was tucked away? Who, besides the key bearer comprehends either its beauty or its intrinsic value? What becomes of it when the protector moves on? To be appreciated and valued, things must be observable, accessible and attainable or they will inevitably fade away into neglect and abandon.

With that in mind, at present and as already described in the "Stretch Goal" section (above), we are working on our first task: to conserve between 450 and 2000 acres of precious primary rain forest in Costa Rica. A short video about what makes a piece of the rain forest "primary" versus "secondary" and why it is important to conserve primary rain forest can be seen here:



This is not about preventing the native Costa Ricans from using the land. They can. It is about protecting the land against future commercial development while making it accessible for scientific study as well as creating a destination where anyone who cares can experience it first hand. There is very little primary rain forest left in the world and we have little to no understanding of the biodiversity it contains.

So, these are the goals of the Brechin Heritage Foundation that you can help us achieve with your contributions and your support:
  1. to identify at-risk eco-systems that can be responsibly and intelligently conserved
  2. to support scientific inquiry of, and education in, those eco-systems
  3. to make those eco-systems accessible to the public in a sustainable way

How You Can Help


  • Please, make a contribution... even just $1 makes a difference. NO contribution is too small or too large. Every single dollar makes a positive difference and moves us one step closer to realizing the dream.

  • Whether you can give or not, please help us spread the word... share this campaign on your social networks, tell your friends and family, professors, study groups, researchers, blogs, environmental groups, media and so on. The more people you tell, the more exposure we gain and the better our chances of success.

  • Please, follow us on Tumblr, Facebook and Twitter. Share our posts, links and stories and help us make this a reality! Social networking and awareness is at the heart of our success. Keep up with our progress and share our story.

  • We are going to have need of lawyers, accountants, and professionals as we go forward. If you have skills and you're willing to volunteer time and advice to us, please contact us directly. The more volunteer help we can acquire, the more good we can do. It is our goal to try and keep overhead as close to zero as we possibly can and professional services are our biggest overhead expense.

  • We need perks! In the larger scheme, we are seeking to crowd fund the purchase of 450 to 2000 acres of primary rain forest for conservation in our first project. We need incentives to encourage people to give. If you have valuables, arts, crafts, services or goods you would be willing to donate (or offer at a respectable discount) for fund raising, please contact us directly. We can do this once the 501(c)(3) has been established so your donation is tax deductible.


What You Get

We are offering several perks you can use to show off your support for the eco-geeks.org cause. For each perk you can choose to align yourself with The Alliance (order), The Horde (chaos) or remain neutral and we'll ship you the corresponding version of the perk.

NOTE: You can choose more than one perk, or more than one of each perk. Either make a contribution for each perk you want, or multiply the amount of each perk by the number of them you wish to receive. Please be sure to include sizing and alignment information for each in your comments to us.

Sample images and sizing information for each of the perks is given here...

Logo Bumper Sticker

You know your mount needs one of these. Right? Show your support, and your allignment, everywhere you quest with one of our eco-geeks.org bumper stickers!

Fantasy Art Poster



This is a 24"x36" full color glossy print of Arianna Edwards' fantasy art made specifically for eco-geeks. It is limited edition and available nowhere else.

Embroidered Safari Hat



This is a great one-size-fits all safari hat available in black or khaki for the Alliance, the Horde or neutral. It has snap rivets for the brim and air vents. Well made and well suited to your next jungle adventure (or trip to the mall). *note: logo layout may change slightly depending on which firm does the embroidery work

The embroidery sample we have received from the printer is provided here:


Organic Fantasy T



This is our very flattering bamboo t-shirt with the eco-geeks.org logo embroidered on the front-left chest and Arianna Edwards' beautiful fantasy art piece (see 'Fantasy Art Poster' above) printed direct to fabric on the back available in Horde, Alliance and Neutral versions. This is a high quality, soft, attractive, eco-friendly and sustainable way to show your contribution to the cause!

Note: the printer has had to make changes to the logo for the embroidery work on the front of the shirt. See the sample embroidery image for the Safari Hat (above) for the actual embroidery that will be used.

Mens Product Overview: 70% bamboo/30% cotton jersey t-shirt. StretchFlex™ technology. Dry wicking and anti-microbial performance capabilities. Natural inherent properties wick moisture and are naturally anti-bacterial, hypoallergenic and breathable. Rolled neck band with raw edge.

Mens Sizes & Fit: Slim Fit, Tapered through the torso, Creates an illusion of broad shoulders, Fitted,

  • Chest Size (inches)
    S 39" - 41" / M 41" - 43" / L 43" - 45" / XL 45" - 47" / 2XL 47" - 49"

Ladies Product Overview: 57% bamboo lyocell/38% cotton/5% spandex ladies’ jersey t-shirt. StretchFlex™ technology provides comfort and freedom of movement. Natural inherent properties wick moisture and are naturally anti-bacterial, hypoallergenic and breathable. Rolled neck band with raw edge. Contrast color stitching at bottom and sleeve hems.

Ladies Sizes & Fit: Slim Fit, Tapered through the torso, Creates an illusion of broad shoulders, Fitted

  • Chest/Bust (measured 1" below the armhole with garment laying flat)
    XS - 14" / S - 15" / M - 16" / L - 17" / XL - 18" / 2XL - 19"

Drawstring Hoodie



This is our sharp looking hoodie with our baby sloth in pajamas logo embroidered on the front and direct to fabric printing of Arianna Edwards fantasy art (see 'Fantasy Art Poster' above) on the back available in Horde, Alliance and Neutral versions.

Product Overview: Dry-Excel performance fleece polyester knit. Dries quickly for superior comfort and warmth. Bi-color design with inserts, drawstring hood with contrast dry-Excel elite pin-hole micromesh lining. Media pocket with inside hidden cord port. Matching self cuffs and bottom hem. Front pouch pocket. Sizes XXS-XS do not have a drawstring hood.

Sizes & Fit: Size refers to your actual body measurement. When in doubt or if you fall in between sizes, order a size up. Classic Fit, Longer sleeves, Full Cut, Shorter Length

  • Chest Size (inches)
    XS 30" - 32" / S 34" - 36" / M 38" - 40" / L 42" - 44" / XL 46" - 48"
    2XL 50" - 52" / 3XL 54" - 56"
The sample embroidery work for the neutral, Alliance and Horde versions of the hoodie is shown here:



Why Brechin?

Why the "Brechin" Heritage Foundation? The answer to that question is history.

This family is directly descended from John Smith of Brechin, Scotland. Two of his sons, John and Peter Smith, emigrated to the United States in the early 1800s, leaving Scotland as dirt poor laborers and arriving in Boston (eventually settling in Andover, Massachusetts) with little more than their dreams and a willingness to work hard. The brothers created their own success and, then, gave it back in spades. They established a standard of giving and support of learning that endures to this day.

The Brechin Heritage Foundation name is a tip of the hat to the high standard they set through their love of the land, their humble beginnings, their honor, their hard work, their success and their willingness to give of themselves to help others, to conserve, to understand and to support education as a means to offer a better tomorrow for others, boys and girls alike, who would otherwise have never had the opportunity.


Why Heritage?

Our family has deep roots in the history of this country aside from our ties to Brechin outlined above. We have been connected to the history of America from the Mayflower to the present. We have served in the military in every war from the American Revolution through the Civil War, both World Wars, and right down the line from Korea and Vietnam to today's War on Terror. From forgotten and penniless farmers and blacksmiths to storied Generals and leaders, we have lived and breathed the greater ideals of the Founding Fathers.

Love of country, the American dream, intellectual curiosity, charity, freedom and sacrifice mean something to every one of us. In our broader family, today, we have active duty and retired combat veterans, law enforcement, EMTs, registered nurses, volunteers, scientists, researchers, engineers, librarians, publishers, educators and artists. We are a hard working, grounded, inquisitive, creative, caring and giving people.

Compassion and service are in our genes as is ambition, a hunger for learning, and a drive to get things done. We have been born to serve, to protect and are motivated to leave the world a better place than we found it; as we have for generations. It is our intent to continue this long family tradition of service and giving through The Brechin Heritage Foundation. We see this as an opportunity to do great things, make a positive difference while continuing an enduring legacy of smart conservation, scientific curiosity and education.

Genealogy: If you'd like to learn more about our family heritage, by all means Google for Peter D Smith of Andover, Massachussettes. We are also directly descended from Brigadier General Marlborough Churchill with distant relationships to Winston Churchill and General George B McClellan. You will find our family tied to Scientific American Magazine via Gerard and Jon Piel and a great deal more for those curious enough to explore our history. It's a fascinating and storied family tree for those who are intrigued by such things.


With thanks to those who have gotten us this far...

13 October 2014 UpdateThe effort to make a proper 501(c)(3) of the Brechin Heritage Foundation continues, albeit at a snail's pace. We are, to be sure, continuing to move forward. We are incorporated in Florida, have our Board of Director's set up, bank accounts in place and paperwork in place for the IRS. It's just time.For those who missed the campaign, but still interesting supporting our cause, you can do so by cheque if you would like. Please make your check payable to:The Brechin Heritage FoundationP.O. Box 700725St. Cloud, FL 34770If you are a member of the nUIaddon.com web site, please be sure to let us know what your user name is on the site so that we can give you free access to the supporter's pages and features.27 January 2014 UpdateWith thanks to everyone who has done so much to help us get there, we have done it! We have reached our total funding goal for this leg of our conservation campaign: creating the non-profit. We have everything we need to complete the startup of the 'Brechin Heritage Foundation' and begin the true challenge of raising the funds to purchase this piece of primary rain forest and conserve it.From this point forward, 100% of all proceeds received (over and above the fixed costs of the perks that are selected) will be dedicated to securing the binding contract on the property. We're on to our stretch goal! We know we won't achieve it in the remaining hours of this campaign, but every dollar we collect now moves us one step closer to that goal.While we have achieved the primary goal of this specific campaign, we need to raise $300,000 to get a binding contract on the property. That's a tall mountain to climb and we need to start now. Please give and please know that from this point forward, every dollar is going straight toward that singular purchase. There are no salaries to be paid, no expense reports, no bills and no overhead... aside from the cost of your perks, every dollar now goes toward the conservation of this precious resource! Please, if you can, give. Even just $1 makes a difference. Do it.And, with that, our heartfelt thanks to everyone who has participated in this labor of love. We've come a long way and we're building a dream, one that will make a lasting difference in the world for generations to come. We have you to thank for that. We are humbled by your support.26 January 2014 Update
More happy news! We have reached our second funding goal of $2000 and now have sufficient funds to make our Federal application for 501(c)(3) status to the IRS. We are so excited to see this dream becoming reality. We cannot thank you enough.At the time of this writing, we are just 65 hours away from the end of the campaign and just $500 shy of our total funding goal. Every $1 of help matters. Please give if you can.6 January 2014 UpdateWe've done 
it! We have reached our first goal of $1000 and will be kicking off the 
filing process with the State of Florida and starting the work on our 
Federal application today. We can't thank everyone enough for your support and encouragement 
along the way. Thank you, thank you, thank you.We are now off in
 pursuit of the second goal of reaching the $2000 mark so we can file 
our Federal application with the IRS. We're already over half way there 
and have no doubt we can succeed. So, again, our sincere 
appreciation to all who have gotten us this far. We are on the way and 
we're going to do great things. We have you all to thank for that.What We Are Doingeco-geeks.org is the social media face, originally organized in the gamer community, of what we hope will soon be a

conservation, scientific research, education and public awareness. It's

 heritage of public service. Founded upon a family history and tradition of

organization dedicated to this task: The Brechin Heritage Foundation, Inc.To that end, we are seeking to raise up to $2500 to help defray the legal, fiscal and bureaucratic costs of establishing a proper 501(c)(3) non-profit corportation through which we can achieve our stated goals. Why the "Brechin" Heritage Foundation? The answer to that question is history.
This family is directly descended from John Smith of Brechin, Scotland. Two of his sons, John and Peter Smith, emigrated to the United States in the early 1800s, leaving Scotland as dirt poor laborers and arriving in Boston (eventually settling in Andover, Massachusetts) with little more than their dreams and a willingness to work hard. The brothers created their own success and, then, gave it back in spades. They established a standard of giving and support of learning that endures to this day.
The Brechin Heritage Foundation name is a tip of the hat to the high standard they set through their love of the land, their humble beginnings, their honor, their hard work, their success and their willingness to give of themselves to help others, to conserve, to understand and to support education as a means to offer a better tomorrow for others, boys and girls alike, who would otherwise have never had the opportunity.
Why Heritage?
Our family has deep roots in the history of this country aside from our ties to Brechin outlined above. We have been connected to the history of America from the Mayflower to the present. We have served in the military in every war from the American Revolution through the Civil War, both World Wars, and right down the line from Korea and Vietnam to today's War on Terror. From forgotten and penniless farmers and blacksmiths to storied Generals and leaders, we have lived and breathed the greater ideals of the Founding Fathers.
Love of country, the American dream, intellectual curiosity, charity, freedom and sacrifice mean something to every one of us. In our broader family, today, we have active duty and retired combat veterans, law enforcement, EMTs, registered nurses, volunteers, scientists, researchers, engineers, librarians, publishers, educators and artists. We are a hard working, grounded, inquisitive, creative, caring and giving people.
Compassion and service are in our genes as is ambition, a hunger for learning, and a drive to get things done. We have been born to serve, to protect and are motivated to leave the world a better place than we found it; as we have for generations. It is our intent to continue this long family tradition of service and giving through The Brechin Heritage Foundation. We see this as an opportunity to do great things, make a positive difference while continuing an enduring legacy of smart conservation, scientific curiosity and education.
Genealogy: If you'd like to learn more about our family heritage, by all means Google for Peter D Smith of Andover, Massachussettes. We are also directly descended from Brigadier General Marlborough Churchill with distant relationships to Winston Churchill and General George B McClellan. You will find our family tied to Scientific American Magazine via Gerard and Jon Piel and a great deal more for those curious enough to explore our history.
